loans.name: Abahuje Cb B Group

texts.en: Assumpta is a group leader; 24 years old. She is married with one child who has one year old. The group is called Abahuje which means “all together” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for the better future. She sells sugar cane and has been running a business for the past 2 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar cane for sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more sugar cane for sell.

loans.name: Santos Ernesto Mendo

texts.en: Iâ€™ve had my business for the past 5 years, I take photos in special events, frame photos and diplomas, sell film and cameras as well as well as car batteries.  My business has grown parallel with my improved experience and my knowledge of camera repairs. I also fix cameras but only on few occasions. I only have basic repair equipment and would need greater financing in order to improve my shop and my services.

loans.use: Buying films, batteries and glass for the studio

loans.name: Dilcia Maria

texts.en:
My name is Dilcia Maria, and my principal occupation is in producing rosquillas. I hope to start a small, home-based artisan company. I have several years of experience in this type of business. Being at home will allow me the opportunity to give proper attention to my family, and the generated revenue will contribute to familial costs and the education of my children.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Dilcia Maria, mi actividad principal es la elaboración de Rosquillas, cuento con un pequeña Micro Empresa artesanal, ubicada en mi casa de habitación, tengo varios años de experiencia en este tipo de negocio, el que me permite atender a mi familia y generar ingresos para contribuir con los gastos familiares y de educación de mis hijos.

loans.use: To purchase corn, cheese, lard, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Mukarram

texts.en: Mukarram started her business 7 years ago. She received her first loan in April 2005. She is one of the successful clients of MicroInvest. She works at the central market of Zafarabad. Her teenage children help her in her business. Mukarram has about $2000 in her sales turnover. She buys her goods from the Istaravshan wholesale market, which is one hour away from her town. Since she started her business, the living conditions of her family have improved. She was able to buy home equipment and make repairs in their house. She often recommends receiving loans to her colleagues at the market. She and several entrepreneurs who work nearby would like to improve the condition of their storage house in the market. Each of them will invest their share of money to do this.

loans.use: Improving conditions for storage of goods

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is 41, she has five children and her husband sells home made ice-cream from door to door. She crafts belts and bracelets from silk thread, and then sells them in San Cristobal de Las Casas, to merchants who have their own established stands in the market "Santo Domingo" ( an artesan market in the city). Juana is a member of the solidarity group "Betania 2." She hopes to invest the loan in the purchase of more thread to craft her products.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

JUANA TIENE 41 AÑOS, CINCO HIJOS, SU ESPOSO HACE Y VENDE HELADOS ARTESANALES DE CASA EN CASA. ELLA SE DEDICA HACER CINTURONES Y PULSERAS CON HILO DE SEDA, POSTERIORMENTE LAS VA A VENDER A SAN CRISTOBAL DE LAS CASAS CON LOS COMERCIANTES QUE TIENE SUS LOCALES ESTABLECIDOS EN EL MERCADO DE SANTO DOMINGO, ( MERCADO ARTESANAL DE LA CIUDAD ) JUANA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO SOLIDARIO BETANIA 2. CON EL PRESTAMO PIENSA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MAS HILO PARA LA ELABORAR MAS PRODUCTOS PARA VENDER

loans.use: To craft bracelets and belts.

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en: Mrs. Loveth E. is 34 years old, married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She derives pleasure in fixing weavon, braiding of hair and decorating brides with beads for the wedding ceremony . Mrs. Loveth hopes to improve her business with the loan amount. She is a leader of her union and has 7 years of experience in her business.

loans.use: To buy more weavon and beads for sale.

loans.name: Santa Ysabel

texts.en: Santa, 47 years old, mother of five children, is a very diligent and dynamic woman. In order to provide her children with a good education, she has been in turn a cook, house cleaner, and saleswoman. Ten years ago, she started her own business. In the morning, she sells fresh chicken parts and vegetables at the public market. At night, she makes empanadas, fried chicken, and sells drinks in her house. With the requested loan she will invest in the purchase of live chickens and some goods like flour, spices, and meat. She also wants to fix her house´s roof. This way, customers will have no problem when it rains. Given this loan, this entrepreneur will also better face her family's financial issues.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and some goods like flour, spices and other goods.  She´ll also fix the roof of her house.

loans.name: John Borbor

texts.en: John is a small trader, married with 6 children. Life was very difficult for John after the war. With some small savings, he started selling a few packets of cigarettes. When SMT expanded its activities in Makeni town of Sierra Leone, John obtained loans and diversified his business.  His children have school fees now, so he also needs to expand his business to be able to generate more income for future high school requirements. He is therefore requesting a $300 loan for the purpose. John is 52 years old.

loans.use: Expand his business in order to generate more profits for future school tuition.

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
Joyce N. is a tailor sewing uniforms, games, and Bitengi (dresses) in Kasobi trading center. She wants to buy thread, materials, and to learn how to make good designs. She has 6 children and also looks after a grandson.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To purchase sewing supplies

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en: U. Rahima lives in Nau, Tajikistan. She is married and has 5 children. She became a client of MicroInvest because she heard many successful stories from friends about the MicroInvest loan procedure that had helped her friends to develop and improve their businesses. Thus she became a client of MicroInvest in 2005. The business stability and increase in income helped her to return her previous loan on time. Mrs. U. is engaged in selling materials. She has a good assortment (different types of material and different tinting). She is a very polite and sensitive person, which is why she has repeat customers and a good business turnover. Now Mrs. U. requests a loan of $1075 to purchase new materials.

loans.use: To purchase new goods

loans.name: Magamaga East D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Joy B.. She is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to expand to bulk selling. Joy is 28 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from age 6 to 16 and all her children go to school. Each week, Joy makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest more in her business. Joy has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy more charcoal and the loan was paid back on time.

Joy is joined in her small group by Jane W., Faridah T., Jane S., and Julia M.. Jane W. has a business in clothing sales and wants to add to the business. Faridah T. is currently operating a business running a grocery store and wants a loan to purchase more groceries. Jane S. operates a business selling coffee and wants to expand the business. Julia M. is currently in the business of selling spare parts and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To boost charcoal business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in material such as fabric and thread.

loans.name: Desideria

texts.es:
Desideria is married and has two children. She started her business out of necessity to obtain a higher family income given that one salary was not enough. Also, at the time, her husband’s unemployment caused her to look for additional resources and she started working on her own. Two years ago, one of her neighbors began supplying her with household cleaning products for her to sell, and she continues to carry out this activity today.

She is now requesting a loan for $US 150, which she will repay in 3 months, to purchase a batch of personal cleaning products and offer demonstrations of these on her own.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Desideria es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Inició el negocio por la necesidad de obtener mas recursos para su familia dado que un solo sueldo no era suficiente, además en ese tiempo el desempleo que tenia su marido la obligo a buscar recursos y empezó a trabajar por su cuenta, hace 2 años una de sus vecinas le facilitaba productos de limpieza para su venta, actividad que continua realizando.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $150 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar un lote de productos de limpieza personal y realizar demostraciones por su cuenta.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to give her own demonstrations.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is a partner of the Comunal Bank Arco Iris

Felicitas is 55 years old and married with 6 children. She travels to different fairs in the area 2 times a week to buy grains, cheese, and livestock. She then returns home and sells her products door to door. On top of that Felicitas farms her land and raises her livestock.

She needs a loan of 3000 soles to invest in the purchase of more livestock.

Her hope is that her kids have as many opportunities as possible, and to offer them and her business all the comforts necessary to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.

Felicitas es casada, tiene 55 años y 6 hijos, Felicitas viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región 2 veces por semana, donD. compra cereales, queso, animales menores que ella beneficia, sus ventas lo realiza caminando D. casa en casa. Además Felicitas se dedica a la agricultura en sus tierras D. Rancha y también se dedica al engorD. D. ganado vacuno y caprino.

Felicitas necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. Cerdos y ganado vacuno.

Los sueños D. Felicitas son que sus hijos sean profesionales, brindar todas las comodidades a sus hijos y su negocio crezca.

loans.use: Felicitas needs a loan of 3000 soles to invest in the purchase of more livestock

loans.name: San

texts.en: San P., 44, is a widow living in the Kampong Cham province with her four children. She is supported by her children who are in the garment factories and logging industry. San P. is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase a small tractor. She will rent out her tractor to other farmers, and in so doing, generate a profit. She sees her area as having a need for a tractor to work the fields, and believes this opportunity will be able to raise her standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase a small tractor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of two machines and materials

loans.name: Saumu Salmini Group

texts.en:
Saumu is 35 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 8 and 20 years old. She has been a juice and spices seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Saumu now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with firewood sales, charcoal sales, livestock raising, and clothes and handbag sales.

loans.use: To buy more items to increase her stock

loans.name: Ma. Emilia

texts.es:
Ma. Emilia es originaria de García Nuevo León, su actividad principal es la venta de paletas de hielo y de snacks en un establecimiento que se encuentra ubicado en su hogar. <

> Actualmente, solicta un préstamo por USD$475 a un plazo de seis meses, con la finalidad de surtir más y mejores mercancías. <

> Ma. Emilia empezó hace dos años vendiendo paletas de hielo casa por casa y frituras en la plaza principal, gracias a los buenos resultados obtenidos ya cuenta con un puesto en su casa. La idea de iniciar con la venta de paletas de hielo y snack se debe a la necesidad de apoyar a su familia mediante la contribución de un ingreso. La familia de Ma. Emilia se compone por su esposo y cinco hijos. Ante la temporalidad del empleo de su esposo, dado que se dedica a la albañilería, Ma. Emilia se ha preocupado por apoyarlo dado que a veces el pago que recibe por su trabajo no es muy alto y a veces el mismo trabajo es escaso. <

> ¡Los invito a que apoyen a Ma. Emilia para que su negocio pueda seguir creciendo! <

>

loans.use: Sustuir mercancía para la venta de paletas de hielo y snacks.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea S. was born in 1978 and she now lives in Dock Por Village in Takeo Province. Chea has four children, two of whom are attending the local school while the remaining two are too young to work or study because they are at the age of one and five years old. She owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn her living. Her husband, Mr. Nget Chor, is a motorbike taxi driver who makes little income because his motorbike is too old and he pays a lot of money on it. In order to improve his business, his wife decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a new motorbike to replace the old one. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: Chea would like to buy a new motorbike to replace the old one for her husband's motor taxi service.

loans.name: Melina

texts.es: Melina tiene 19 años, es soltera, vive junto con sus padres, quienes la apoyan mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas y refrescos, dentro de su casa, aprovechando un pequeño negocio de servicios de cabinas de Internet que tienen sus padrinos. Esta actividad, de la venta de golosinas, la viene realizando desde hace un año atrás. Le gusta mucho porque está en contacto con todo tipo de personas, dar una buena atención es lo que hace a diario y le agrada. Le es rentable, ya que gracias al negocio que pusieron sus padrinos acude mucha gente que compran golosinas y refrescos. Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP. Esta cantidad de dinero le dará la oportunidad de comprar una vitrina más grande, para adquirir más golosinas de tipo variado para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Melina is 19 years old and is single and lives with her parents who support her very much. She works selling candy and sodas from her house thanks to a small internet cafe owned by her godparents. She has been selling candy for a year already. She likes working in this very much because she is in contact with all kind of people and she likes providing them with good attention. It is very profitable because thanks to the business set up by her godparents many people goes and buys candy and sodas. This is the first loan she is requesting to MFP. She sill use the money to buy a larger showcase and more candy of different kinds for her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a larger showcase to present her products

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina tiene 49 años de edad, es conviviente, tuvo 6 hijos, de los cuales solo viven ahora con ella, 4 de ellos. Desde muy niña trabajó al cuidado del hogar y de los niños de sus vecinos, una vez que tuvo su familia se puso a vender comida en las ferias sabatinas que están cerca de su casa. Hace como 8 años puso un pequeño restaurante en su domicilio, y hace un año lo implementó con la venta de gaseosas y golosinas. La venta de comida le es muy rentable, lo dificultoso es cuando le sobra comida y no recupera parte de su capital, pero en los dias de feria, si le sale muy bien e inclusive le falta la comida. Es su 2do préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado va a incrementar sus golosinas y gaseosas para su restaurante.
texts.en:
Paulina is 49 years old, is the mother of six children, and lives with her partner and four of her children. Since she was very young she worked taking care of her home and of her neighbor's children. Once having her own family, she began to sell food at local Saturday markets. About eight years ago she opened a small restaurant in her home. One year ago she expanded her business to include the sale of soft drinks and sweets. Selling food is very lucrative and the only problem is when there is unsold food and Paulina does not recoup her investment. But on market days, she does well and even runs out of food.

This is Paulina's second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She will use the money to stock up on sweets and soft drinks for her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on soft drinks and sweets for her restaurant

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su conviviente y sus 4 hijos que estudian y la apoyan mucho. Desde muy temprana edad apoyaba a sus padres con la crianza de pollos, y ahora esta actividad la realiza personalmente desde hace un año, y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es criar bien a sus pollos, y que estos estén con un peso exacto para su venta. Esta actividad le es muy rentable, ya que cada 28 días sus pollos ya están listos para la venta. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y es una persona responsable en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a construir un galpón más grande, y comprará más pollos bebes.
texts.en:
Mary is 36 years old and lives with her partner and four children who help her out quite a bit. Since she was very young she helped her parents to raise chickens. This has now been her personal business for the past year and it is going well. She enjoys raising her chickens well so they are at the optimum weight for sale. This business has been profitable since her chickens are ready for sale every 28 days. This is her seventh loan with MFP and she is responsible about making payments. With the requested funds she will have a bigger chicken hutch built and will buy more chicks.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bigger chicken hutch

loans.name: Kholmurat

texts.en:
Kholmurat A. is 43 years old. He is married with four children. Kholmurat is raising and selling cattle. He purchases calves in the central market, feeds them well, and then re-sells them at higher prices in the local market. Being in this business for 5 years, he knows very well how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them. Thus, he gets up early every morning in order to feed the animals and to look after them.

His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and generate stable and considerable income for his large family. Currently, Kholmurat is planning to expand his business and to purchase cattle. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting 2500 Somoni for the term of 11 months. You could become an important part in Kholmurat family's life; he deeply appreciates the trust and support you give him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle and calves to expand his business

loans.name: Rous

texts.en:
Rous N., 41, is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has worked growing and selling rice at the market to earn an approximate US$ 4 every day. Her husband, pictured here, makes about US$ 3 by working as construction worker building houses. This couple has six children, four who are in school and two who are construction workers.

Mrs. Rous N. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. This will reduce the money that her husband spends every day on public transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for family transport

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is a 42-year-old childcare provider. She has no children herself - but loves children. She herself is an orphan and she makes an effort to provide for all of the children in her care equally. She hopes one day to turn enough profit so she can purchase homes to rent to people. When we interviewed her, we talked for about 15 minutes and she is an incredibly warm and vivacious person.

loans.use: buying beds

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en: Having a mini "carenderia" (small restaurant) is really a big help for Mrs. Jovy P..  She is 35 years old, married, and lives at Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She has two children. Her husband is a motorcycle driver. Considering the economic crisis we are facing today, Mrs. P. works very hard cooking in her carenderia in order to earn the money her family needs to survive. Fortunately, the daily consumption needs of her family are met because of the carenderia. Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative is a big help to her family and business. She has availed loans several times. Now, she applies for PHP 7,000 to buy additional meats, fishes, and spices for her carenderia. She hopes that her business will be successful and expand into a full restaurant someday, where she can sell a variety of foods.

loans.use: To buy meats, fishes, and spices for carenderia

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia de 32 años es una madre muy preocupada por el bienestar de sus hijos Gabriel de 7 y Midwar de 16, vive en cuarto alquilado y tiene muchos deseos de salir adelante. Lleva más de 5 años en la venta de sobreros y gorras de segunda mano, ha encontrado en esta actividad la mejor manera de sostener económicamente a su familia, compra las gorras usadas de sus proveedores, para luego arreglarlas y el día domingo, en la ferias de la ciudad de Juliaca, las vende de manera ambulatoria. Para Celia lo más divertido de su trabajo es vender, disfruta de convencer a sus clientes de comprarle algo y así acabar con su mercadería, espera en el futuro tener una tienda de ropa donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, puesto que lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo es tener que caminar todo el día por la calles en busca de clientes. Celia sabe que el camino a sus metas es duro, pero no decae en su afán de lograr alcanzarlas. Este es el segundo préstamo con MFP, se siente muy feliz por la oportunidad de crédito y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una de las socias más participativas y responsables. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más gorras y sombreros, para incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que vende.
texts.en:
Celia, 32 years old, is a mother who is very worried about the well-being of her sons Gabriel, age 7 and Midwar, 16. She lives in a rented room and has great desire to get ahead in life. For more than 5 years she has been selling second-hand hats. She found this activity to be the best way to support her family economically. She buys the used hats from suppliers to then repair them and on Sundays, in the markets of the city of Juliaca, she sells them as an ambulatory salesperson. For Celia, the most fun part of her job is to sell as she enjoys convincing her customers to buy something and sell out of her merchandise. In the future she hopes to have a clothing store where she can sell with greater comfort and provide better service to her customers. What she likes least about her work is having to walk all day long through the streets in search of clients. Celia knows that the path to her goals is difficult, but this does not decrease her eagerness to accomplish them. This is her second loan with MFP and she feels very happy about this opportunity for a loan. She hopes to be able to repay it on time and in her communal bank she is one of the most participatory and responsible members. With the loan that she is requesting she will buy more hats to increase the amount of merchandise that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Merchandise

loans.name: Sanoussi

texts.fr: Cette dame est une veuve qui vit seule avec ses 03 enfants dans le quartier d’amoutiévé, l’activité qu’elle exerce et qui lui permet de subvenir aux charges de sa famille est le commerce des articles de mercerie et la vente de boissons, ce commerce lui réussit bien. , elle exerce son commerce près du marché d’amoutiévé.Elle veut commencer le commerce de produits cosmétiques pour augmenter ses recettes et bien subvenir aux charges de sa famille, elle  a déjà obtenu un crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé et sollicite de WAGES son deuxième crédit afin d’acheter des produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
This lady is a widow who lives alone with her three children in the Amoutiévé district. Her work, which enables her to provide for her family, involves commerce in sewing supplies and in beverages. It’s a business that is very successful for her. She operates near the Amoutiévé marketplace. She wants to begin commerce in cosmetics to increase her receipts and to do well in supporting her family. She has had a loan before that she has repaid. She’s requesting her second loan from WAGES in order to buy cosmetics.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Lokohounsi Gisèle

texts.fr:
H. Lokohounsi Gisèle est née vers 1968 à Ekpè, dans la Commune de Sèmè kpodji dans le Département de l’Ouémé. Lokossi Gisèle est mariée et mère de six (6) enfants. Lokohounsi Gisèle vend la nourriture au sein de la maternité de Ekpè au personnel de cette maternité et à ceux qui viennent aux soins . Lokohounsi Gisèle vend aussi des divers(Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc.). Avec la hausse actuelle du prix des denrées de première nécessité, Lokohounsi Gisèle a besoin de plus moyens financiers qu’elle n’en dispose. c’est pourquoi Lokohounsi Gisèle s’est approchée de ALIDé pour avoir un prêt afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle . 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
H. Lokohounsi Gisèle was born around 1968 in Ekpè in the township of Sèmè Kpodji in the County of Ouémé. She is married and the mother of 6 children. She sells food in the clinic for pregnant women in Ekpè to the staff of this facility and also to those who come in for care. She sells various items (candy, cookies, tins of milk, sardines and tomatoes; sugar, pasta, detergent, dish-washing liquid, and toilet soap) as well.

In view of the present price increases for staple goods, Lokohounsi Gisèle needs more capital than she has. That is why she has come to ALIDé to take out a loan so as to better satisfy her clientele.

. The significance of ALIDé in the local language of Bénin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor". Bénin is a small country in West Africa next door to Nigeria, where the average per capita annual income stands at US$ 1,500.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 2 sacks of 50 kg of rice; tomatoes--both tinned and fresh; a case of tinned milk and powdered milk, and a case of detergent and dish liquid, a carton of lump sugar, and 50 kg of granulated sugar

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.ru: Абдурасул парен , который занимается продажей фруктов на рынке Паншанбе города Худжанда.Он недавно получил кредит , но с сезонностью он хочет досрочно погасить оставшееся погашение и получить повторно чуть побольше.На повторный кредит он хочет оптом привозить малину и раздавать по точкам покупателям , торговцам рынка.
texts.en:
Abdurasul is a young guy who sells fruit at Hojand's Panshanbe market. Recently he has received a loan but he would like to pay it off earlier so that he can receive a bigger loan. He would like to use the second loan for the wholesale purchase of raspberries and selling them retail to different vendors and customers.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fruit sales

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina R. raises pigs for sale. She is 41 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the city of Dapitan. Lina has been in this business for over three years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. Lina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Kahor

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Кахор мужчина 49 лет. Женат имеет 3-х детей.Кахор занимается перевозкой строй материалов на разные точки города. У него автомобиль марки "Камаз", сезон работы у него в летнее время, так как сейчас все делают стройку и большой спрос на услуги его автомашины. Кахор планирует хорошо заработать в этом сезоне для того чтобы женить сына в осенний период. Кредит берёт на покупку новых шин.
texts.en:
Kahor is a 49-year-old man. He is married and has 3 children. Kahor is involved in transporting building materials to various sites in the city. He has a Kamaz truck. His work season is during summer time because now everyone is doing construction, and the demand for his transportation services is high. Kahor plans to earns well during this season in order to marry off his son in the autumn. He is obtaining this loan for the purchase of new tires.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new tires

loans.name: Yemisi

texts.en: Yemisi is 53 years old and married with five children. She sells herbal medicines. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000 NGN to purchase more herbal medicines to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more herbal medicines

loans.name: Mujeres Con Dedicacion Group

texts.en:
The communal loan group “Mujeres con Dedicacion” (Women with Dedication) consists of 13 members.  These women just began working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos, and this will be their very first loan.  They are requesting a total of 4400 soles.  The women of “Mujeres con Dedicacion” dedicate themselves to a variety of business ventures including making and selling shoes, sewing, and selling cooked food, juices, or basic grocery items.  Each plans to invest her loan in her business.

Señora Nelia T. R. is the official president of “Mujeres con Dedicacion.”  She is 52 years old and is married with one child.  She has a business making and selling beaded sandals and also earns income by recycling bottles.  Her husband works at a saw mill.  Nelia plans to invest her loan in purchasing materials such as elastic, beads, soles and other items necessary for constructing her handmade sandals.

The women of “Mujeres con Dedicacion” are pleased to have working capital to help grow their businesses, enabling them to contribute financially to their households.

loans.use: To buy materials to make beaded sandals

loans.name: Management Group

texts.en:
Managment Group, led by Mateneh B., is a group of five borrowers living in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.

Mateneh is 28 years old and is single with three children age 3 to 14. All her children are in school but behind due to the schools being closed during the war. Mateneh was unable to attend school herself because, although she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide, and therefore school was considered unnecessary. She lives in the remote city of Kolahu in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia.

Mateneh’s business is retail housewares, specifically plastic dishes which she buys wholesale from nearby Guinea and sells in a temporary market stall on the Kolahu-Foya highway. She has run her business for two years and is successful because of the way she treats her customers.

Mateneh is taking the loan to increase her inventory of dishes to meet increased demand. Her dream is to grow her business so she can one day have the biggest table in the central market. With the profits from her business she dreams of building her own house.

loans.use: To purchase more dishes wholesale to sell

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles S. is from the village of Pangabuan, Tangub City. She is 48-years-old. Angeles is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Angeles owns and operates an "alimango" fishing retail business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Angeles has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Angeles joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angeles has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Angeles is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seafood to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Angeles from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children and to be used for daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seafood to sell

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 52 years old and a business woman from the village of San Vicente, Quirino, Isabela. She is married to Julito and they have two children: Ednalyn and Manuel who are both married. 

Lorena  used to engaged in a retailing business.  However, due to lack of capital, it did not survive so she was forced to close it since she cannot meet the demands of her customers.  

She then decided to venture into the hog raising business which is located in their back yard.  With the small capital from her store, she used it to purchased a few hogs.  She hopes to increase her hogs but she needs more capital.  She is hoping that KIVA lenders will give her the chance to make her business productive by lending her a loan of PHP8,000.00.  This will be of great help in making her business profitable.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase more hogs

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline S. is from the village of Lawigan, Catarman Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Jacqueline is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Jacqueline owns & operates a business peddling food including snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Jacqueline has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jacqueline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jacqueline is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be used to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie M. is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of Faleasiu Tualesolo. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marie operates a family member's business, a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Marie has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 500 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Marie joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marie is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Marie plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita R. is from the village of Palacapao, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. The primary source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the 8th she has taken from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & for working capital

loans.name: Larsie

texts.en: Larsie V. is from Guadiz St., Laoac, Pangasinan. She is 52 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Larsie owns and operates a business vending fruits and vegetables. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Larsie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used as additional capital for buying products to sell. Larsie is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will again be used to buy additional products to sell. This loan will her fifth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Elohor

texts.en:
Elohor, age 28, lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria, where she has a grocery store business, selling grocery items at retail prices to her customers. She is a client of LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization), which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers, and she hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is married and has three children.

Elohor is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN, which she will use to purchase more groceries to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
Mariluz, de 25 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Edgar, de 25 años, y con su pequeño hijo Edu de 6 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

En una de las calles más importantes del poblado de Cabanillas, Mariluz tiene su puesto. Su actividad es la venta de gelatina con leche batida, el cual es un postre muy delicioso, motivo por el cual es muy solicitado por sus clientes, quienes no pueden evitar comerse más de uno. 
Ella ya tiene una reputación ganada y es por eso que se esfuerza mucho en la elaboración de su delicioso postre.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes mientras saborean la gelatina con leche batida, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer bajo los inclementes rayos solares todos los días. Pero aún así, desea trabajar muy duro para sacar adelante su negocio.

Este es el primer préstamo de Mariluz con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en todas sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para elaborar su delicioso postre.
texts.en:
Mariluz is 25 years old and is the mother of a family. She is very affectionate and hardworking. She lives in a rented house together with her husband Edgar, who is also 25 years old, and her young son Edu who is 6 years. Edu is the reason for all of their hard work. In one of the most important streets in the village of Cabanillas, Mariluz has her stall. She sells gelatin with whipped milk, which is a very delicious dessert and is in high demand from her customers who can't avoid eating more than one. She has already gained a reputation and it is because of this that she puts so much effort into making the delicious dessert. What she likes most about her job is talking with her customers while they savor the dessert. She has been in the business for 2 years and finds the most difficult thing is staying under the harsh rays of the sun all day. But despite this, she wants to work really hard to take her business forward. This is Mariluz's first loan with MFP and she hopes to be very punctual with all her payments since she doesn't want to give problems to her communal bank which she is very happy with. With the five hundred nuevos soles she is asking for Mariluz will buy more ingredients for making her delicious dessert.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make her desserts

loans.name: Wenceslao

texts.es:
Wenceslao tiene 66 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y dos nietos en el caserío Huaca de Barro, distrito de Morrope, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la agricultura desde hace más de 20 años. Tiene unos terrenos de cultivo en una zona cercana. Allí ha sembrado actualmente arroz. Este negocio es la única fuente de sustento con la cual ha venido manteniendo a su familia durante todo este tiempo. Por lo que siempre da todo de si para sacar sus cultivos adelante.

El cultivo de arroz ya está muy avanzado y Wenceslao necesita darle mantenimiento con la aplicación de fertilizantes, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

El es una persona muy conocida y estimada por los vecinos de su comunidad, ellos lo consideran un hombre honrado y trabajador.
texts.en:
Wenceslao is 66 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and two grandchildren in the small village of Huaca de Barro, in the Morrope district, located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. He has worked in agriculture for more than 20 years. He has some land under cultivation in a nearby zone. At this time, he has planted rice there. This business is the only source of sustenance he has had to maintain his family for this whole time. For this reason, he always gives all of himself to raise his crops. The rice crop is already very far along, and Wenceslao needs to maintain it with the application of fertilizer, but he does not have enough capital to do this. For this reason he has seen the need to apply for the first time to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 PEN. He is a person who is well-known and admired by his neighbors in the community. They consider him an honest and hard-working man.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to maintain his rice crop.

loans.name: Mohammad Arif

texts.en:
Mohammad Arif, 37 years old, is married and is the father of four children. He lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Mohammad has a photo shop and he has had good experience for more than four years in his business. He has already successfully completed his first loan and expanded his stock.

Still, Mohammad wants to further expand his business with full success, so now he has requested his second loan to enlarge his shop so as to attract more customers and make a good income to help his family. He is happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy some necessary things for his shop

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie V. is from the village of Camp Philips, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old. Emelie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Emelie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Emelie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $175 a month from these activities. (Emily chose to remain in the 5000 PHP range for her 2nd cycle loan.)

In 2009, Emelie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Emelie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Xochilt Paola

texts.es:
La señora Xochilt, se dedica a la Venta de Calzado y Chinela, todos los días se ubica en puesto fijo  al aire libre en la 2da. Calle del mercado la terminal – León, oferta su producto desde temprana hora finalizando  a las 2:00 pm. la tarde es dedicada a su familia ya que tiene un niño de 20 meses. 
Este crédito que solicita es  para aumentar su inventario, actualmente le están ofreciendo un calzado a bajo precio por lo que quiere aprovechar la oportunidad presentada de lo cual obtendría mayores ganancia al igual que ofertaría a su clientela variedad de productos con el objetivo de satisfacer la necesidad de  ellos.
texts.en:
Xochilt sells shoes and sandals every day at an open-air stand in the second aisle of León's La Terminal market. She is open for business from very early in the morning until 2pm; the afternoons are dedicated to her family for she has a 20-month-old child. She will use the requested funds to increase her stock inventory. She is being offered shoes at a low price and she wants to take advantage of this opportunity which will allow her to make higher profits while offering her customers a greater variety of products to meet their needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma P. a 36-year-old rice farmer has three children. Because her eldest child is 13 years old, she has been quite worried how to manage their income when her child starts going to college soon. She would like to grow her rice farm business. Now she has been busy preparing it for the next planting. However, she said, she still needs additional money to complete the process. She thinks of applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 at Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Milly

texts.en: Milly is a married with six children and her children go to school. She owns a two-room house where she stays with eight people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Milly takes care of additional family members (her sister). Monthly expenses include medication, school fees and feeding the family. Milly owns a store where she sells charcoal near her home. She sells to all categories of people both at retail and at wholesale . She works seven days a week. Milly receives at least for 30 customers a day she has been in this business for ten years and her business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.  Besides this charcoal business, she also rears chicken at her home.  She has been with MCDT for many years servicing her 13th loan.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal and chicken feed.  She is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and go directly to producers.  She joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with low income women. She aspires to get a better standard of living and educate her children up to university level

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and chicken feeds

loans.name: Aminat

texts.en: Aminat sells bottles of wine, canned drinks and juice at retail prices to make a living. She hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger. She is 38 years old, married with 3 children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports their home. She hopes to excel in her business and family life. She is requesting for a loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more bottles of wine to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bottles of wine to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva tiene 32 años, vive con sus 2 hijos y su madre en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las tareas agrícolas, desde entonces y durante 15 años ha trabajado de manera independiente, cuidando sus vacas y sus tierras de cultivo, en donde siembra  maíz, papa arveja y zanahorias. Durante la temporada de cosecha lo lleva a comercializar al principal mercado de su ciudad. Para Eva realizar estas tareas son muy sacrificados pero a la vez recompensando, ya que ha logrado mejor su calidad de vida es por ello que  quiere continuar  trabajando y  emprendiendo mas en sus ingresos con la venta  al por mayor de sus cosechas. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. El crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de un becerro para intensificar su ganadería.
texts.en:
Eva is 32 years old and lives with her two children and her mother in their own house. Since she was a little girl she's been doing farm work, and has always worked independently, taking care of her caddle and land where she plants corn, potatoes and olives. During the harvest, she sells her products at the town's farmer's market. Eva works very hard but she believes she's seeing rewards, since her lifestyle has improved, and she wants to keep growing her business by offering more products and gaining more clients. This is her 7th loan with MFP, and she promises to pay it back responsibly, and thinks the money will be really useful in improving her business. She is using this loan to buy calf and intensify her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a calf

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar tiene 31 años, vive con su pareja Reina de 23 años, en una acogedora vivienda propia, está pareja quiere tener comodidades antes de convertirse en padres, porque no quieren que sus hijos tengan carencias. Desde hace dos años, se dedica a la agricultura de café y plátano en sus propias chacras, siendo éstas heredadas por su suegra. Por otro lado labora como operario en las tierras de los hacendados, ganando S/. 20.00 soles por día, mientras su esposa se dedica a las labores domesticas de la casa, pero en época de cosecha lo ayuda. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es limpiar la maleza de sus campos y cosechar sus frutos, por otro lado le es difícil cuidar sus plantaciones de las plagas, por lo que pierde productividad. Pero sabe que en la agricultura, siempre gana buenas utilidades, por eso la considera rentable y por tal motivo desea ampliar las hectáreas de su chacra para continuar sembrando café. Asegura además que se convertirá en el mejor productor de café de la zona y para que su esposa también tenga beneficios económicos instalará una tienda de comestibles o de prendas de vestir en su casa. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y como ya conoce la metodología de trabajo de su grupo comunal, siento feliz por continuar acompañada de personas muy responsables y honestas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 7 sacos de fertilizantes, además comprará madera, clavos, calaminas para terminar de construir el segundo piso de su domicilio.
texts.en:
Edgar is 31 and lives with his partner, Reina, 23, in a cosy home that they own. They are a couple who want to be well set-up before becoming parents, because they don't want their children to lack anything. For two years, Edgar has farmed coffee and bananas on his own farmlands, which he inherited from his mother-in-law. He also works as a labourer on the land of some landowners, earning about 20 soles per day. His wife does housework but helps him at harvest time. His favourite part of his job is clearing the weeds from his land and harvesting his fruits; on the other hand, it is difficult to keep his fields safe from pests which hurt productivity. But he knows that in agriculture, one always earns something useful, and thus he considers agriculture to be profitable and he wants to expand his farmlands to keep growing coffee. He is sure that he will become the best coffee producer in the area and, in order for his wife to also have economic benefits he will install a food store or a clothing store in their house. This is the second time he has taken out a loan with MFP, and as he already knows how the community group works together, he is happy to keep working with such very responsible and honest people. With the requested loan, he will buy 7 bags of fertilizer, and wood, nails and corrugated iron to finish the construction of the second floor of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 7 bags of fertilizer and materials for home completion

loans.name: Yameena's Group

texts.en:
Yameena H. is a resident of Raiwind which is located near Lahore, Pakistan.  Her family consists of four members: Yameena, her husband and two children. Both of her children are getting their education. Her husband works in the government sector while she operates a beauty salon to financially support her family. 

She started this business last year by taking a loan from Asasah. Her business is doing well because of her hard work and dedication. She has been able to practice her art among her customers. 

Now she has applied for a loan for the second time from Asasah to invest the loan amount in her beauty salon. She will buy beauty items such as creams, cosmetics and a hair dryer machine to better assist her customers.

Note: Yameena group member Samina is showing decoration pieces from her business and Munawar is showing items from her embroidery business in this photo.

loans.use: Purchase beauty items for beauty salon

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie Z. has successfully completed her payments on time to KIVA through ASHI. While continuing her previous business of making sweet delicacies and selling them, she is now requesting a loan to finance another type of business, raising chickens in 45 days for selling. Once they are sold, she will again buy replacements to sustain her business. Rosie also wants to resell low-priced clothing to her neighbors since their village is far from the market and people would not have to pay transportation fees to shop for clothes. Rosie thinks that, instead, their money could be used for other necessary purchases. 

Rey, Rosie’s husband, feels that achieving their dream to give their child a comfortable life is now easier because both he and Rosie are helping each other earn money for their family cash flow. Rosie feels that with the support and love of her husband, she will never stop working hard and expanding her business, especially since ASHI and KIVA are giving her the opportunity to receive a loan.

loans.use: To purchase chicks for raising and materials to make a cage; to purchase low-priced clothing to resell

loans.name: Nurjamal's Group

texts.ru:
Всем известна общая тенденция стремления молодых людей уехать на заработок в зарубежные страны или хотя бы в город из родного села. Большой город манит всех своим большим выбором работы, освещёнными улицами, множеством развлечений и многообещающими перспективами на грандиозный успех. Лишь немногие из молодёжи рискуют остаться в родном селе и строить свою жизнь там, где другие давно потеряли надежду. Герои нашей истории из тех немногих людей, которые решили остаться и добиваться успеха постепенно. Нуржамал Ибраевой сорок шесть лет. Нуржамал – мать троих детей. Её старшему сыну двадцать два года. Когда мать овдовела, старший сын решил остаться возле матери и быть всегда рядом. Сейчас Нуржамал работает в школе учителем. Семь лет назад она получила кредит и купила бычков. Сын подрос и заняв место отца, взял всё домашнее хозяйство на себя. Второй сын решил работать на стройке, а младшая дочь в этом году закончила десятый класс. Общими усилиями семье Нуржамал в течение семи лет удалось купить земельный участок и построить дом. Нуржамал не хочет останавливаться на достигнутом. Она обратилась за кредитом и надеется купить корову. В её планах на данный момент увеличить поголовье скота и достроить дом. 
Партнёры Нуржамал:
Тамаре Торубаевой пятьдесят шесть лет. Тамара вырастила пятерых детей. Четыре дочери уже замужем и сын также женат. Тамара с мужем занимаются откормом скота и при этом им помогают внуки, которых они взяли к себе на воспитание. Тамара обратилась за кредитом с целью купить две овцы на откорм. 
Сабырбеку Сыдыкбекову сорок восемь лет. Сабырбек – отец пятерых детей. Старшая дочь – преподаватель, вторая дочь – медсестра, а старший сын в этом году закончил школу. Младший сын только собирается пойти в школу, и две дочери близнецы пока ещё в дошкольном возрасте. Сабырбек обратился за этим кредитом, так как хочет купить запчасти на комбайн. 
Гулзат Жусубалиевой сорок пять лет. Гулзат – вдова и мать четверых детей. Старший сын помогает Гулзат по хозяйству. Гулзат ежедневно сдаёт по четырнадцать – пятнадцать литров молока и занимается откормом скота. Ей нужен кредит, чтобы восемь голов овец.
Турсунбеку Оморбекову шестьдесят восемь лет. У Турсунбека двое сыновей. Оба женились. Младший сын помогает Турсунбеку ухаживать за скотом и собирать корм. Турсунбек надеется получить этот кредит и купить шесть голов овец.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Everyone knows that young men tend to leave to work in foreign countries, or at least in big cities far from their home villages. The city suits everyone: the broad choice of work, the shiny streets, the entertainment, and the promising prospects of great success. Only a few youth risk remaining in their native villages and building a life there where others have long since lost hope. The heroes of our story are some of those few people who have decided to remain and achieve success gradually. Nurjamal I. is forty-six years old. Nurjamal is the mother of three children. Her eldest son is twenty-two years old. When his mother became a widow, the eldest son decided to remain near her. Now Nurjamal works at a school as a teacher. Seven years ago she took out a loan and bought calves. The son has grown up and taken his father’s place, doing all the work at home himself. The second son has decided to work in construction, and the daughter finished tenth grade this year. By working together over the last seven years, Nurjamal’s family has managed to buy a plot of land and build a house. Nurjamal does not wish to rest on her laurels. She has applied for a loan and hopes to buy a cow. She plans to increase her head of cattle and to complete their house. Nurjamal’s Partners: Tamara T. is fifty-six years old. Tamara has raised five children. Her four daughters and her son are already married. Tamara and her husband work fattening cattle, and they are helped by their grandsons whom they are raising. Tamara has applied for a loan to buy two sheep to fatten. Sadyrbek S. is forty-eight years old. Sadyrbek is the father of five children. His oldest daughter is a teacher; the second daughter is a nurse, and the eldest son left school this year. The younger son is the only one going to school. Two twin daughters are preschool age. Sadyrbek has applied for this loan to buy spare parts for a combine. Gulzat J. is forty-five years old. Gulzat is a widow and the mother of four children. The eldest son helps Gulzat at home. Daily, Gulzat sells fourteen to fifteen liters of milk, and she is works fattening cattle. She needs this loan to buy eight sheep. Tursunbek O. is sixty-eight years old. Tursunbek has two sons. Both sons are married. The younger son helps Tursunbek to look after the cattle and to collect feed. Tursunbek hopes get this loan to buy six sheep.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Luis Joaquin

texts.es: Luis Joaquín tiene 44 años, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo que son lo más importante pues es por ellos que él se esfuerza para salir adelante. Este es su quinto crédito con Fundación pues ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y puntual en sus cuotas. Su actividad económica es la venta y crianza de cerdos, el inicio este negocio hace 7 años por lo que tenía que buscar los medios necesarios para generar ingresos a su familia. Por lo que es un desafío para el mantener este negocio activo, por la escases de maní y otros alimentos necesarios para el engorde de los cerdos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de alimentos y compra de cerdos pequeños. Sueña con ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Luis Joaquín is 44 years old and has two children under his care. They are the most important thing to him and it's for them that he works so hard to make headway. This is his fifth loan with this organization and he has shown himself to be a very responsible and punctual person with his payments. He makes a living raising and selling pigs. He started his business seven years ago because he needed to find a way to earn an income for his family. It has been a challenge to maintain the business due to the shortage of peanuts and other food products necessary to fatten the pigs. He is requesting the loan to purchase feed and also buy some piglets. He dreams of expanding his business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed and piglets

loans.name: Luis Ernan

texts.es:
Luis es un joven de 22 años de edad que vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el caserío Tejedores del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola caracterizada por producir exclusivamente frutas como el mango y el limón. Pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace algunos dos años aproximadamente a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino, el cría ovejas en un ambiente cercano a su vivienda, cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que visitan el lugar en donde reside. Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades el sostiene sus gastos personales y apoya a sus padres en el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Luis desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo mas animales para criarlos y venderlos, como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales espera lograr su objetivo.

Luis es un joven tranquilo, trabajador y bastante independiente. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder brindarle a su familia la posibilidad de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis, 22, lives with his parents, brothers and sisters in the Peruvian district of Tambogrande, an agricultural area largely given over to growing fruits like mangoes and lemons. Tambogrande is in the province of Piura, in the region of the same name, and some three hours from Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Luis has operated a business raising and selling sheep for two years. He raises the animals behind his house and, when they are ready for market, sells them to neighbors and the buyers who occasionally travel through the area. With earnings from the business, he supports himself and helps with family expenses. Luis wants to buy more animals to expand his business. He is applying for a 1,500 new-soles loan from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can meet his goal. Luis is a reserved, hard-working young man and largely independent. His greatest hope is to grow his business so that he can provide his family with the best possible quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy animals for livestock business.

loans.name: Zherendi's Group

texts.en:
Zherendi K. is leader of this group. She is forty-seven and widow. She has three children: her daughter is twenty-six and her sons are twenty-seven and twenty-three years old. Her elder son is a construction worker and lives with his own family independently, her daughter is also married and lives independently, and her youngest son works in Kazakhstan.

She resells agricultural products and milk. Three years ago, she started her business with a purchase of agricultural products for 6,000 soms which she resold at a higher price.  She is applying for a loan to purchase wheat and barley for resale at a higher price. In the future, she is planning to expand her business.

Group members:

Asel I. is treasurer of the group. She is thirty-six and married. She has four children: her son is twelve and her daughters are eleven, four, and two years old. Her elder son and daughter go to school and her youngest two daughters are at home. Her husband is a carpenter. Her husband learned from his farther skills of making different things from wood. 

Asel breeds cattle and she sells nearly ten or twelve liters of milk a day. Together with her husband, she is in the business nearly eighteen years. They started with an initial investment of 1,000 soms. Now, they earn 4,000 soms each month. For now, they could purchase a car and build a house. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase wood for her husband. In the future, they are planning to expand their business and increase the size of their cattle herd. 

Chynarkul S. is fifty and married. She is tractor driver. She has five children: her sons are thirty, twenty-nine, twenty-two, and sixteen, and her daughter is nine years old. 

Her elder son is married. He works and lives independently in Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan) with his own family. Her second son works in Russia. Her third son works in Cholpon-Ata. Her youngest son and daughter go to school. She started cattle breeding fourteen years ago with initial investment of 2,500 soms. For now, she could increase significantly the number of cattle she owns and increase her earnings to 2,000 soms monthly. 

She is applying for a loan to purchase cattle for breeding. In the future, she is planning to increase the size of her cattle herd, marry her children and build a big house for her family. 

Sveta A. is thirty-six and married. She has five children: her youngest daughter is four months old; her other daughters are nine, thirteen, and sixteen years old; and her son is fifteen years old. Her elder children go to school and her youngest daughter is at home. 

She breeds cattle. Her children help her in cattle breeding. She started cattle breeding nine years ago with a purchase of cattle for 3,000 soms. She earns 1,500 soms from cattle breeding. She also sells five or six liters of milk a day. She could build a house and increase her cattle quantity with the help of her business. 

She is applying for a loan in order to purchase cattle for breeding. In the future, she is planning to continue increasing the size of her cattle herd and to purchase furniture for her house. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line--People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan   Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase wheat and barley

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila B. is from the village of Sepac, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Nila is separated from her spouse and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Nila owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of revenue for the business comes from selling scrap metal, iron, bronze, bottles and other used products. Nila has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Nila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Nila is requesting a loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken by Nila from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosa Elba
