texts.es: Rosa Elba A. D. C. 71 años D. edad, es una señora muy admirada ya que a pesar D. sus años, es una persona muy trabajadora quien lucha día con día por obtener su sustento diario. Ella vive junto a su esposo en el departamento D. Usulután, lugar en el cual posee una venta D. frutas y verduras. Rosa posee 40 años D. dedicarse a este trabajo, lo que la ha hecho muy conocida y querida en el lugar. Rosa solicita un préstamo con el deseo D. comprar mayor cantidad y variedad D. frutas,  ya que ella comercializa por mayor y así mismo por unidad, lo que le permite contar con muchas ventas. Rosa desea mejorar sus ganancias, debido a que es D. este negocio del cual ella depenD. por lo que desea mucho mejorarlo para vivir mejor en su vejez y D. esta forma contar con una vida estable y tranquila.
texts.en: Rosa Elba A. D. C., 71, is a much-admired woman because, despite her age, she still works hard, fighting each day to make her living.  She lives with her husband in Usulután Department, where she has a fruit and vegetable stand.  Rosa has been in this business for 40 years, and she is well known and loved there.  She is asking for a loan to buy a larger supply and variety of fruit.  She sells them in bulk and by the piece, which allows her to make a lot of sales.  Rosa wants to improve the income from her business so she can live better in her old age and have a stable and peaceful life.

loans.use: To buy fruit for her business

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza C. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Bliss, Bogo, Cebu. She earns her living buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing. Her husband, Danilo C., who is 40 years old, works as a company driver and also helps in his wife's business. They have four children between three and 19.  

Liza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Liza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000, which she intends to use to expand her clothing inventory so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Liza C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more inventory

loans.name: Beronika

texts.en: Beronika S. is currently in the business of selling fish, groundnut paste and bread. She is requesting a loan to stock more fish to sell.  Beronika is 35 years old and is married to a peasant. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Bintirashid

texts.en:
Bintirashid is a widow with five children; one still attend school while four have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For over ten years, she has operated a cashew nut selling business. She sells at the market to town dwellers and passersby. Bintirashid faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the hot summer season, cashew nut supply is less compared to the rainy season where the supply is high. She hopes to expand and sell a larger quantity of cashew nuts in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To  purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale

loans.name: Edita María

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Marianita de Jesús.

En este lugar encontramos  a la señora Edita, tiene 57años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos ya todos mayores de edad, una de sus hijas vive en su casa con el esposo y tres hijos pequeños, los mismos que son la alegría de doña Edita. Su marido es albañil.  Ella es parte del Banco Comunal hace ya 3 ciclos y está muy a gusto por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Tiene un negocio de preparación y venta de corviches,  empanadas y helados de varios sabores, tiene un pequeño local en su casa donde todas las tardes vende las empanadas y corviches porque los helados los vende todo el día, trabaja en las mañanas en la producción de sus productos y en las tarde los vende.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar materiales tales como maní, plátano y especias para la preparación de los alimentos. Sus sueños son ver que sus nietos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The members of the Marianita de Jesús communal bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its beaches, its rich gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

Edita, 57, is married and has five adult children.  One of her daughters, her husband and three small children live with her.  They are Edita’s joy.  Her husband is a bricklayer.  She has been a member of the communal bank for three cycles already and is very happy with the ease in getting loans.

She has a business making corviches (dough made from grated plantain, deep fried and stuffed with spicy fish or minced meat, topped with salad, mayo, chili), turnovers and ice cream of various flavors.  She has a small stand in her house where she sells turnovers and corviches in the evenings; she sells ice cream all day.  She works mornings preparing her products and then sells them in the evening.

This loan will be used to buy ingredients like peanuts, bananas and spices for the food preparation.  Her dream is to see her grandchildren go to school and become professionals.

loans.use: To buy peanuts, bananas and spices.

loans.name: Simona Del Carmen

texts.es:
Simona es una pequeña comerciante, que se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa, zapatos, siendo su medio de ingreso para poder apoyar  a sus hijos ya que no cuenta con el apoyo del papa.
Para ella no ha sido fácil, pero se ha esforzado, lo que ha logrado la captación de clientes. Y a través de los financiamientos  ha venido comprando más productos los cuales los vende en los departamentos en donde se vende más, es por eso sus venta las realiza en el norte.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo su objetivo es comprar ropa nueva para dama, caballero, niños, zapatos, perfumes, logrando aumentar las ventas ya que este mes se comercializa mucha mercadería.
texts.en:
Simona is a small businesswoman who sells clothes and shoes.  This is how she makes income to support her children since she has no support from the children's father.

Life hasn't been easy for Simona but she has worked hard and managed to attract a number of customers.  Through her loans, she has been buying more products.  She sells these in the departments where they sell best.  For this reason, she makes her sales in the north.

Simona's goal with this new loan is to buy new clothes for men, women and children, shoes and perfume.  This will help her to increase her sales as merchandise sells well during this month.

loans.use: To buy men's and women's clothes and different styles of shoes so that she can increase her sales

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy J. is 26 years old and a single lady. Nancy has three children: Nickson age 13 years, Brian 11 years and Kelvin five years. They all go to primary school.  Nancy sells cereals in Ndurio trading centre in Kabarnet town. She has been in the business for three years and she gets a monthly profit of Kshs. 4,500.  She has borrowed her first loan of Ksh 10,000 from KADET LTD and wants to use this money to buy maize worth Kshs 4,000 and beans worth Kshs. 6,000 for resale.

Nancy anticipates using the profits she gets to buy more cereals and to expand her business.  Her hopes and dreams are to meet the needs of her customers and to be able to support her family fully.

loans.use: To purchase cereals for sale

loans.name: Mesalina

texts.en:
Mesalina A. is from the town of Baclayon. She is 57 years old. Mesalina is married and has four children. Her eldest child is 27 years old and the youngest is 20. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling hair accessories. She has been engaged in her business for quite some time now and she earns approximately $70 a month for these activities.

Mesalina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Mesalina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase assorted accessories to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase assorted accessories to sell

loans.name: Peter Kamau

texts.en: Peter has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last eight years. He is 32 years old, married to Elizabeth Nyawira and they have four children. Peter was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy goat. In the future, Peter hopes to practise mixed farming on a large scale.

loans.use: to buy a dairy  goat

loans.name: Jorge Raúl

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CHASKA ÑAHUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jorge Raul; el tiene 39 años de edad y es separado y tiene 2 hijos; el socio trabaja en artesanía el trabaja con fibra de alpaca (tejidos) el tiene su fábrica donde reparte solo a sus clientes, el socio es una persona bien alegre y entusiasta con muchas ganas de salir adelante siendo de esta forma que el socio saca  a su familia.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de más materiales para su negocio de artesanía.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Jorge Raúl is a member of the “CHASKA ÑAHUI” communal bank located in Cusco district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

He is 39 years old, separated and has two children.  He is a craftsman making woven items out of alpaca fibers.   He has a factory where he sells to customers.  He is quite a cheerful, enthusiastic person with drive to get ahead since this is the way he supports his family.

He is asking for a loan to buy more materials for his crafts business.  He is happy about the loan and commits to repay.

loans.use: To buy more materials for his crafts business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is a 50-year-old widow who supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in the municipality of Quezon, Palawan. Teresita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past two loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Teresita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,600, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her third loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy additional items to resell so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Teresita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock

loans.name: Houda

texts.ar: هدى متزوجة ولها 1 هي في عمر 32 سنة تعمل في صناعة المونة الموسمية لها في عملها 10 سنوات تحب عملها تعمل بكد ونشاط تتميز بالعمل الدقيق والنظيف تريد ان تتطور وان تزيد من مدخولها السنوي فعملها يعتمد على المواسم تحب اولادها وتتمنى دائما التطور لهم تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى زيادة البضاعة لديها من خلال شراء الزيت والعلب المضغوطة والجوز وغيره هي نشيطة وتحب التجدد والتقدم في العمل
texts.en: Housa is 32 years old and married with one child. She works in the preparation of seasonal vine leaves (used to make various delicacies) and has 10 years experience in this. She loves her work and is enthusiastic about what she does. She is distinguished with attention to detail and cleanliness. She wants to develop and increase her annual income as her work is seasonal. She loves her family and is always seeking progress for them. With this loan she wants to purchase ingredients and supplies, such as oil, nuts and airtight containers. She loves new ideas and progress in her work.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and supplies, such as oil, nuts and airtight containers.

loans.name: Nasanjargal

texts.en:
Nasanjargal is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two children in their own house in Zavhan province in Mongolia. Her husband is an officer in a private company in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter, age 7, goes to a secondary school, while her son, age 4, goes to a kindergarten. 

She manages a dairy farm in her town. At first she started her business under the 2010 project to develop and improve farm businesses in the countryside area. With continuous hard work she managed to own her dairy farm. Now she wants to expand her farm business and supply more dairy products to local residents as well as the neighboring area. 

Nasanjargal is a diligent and honest lady who says, "I am working day and night to improve my family’s living conditions." She is requesting a 3,100,000 MNT loan to purchase more cows and equipment for her farm.

loans.use: to purchase more cows and equipment

loans.name: Purificación

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; Este banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Purificación: es casada, la socia  tiene 54 años de edad, ella tiene 7 hijos todos ellos independientes, la socia tiene como principal actividad la agricultura, ella se dedica a la siembra y cosecha de maíz, la socia tiene terrenos de cultivo y también según a las épocas del año ella siembra pasto, maíz, papa y un poco de verduras en las laderas de sus terreno, la socia en esta ocasión desea comprar semillas y todo lo referente a la nueva siembra de maíz, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para su terreno de maíz.

La socia está muy agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sra. Purificación is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Natividad” which is located in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 54 years old, married, and has seven children who are all independent. Purificación’s main business activity is agriculture. She spends her time planting and growing corn. According to the time of year, she grows grasses, corn, potatoes, and a few vegetables on the slopes of her land. On this particular occasion, Purificación wants to buy seeds and other supplies for planting her new crop of corn. The funds from this loan will be invested in the purchase of seeds for her plot of corn.

Purificación is very appreciative of this loan and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and supplies for planting corn.

loans.name: Johana Del Pilar

texts.es: La señora Johana:  de 41 años,  está casada tiene  4 hijos vive con su esposo quien se dedica al transporte pesado (piloto). Doña Johana tiene una tienda de productos comestibles de primera necesidad  desde hace ya 10 años el negocio era de su padre y quien se lo  heredo  a ella, por motivo de salud la tuvo un poco de baja en las ventas de su tienda  por lo que ahora necesita  surtir con mas productos  su tienda por eso solicita este credito para la compra de productos comestibles de primera nececidad y también alquilar un  local para la venta de ropa americana que ya empezó a vender en su casa pero necesita un mejor espacio para mostrarlo a los clientes. Desea superarse e incrementar sus ingresos para seguir apoyando a su esposo con la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en: Johana is 41 years old, married, and she has 4 children. She lives with her husband, a heavy transport pilot. Johana has had a store selling basic and every day food products for the past 10 years. The business was her father’s and he inherited it to her. For health reasons her store saw a decline in sales and it is the reason why she needs to purchase products to supply her store. She requests a loan to purchase basic and every day food products and also to rent a store space to sell American clothing, which she has already started to sell from her home. She needs a better space where to display the products to her clients. She wants to improve herself and to increase her income to keep supporting her husband with their children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase food products to supply her store.

loans.name: Fatina

texts.en: Fatina is a thirty-year-old single mother of four children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in agriculture for two years, which she started with one acre of maize, and now she has three acres. Her hardships are climatic changes and high transport costs, and her vision is to establish a produce store. Fatina needs the loan to pay laborers to weed her fields.

loans.use: to pay laborers to weed her fields.

loans.name: Sonia Lilliam

texts.en: Sonia Liliam is a 71-year-old woman who has operated a door-to-door food vending business for the last nine years.   Her merchandise includes basic grains, milk, meat, and other food products. Sonia Liliam started her business with her own funds and assistance from her son.  She is very proud of the fact that through her hard work over the years, she has been able to buy her own house. The loan will be used to buy more merchandise that Sonia Liliam will then be able to sell.  Her dream is for her grandchildren to have a future full of opportunities.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal De Colorado se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Nancy es socia fundadora del Banco comunal hace  12 años desde que se  formo y le gusta porque son muy responsables sus compañeras del banco. Tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero aún viven con ella. Su esposo es chofer. Ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una Academia en la ciudad de Manta.

Tiene un pequeño taller de costura desde hace muchos años donde cose todo tipo de ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que llegan hasta su taller, elabora todo tipo de prendas tanto para damas y caballeros pero lo que más le gusta confeccionar es la ropa para damas ya que allí hay mas diseños. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar, nos cuenta que lleva más de 20 años dedicada a esta actividad y que le ha ido muy bien.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, botones, cierres y otros materiales para la costura.

Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the Colorado community bank meets in Colorado, in Montecristi canton.  This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts which are famous both nationally and internationally.  It is the home of the famous Panama hat.

Nancy is a founding member of the community bank which was established 12 years ago.  She enjoys belonging to the bank because her fellow members are all very responsible people.  Nancy is 47 years old, married, and has two grown-up children who still live with her.  Her husband is a driver.  Several years ago, Nancy learned dressmaking skills in an academy in the city of Manta.

Nancy has a small sewing workshop, which she has owned for many years now, where she sews all kinds of clothes.  She works on orders from individuals who come to her workshop.  She makes all kinds of men's and women's clothes but what she likes making most of all are women's clothes because there are more designs.  Nancy works every day of the week from 6.00am to 10.00pm and sometimes even later still when she has orders to deliver.  She tells us that she has been in this business for more than 20 years and it has done very well.

Nancy will use this new loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, fasteners and other sewing supplies.

Nancy's dreams are to own a larger workshop and to continue working.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, fasteners and other sewing supplies

loans.name: Matano

texts.en:
Matano is 27 years old and a married father of one child aged six years. Matano runs a food stall in Bombolulu, Mombasa. His business has been in operation for the last three years and has been a success. 


Matano has been a KADET client and this marks his first borrowing to finance his business. With this loan he plans to purchase tomatoes, potatoes, mangoes, watermelon, cabbage and carrots to sell. 


The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. His dream is to prosper in life.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, potatoes, mangoes, watermelon, cabbage and carrots to sell

loans.name: Bacilio

texts.es: Bacilio tiene 53 años, convive con Bertha de 47 años. Ambos tienen un hijo, Antony de 9 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. Su principal actividad económica, es la agricultura. Hacen 20 años siembra, fertiliza y cuida con mucho esmero sus sembríos de papa, arveja, y maíz, que son los mejores de su localidad. Pero no solo a ello se dedica esté exitoso hombre, él también se dedica al cuidado de su ganado vacuno y ovino, como también de los burros que posee, pues le ayudan a trasportar los sacos de fertilizantes para la tierra y el alimento cuando se acerca la cosecha de sus terrenos de cultivo; los cuales trasporta hacia su localidad para posteriormente distribuirlos en la ciudad de Tarma y Huasahuasi. Según cuenta, que en temporadas agrícolas viaja a Lima a comercializar  sus cosechas. Ahora piensa sembrar arveja en mayor proporción, pues es temporada de siembra, además va a complementar con la fortificación de sus sembríos de papa de la variedad denominada “única”, los cuales darán un buen fruto, dentro de unos meses. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Pioneros de Cumutay” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos. Razón por la que se compromete a cumplir con puntualidad todas sus cuotas. Bacilio de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja para comenzar con la temporada de siembra.
texts.en:
Bacilio 53, lives with his partner, Bertha, 47.  They have a son named Anthony who is 9 years old and they all live in their home in the village of Cumutay.  Bacilio's main job is farming.  He has planted, fertilized, and carefully tended his potato, peas, and corn fields for 20 years and they are the best in the area.  This successful man does not only farm, he also raises cattle, sheep, and donkeys.  The donkeys help him transport the sacks of fertilizer and feed as he approaches the harvest.  They transport so they can distribute in the cities Tarma and Huasahuasi.   As he tells it, he travels to Lima according to the farming cycles to sell his crops.  Right now he is planning to plant more peas, since it's planting time.  He will also fortifying his potatoes crops, the 'unica" variety, which will bear a lot of fruit in a few months time.  

Bacilio is a member of the communal bank "Pioneros de Cumutay" and this is his 8th loan with MFP.  He is hoping for a small loan so he can continue to carry out his goals.  This is why he promises to be punctual with his payments.  Upon receiving your support, Bacilio will invest money in the purchase of two bags of seeds of peas to start the planting cycle.

loans.use: To buy bags of peas seeds.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel desde hace varios años quedo viudo, y su única fuente de ingresos que le quedo fue la pensión por viudez, dinero que solo se le otorga por cada primero de cada mes. Para tener un ingreso mayor opto por vender comida en la maquiladora donde su hija trabaja, el producto lo ofrecen sobre pedido a sus compañeros donde le solicitan taquitos,  chiles rellenos, tamales y mas. Para seguir con su venta necesita comprar la materia prima y de esta manera ella obtendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en: María Isabel has been a widow for several years.  Her only source of income is her widow's pension which she receives the first of every month.  In order to increase her income, she started selling food at the factory where her daughter works.  She receives orders from the workers for items such as taquitos (small tacos), chiles rellenos (stuffed peppers), tamales, etc.  In order to continue with sales she needs to buy ingredients so she can increase her earnings.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es:
El señor Carmelo tiene la edad de 38 años, estudio hasta la preparatoria, esta casado y tiene un hijo de un año de edad.

el nos platica que hace un poco mas de cinco años le ofrecio el director de la primaria de su comunidad el vender comida en la hora del recreo y acepto desde entonces vende antojitos mexicanos(empanadas, gorditas, tacos, tortas, tostadas, tacos dorados y enchiladas), refrescos y dulces en la primaria de lunes a viernes, tambien nos platica que los fines de semana vende carne de cerdo, el nos dice que un dia antes sale a levantar pedidos con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad y al otro dia despues de aliniar el cerdo entrega los pedidos y recebe el pago por su productos. El necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra chiles, tomates, cebolla,carne, tortillas, maiz, col, lechuga, sal , dulces, refrescos y cerdos para poder realizar sus ventas.

el espera que con este credio su negocio prospere ya que desea forgar un buen futuro para su familia y en un futuro poder pagar la universidad de su hijo.
texts.en:
Señor Carmelo is 38 years old.  He studied through high school, is married and has a one-year-old child.

He tells us that a little more than five years ago, the head of his community's elementary school offered him the opportunity to sell food at recess, and he accepted.  Since that time, he has been selling Mexican snacks (empanadas, gorditas, tacos, tortas, tostadas, tacos dorados and enchiladas), soft drinks and candy in the elementary school on Mondays through Fridays.  He also tell us that on weekends he sells pork.  He tells us that the first day, he goes out to take orders from his friends and neighbors in the community, and the following day he allocates the pork among the orders and receives payment for his products. 

He needs this loan to invest in buying chili peppers, tomatoes, onions, meat, tortillas, corn, cabbage, lettuce, salt, candy, soda and pork in order to make his sales.

He hopes that with this loan his business will succeed, as he wants to create a good future for his family and in the future to pay for college for his child.

loans.use: to sell Mexican snacks, and sell pork.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is age 63 and married with 9 children. The youngest is still in school. He lives with his family in the Litein area, South Rift, Kenya. He has been in farming for 30 years and currently sells his milk products to the local Kokiche chilling plant, while tea and coffee go to the local market. He has one farmhand.

Philip has requested for a loan 57,700 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the loan will help raise his family's living standard. He is optimistic the farming business will grow.

Philip sees poor market prices for farm produce and droughts as the challenge in farming.

loans.use: To purchase  and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Benkadi Iv Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI IV  est constitué  de 10 femmes mariées du village de SANGOULA  de la sous préfecture de BLA, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 38 ans, au moins 4 enfants et cultivent  du riz de l’arachide et du gombo. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles et d’augmenter les parcelles cultivables pour une meilleure production les membres du groupe BENKADI  IV  ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année elles sont a leur premier prêt de campagne. 
MAISSATA, la première assise à droite avec  T-shirt   bleu,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des semences de bonne qualité, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles pour la culture, exclusivement  au grand marché de BLA. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de BLA  ,YANGASSO et dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail, au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes et qui sont essentiellement des revendeurs.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI IV comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice moyen de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Benkadi IV consists of 10 married women from the village of Sangoulé of the sub prefecture of BLA, region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families, are in average of 38 years of age, have at least four children and grow rice, groundnuts and okra. 
In order to make their farms more profitable and increase the arable plots for a better production, the group members of Benkadi IV have decided this year to integrate the credit program Soro Yiriwaso and they had their first loan campaign. 
Maissata, the first below on the right with blue T-shirt, plans to use her loan to buy seeds of good quality, small equipment and agricultural inputs, exclusively from the general market in Bla. After the rainy season, crops are stored for a while for them to increase their value before being sold at the general market of Bla, Yangasso and surrounding markets as well as in detail and cash, usually to customers coming from the major cities and who are mainly resellers. 
The members of the group Benkadi IV, after the sale of their agricultural products, plan to make an average profit of 30 000Fcfa each, to be used to pay back the loan interests and the current expenses of their families.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs, seeds and small equipment.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. Editha is married and has a vinegar and salt vending business in the Philippines.

Editha requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of salt and vinegar to sell.

Editha has been in this business for 13 years now.

In the future, Editha would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of salt and vinegar to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Daniel le está haciendo falta la barda alrededor para que su familia este segura y protegida de cualquier accidente. 
Solicita el préstamo para comprar el material que es (cemento, block, varilla, arena y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora) ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar este proyecto a su casa. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe del su trabajo como empleado de una compañía de transportes, ya que su esposa la señora Alejandra se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares de sus dos hijos con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajos. 
Desean que sus hijos tengas un patrimonio seguro donde puedan vivir. 
Don Daniel esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual reparo su baño, espero contar con ustedes en este préstamo.
texts.en:
Daniel's house needs a wall around it so his family will be safe and protected from any accident.  He is requesting the loan to buy the materials (which are cement, blocks, metal rods, sand, and payment for the person who will do the improvement), since he doesn't have the money necessary to accomplish this project for his house.

He plans to repay the loan with his salary from his job with a transportation company, since his wife Alejandra takes care of the family expenses and the school expenses of their two children with the salary from her jobs.

They hope their children will have a safe inheritance where they can live.

Daniel is grateful for your help with the previous loan, which repaired his bathroom.  "I hope to count on you for this loan."

loans.use: to build a wall around his house.

loans.name: Suos

texts.en:
Mrs. Suos comes from Kompong Chhnang province where she depends on agriculture for most of her income. Mrs. Suos is married with six children. It is quite a big family and hard for her to support them. Presently two of her daughters are working as house cleaners in a neighbor country. Mrs. Suos does not want her daughters to work far away from home, but due to the lack of finances, they are forced to work there. 

Besides farming, Mrs. Suos spends her spare time collecting palm fronds around the village, and then she attaches the leaves together for sale. This kind of product can be used for roofing. She can earn around $2 USD each day. Mrs. Suos has applied for a loan from Kiva, a partner of HKL, to buy mineral fertilizers to keep her rice crop healthy. With the remaining funds, she will buy some construction materials for her husband who works as a construction worker. With the anticipated profit she will make, she plans to fix her house partially.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and some construction materials.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is a 25-year-old married woman with two children, two of whom are in school.  She has a business selling clothes in Buluk, South Sudan.  She has been in this business for three years.

Hawa requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more clothes for sale.  She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: buy clothes

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
Don Silvio es una persona de  cuarenta años de edad es casado y con dos hijos  estos se encuentran en edad escolar y todavía dependen de el. 
El acude nuevamente a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo préstamo para compra de materiales de construcción para continuar con el proceso de mejoras en su casa de habitación.
El préstamo es para comprar bloque y arena para la construcción de un muro en la parte de atrás de su casa de habitación ya que así su familia va estar mas segura. todo esto para brindarle una mejor vivienda a su familia y a gradece a ceprodel por las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
Don Silvio is 40 years old. He is married. He has two children who are school aged and they still depend on him
He came to the ceprodel offices again to request a new loan. He wants to purchase construction materials to continue the process of improving his home.
This loan is for the purchase of blocks and sand for the construction of a wall behind the house to make sure the family is safer. All of this gives his family a better home. He is grateful to ceprodel for the opportunities offered.

loans.use: purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a resident farmer and a mother of four children aged between 2 and 15 years old. She has been in farming for three years with her milk and vegetables supplied to the local market. She says farming has been the only source of livelihood for her entire family.
Jane has made a loan request of 31,200 KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo. She hopes to raise her family's living standards with gains from her business. She hopes to rise to the level of the major suppliers of dairy products in the area. Like other farmers, she faces animal diseases as the major challenge to her business.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jade

texts.es:
Jade, de 29 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de progresar y salir adelante, es conviviente con Edgar, fruto de esa unión tiene tres hermosos hijos de 13, 8 y 2 años, que cómodamente están instalados en su propia casa. 

La actividad que realiza Jade es la venta de golosinas y bebidas gaseosas, para eso acondicionó un pequeño espacio en su casa donde acomodó toda su mercadería de golosinas e instaló su refrigerador donde guarda sus bebidas gaseosas a temperaturas que les agrada a sus clientes siendo de su preferencias por las temperaturas de éste clima tropical. 

Viendo la acogida que tuvo su negocio decidió seguir,  teniendo ya 7 años de funcionamiento contando con la ayuda de  su hija para atender a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos. 

Lo que le gusta de su activad es el poder estar en actividad, sentirse ocupada y una mujer productiva, ya que le distrae y le permite socializar con los vecinos e intercambiar ideas, logrando así ganarse sus amistad, con éste trato social es que ha sabido ganarse la preferencia de sus clientes, y ahora tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y variar con abarrotes  y abrir una bodega. 

Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se siente cómoda con su grupo, ya que los considera personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de golosinas y gaseosas en mayor volumen y a menos precios, para así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jade, 29, is a hard-working woman who very much wants to make progress and get ahead.  She lives with Edgar and from this union has three beautiful children, ages 13, 8, and 2, and they live comfortably in their own home.

Jade works selling candy and soda, for which she equipped a small space in her house where she arranged all her candy merchandise and put in a refrigerator, where she keeps her sodas at a temperature that her customers like, their preference being for the temperatures of this tropical climate.

Seeing the welcome her business had, she decided to continue.  Now she has seven years in the business, and has the help of her daughter to take care of the customers, who are mainly her neighbors.

What she likes about her job is being active, feeling herself a busy and productive woman, because it distracts her and allows her to socialize with the neighbors and exchange ideas, managing in this way to gain their friendship.  With this socializing she has been able to gain the preference of her customers, and now she has plans to expand her business and diversify it with groceries and open a store.

This will be her third loan with the MFP institution, for which she hopes for your collaboration to continue with her goals.  On the other hand, she feels comfortable with her group, since she considers them responsible and supportive people.

With the requested amount of 2000 PEN, she will buy larger quantities of candy and soda at lower prices to get better profits.

loans.use: to buy candy and soda.

loans.name: Sorm

texts.en:
From Pouk district, Siem Reap province, Mrs. Sorm, 37, a loving mother of 2 school-aged children, is in the business of selling fish, cultivating rice crops and making several kinds of Khmer cake. Her husband is the one who catches fish for her from Tonle Sap River. Typically, she is able to earn an income in the neighborhood of $4.00 per day.  

With this loan, Mrs. Sorm will buy additional fish, which can be dried, and will buy rice seeds for growing in a new season. She is hopeful to improve her businesses and gain more income through using this loan from HKL.

loans.use: to buy additional fish and rice seeds for growing in a new season.

loans.name: Duo Las Victorias Group

texts.es:
Dúo las victorias
Doña Santa Victoria Jacobo y doña Silvia Elizabeth son personas trabajadoras que gracias a dios su negocio a crecido bastante,doña santa vistoria es la lider del grupo se dedica a la elaboración  de suéteres en su casa desde hace 10 años es por eso que nos esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de sueteres  doña sandra se dedica a la venta de refacción en el mercado municipal de la  localidad  gracias al esfuerzo de ellas han podido sacar adelante a su familia y darles una educación, bajo su responsabilidad están sus hijos que  solo quieren lo mejor para ellos, ellas empezaron con un pequeño negocio y con el transcurso de los días ha podido crecer bastante y ahora ya son conocidas por sus clientes por el buen trabajo que ellas hacen, hoy en dia le hacen encargos de suéteres por docena, y también les  encargan refacciones de entrega en actividades especiales, lamentablemente ellas no cuenta con suficiente capital para poder comprar  materia para elaborarlos los pedidos que le hacen, por eso necesitan un capital para poder engrandar mas su negocio y obtener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
"Dúo las victorias" [The Victorious Duo]

Santa Victoria Jacobo and Silvia Elizibeth are hardworking people that, thanks to God, their business has grown greatly. Santa Victoria is the leader of the group and she makes a living making sweaters in her house. She has been doing this for ten years. It is for this that she is requesting this loan from us, to buy raw materials to make sweaters. Sandra makes a living selling snacks in the municipal market in town. 

Thanks to their efforts they have helped their families to get ahead and have given them an education. Under their responsibility are their children, who they only want the best for. They started with a small business and over the course of time have been able to grow greatly. Now they are known by their customers for the good work that they do. Now they are commissioned for sweaters by the dozen. They are also commissioned to provide snacks for special events. Unfortunately, they do not have enough capital to be able to by the materials they need to make the orders that have been made. For this they need capital to be able to grow their business and make more profits.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make sweaters.

loans.name: Yodita

texts.en:
Yodita is a 25-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Yambio, South Sudan for three years.
Yodita is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
Fortaleza es el grupo integrado por 13 mujeres, quienes son amigas y vecinas de uno de los barrios de la ciudad de Encarnación, ellas se unieron pues vieron una gran oportunidad de progreso en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Actualmente se encuentran en el ciclo catorce y desean seguir trabajando con la fundación.
Rosalina es una de las miembro, ella es una humilde mujer que trabaja sacrificadamente para poder mantener a su familia. Su medio de trabajo es una pequeña despensa que tiene, gracias a la cual tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. Una de sus metas es seguir creciendo como microempresaria.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de fideos, arroz, azúcar, harina, aceites y demás artículos de primera necesidad, pues son los que más salida tienen. Tanto ella como sus compañeras están muy agradecidas por la oportunidad que la fundación y kiva les da.
texts.en:
Fortaleza is a group of 13 women, who are friends and neighbors from a neighborhood in the city of Encarnación.  They got together because they saw a great opportunity for progress in the working women's program of Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya.  They meet every two weeks and want to keep working with the foundation.

Rosalina is one of the group's members.  She is a humble woman who works strenuously in order to maintain her family.  She has a little shop, thanks to which she is able to help her family.  One of her goals is to keep growing as a microtrader. 

She is seeking a loan to buy noodles, rice, sugar, flour, oil, and other basic goods, as these are the items that sell best.  Both she and her comrades are very grateful for the assistance that Kiva has given them.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, sugar, flour, oil, and other items.

loans.name: Mwanasidi

texts.en:
Mwanasidi is widowed and has seven children. She lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a food selling business, making dumplings, flat bread for sale. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Gbeme He Dagba Group

texts.fr: GBEME HE DAGBA est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la cinquième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mahoumè Antoinette (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 27 ans. Mahoumè Antoinette est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Darius. Le couple a deux enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Mahoumè Antoinette et son mari. Pour cette raison, Mahoumè Antoinette vend de la nourriture depuis six ans ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Mahoumè Antoinette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Mahoumè Antoinette sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe GBEME HE DAGBA, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du lait, du sucre, des chocolats et du café.

loans.name: Joweria

texts.en: Joweria is a married mother of five children, and three go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sales green bananas at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality of food. She is aspiring of owing a fully stocked stall. She resides in her own house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent,food, and school fees.

loans.use: To bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Maria Analee

texts.en:
Maria Analee is 51 years old and married with one child. Maria Analee works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Analee runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products.

Maria Analee has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future Maria Analee would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To Purchase Cloth

loans.name: Afi Victoire

texts.en:
Mrs. Afi Victoire T. is a married woman and the mother of four (4) children. She is also responsible for her younger sister, who is an apprentice. Her husband, a carpenter, does not receive a very high income from his business. In order to be able to meet the expenses of her family, Mrs. T. produces doughnuts every day and then sells them along the side of the roads in her village. She is an assertive woman, very involved in community life, and was able to pay back her initial credit of $350 promptly and without any difficulties. She is hoping to receive a new credit of $650 to improve her business by buying a supply of wheat flour, sugar, oil, and firewood to produce her doughnuts. This credit will undoubtedly change the course of her entire family's life.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame T. Afi Victoire est une femme mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Elle a aussi à sa charge sa jeune sœur en apprentissage. Son mari, menuisier ne possède pas un grand revenu de son activité. Pour pouvoir supporter les charges de la famille, Madame T. produit quotidiennement des beignets qu’elle vend aux abords des routes de son village. Femme combative et menant une vie associative très animée, elle a su rembourser promptement et sans incident son premier crédit de $350. Elle espère bénéficier de ce nouveau crédit d’un montant de $650 pour améliorer son activité : s’approvisionner en farine de blé, en sucre, en huile et en bois de chauffe pour la production des beignets. Ce crédit changera à coup sûr le cours de vie de toute la famille.

loans.use: buy supplies of wheat flour, sugar, and oil to produce doughnuts

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima D/O Hussain A. was born in 1963. She is married and lives in District 6 of Kabul City. She is an uneducated Women and with four family members. She help her son, who has a general store. During the wars, her financial situation really got bad, and her children had to quit going to school. After the wars she decided to change her life by starting a business. That was when she helped her son start a grocery store. Due to the success of her participation in the loan program, their family income is good and her children can go back to school. She has finished her 1st cycle and wishes to take the 2nd cycle loan so they can be more secure financially.  

***Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the husband or relative of the female entrepreneur.  In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman to the internet but the loan is to the female entrepreneur.***

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, milk, powder, and other foodstuffs

loans.name: Takhir

texts.en:
Takhir is 58  years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in Khirdalan settlement. He is married and has 2 children. He has his own truck.
Takhir transports goods to market, where the building materials are sold. 
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy a car because his car is broken very often and  he needs it  to improve his business.
He has been in this business for 10 years.

loans.use: To buy a car

loans.name: Okpako

texts.en: Okpako U. has a video store where she sells and rents videos. She has been in the business for the past 14 years. She is married with four  children, and is 37 years of age. She comes from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She would use the $400 loan to increase the inventory of her cassettes to sell and rent.

loans.use: To buy more cassettes to sell and rent in her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy  items that are in style and affordable

loans.name: Tise Suli

texts.en: Tise is 39-year-old lady from the village of Tulaele who sells ice cake and pancakes, serving and satisfying her community's needs and at the local primary school. She lives with her husband and 3 kids, all in school.  She works hard during the weekday, making 170 Tala (about US$ 68). This profit helps to pay her children's school fees and also for repaying her loan. She is applying for her current loan in order to expand her business and to renovate her home.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as plastic bags, Kool Aid, and sugar for her ice cake business; also for home renovations

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. M. Sokha, 43, and her husband, Mr. Prach Nhan, 49, have been married since 1980. They have five children -- two sons and three daughters. Sokha’s first son is married and living different house. The other three children are working. Two work in a garment factory, and the other weaves silk at home. Her youngest son remains in school. Sokha and her family are living on an island of Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. She and her husband are raising chickens and doing farming. 

Sokha is requesting her fifth loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $600. She will use this loan to repair her house and to purchase netting suitable for making a roof for her chicken pen.

loans.use: To raise chickens and repair her house

loans.name: Katooke Iii 2039(A) Group

texts.en:
Jesca is 33 years old and divorced with four children. She sells hardware equipment. With the extra business profits, she intends to pay school fees for the children and provide other necessities for them. Faith owns a restaurant and wants to use the loan to purchase more furniture. Justine has a brick laying business. Agnes is a poultry farmer while Rose sells used clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To add in her business

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: A. Arif is  a 39-year-old farmer who has been selling dairy products to the local bazaar traders since 2000. He lives with his wife and son in a small village in the  Saatli region. He applied for 1200 USD to purchase 20 sheep for 60 USD each. Mutton is in very high demand all across Azerbaijan and people use mutton in their every-day life. Arif believes that it will help him  improve the living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sheep

loans.name: Masan

texts.fr:
Mrs. Masan T. is 39 years old and is the married mother of 5 children. She operates a restaurant in the central market of Avenonou, a small village located about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this loan, she hopes to buy 5 bags of rice, 2 tins of cooking oil, and 5 cartons of canned tomatoes for the preparation of traditional dishes. She hopes to sell these dishes to vendors at the market. She hopes that this loan will allow her to increase the capacity of her restaurant so that she can better respond to the needs of her family using the profits made by selling these traditional dishes.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame T. Masan est âgée de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle opère en restaurant au marché d’Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Avec ce crédit, elle souhaite acheter 5 sacs de riz, 2 bidons d’huile, et 5 cartons de tomates en boîtes pour la préparation des plats traditionnels. Elle espère revendre ces plats aux commerçants et revendeurs du marché. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son entreprise en restauration et par là participer à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille par les profits qu’elle va dégager dans la vente de ses plats.

loans.use:
purchasing 5 bags of rice, 2 tins of cooking oil, and 5 cartons of tomatoes

acheter 5 sacs de riz, 2 bidons d’huile, et 5 cartons de tomates

loans.name: Gladys Eulalia Del S

texts.es:
Gladys is a single mother of two children, ages 17 and 8. She started her business when she realized that she could not cover all their expenses with her salary. She decided to start selling hamburgers and hot dogs out of her brother in-law's house. Gradually she started to get customers and now she wants to give her business a better presentation.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $400, that she will pay in 6 months, to purchase a grill and a display case made of aluminum and glass. With your support Gladis will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Gladys, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 8 años. Empezó su negocio al ver que no alcanzaba a cubrir sus gastos con el salario que ganaba, por lo que decidió iniciar la venta de hamburguesas y hot dogs en casa de su cuñado, poco a poco fue ganando clientes y ahora desea montar el negocio con una mejor presentación.

Solicita un crédito por US $400 que pagara 6 en meses para adquirir una parrilla y una vitrina de aluminio y cristal. Con tu apoyo Gladis saldrá adelante.

loans.use: To purchase a grill

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials for her small beauty parlor

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phạm Thị Hà, 33 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2004. She has two school aged children. Her family’s activities includes farming rice paddy, raising livestock and fishing. Altogether would earns her about 3,000,000 VND a month in average. She uses the funds of her loans to invest in fishing gears and nets. She is applying for a loan of 6,000,000 VND to invest in fishing gears.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Phạm Thị Hà 33 tuổi, Tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2004, nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị là làm ruộng, chăn nuôi và đánh cá, ngoài công việc đồng ruộng và chăn nuôi những lúc nhàn dỗi chị lại tham gia đánh cá cùng chồng chị, với nghề đánh cá trong nhiều năm khi tham gia vay vốn của Quỹ, gia đình chị đều đầu tư vào mua sắm lưới và các đồ nghề phục vụ việc đánh bắt cá, công việc đánh bắt cá diễn ra đều đặn hàng ngày, bình quân mỗi ngày gia đình chị thu nhập từ đánh cá 100.000đ. chị có 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 6.000.000đ mua sắm đồ nghề đánh cá. Thu nhập bình quân 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Agriculture

loans.name: Rith

texts.en:
Mrs. Rith T. is a farmer in the Bakpring Village of Pursat Province. She lives with her husband and their three children. Two of her children are bricklayers, and they each earn approximately $2 per day. Meanwhile, T. grows rice on her farmland, and she is able to earn approximately $1 per day.

Because of increasing demand for her rice, she is now seeking a loan in the amount of $150 to purchase fertilizer. In turn, the fertilizer will help her increase her yield and will thereby increase her income for the benefit of her entire family.

loans.use: To increase her rice yield by purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Mwanahamisi's Haki Na Lawama Group

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is 28 year old and married with 3 children, aged 10, 3 and 1. She has been a fish and spice seller since 1999. Every day she works from 7 AM to 9 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Mwanahamisi now hopes for a loan to buy more fish and spices for sale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses dealing with charcoal sales, fish sales, clothes sales and a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy more fish and spices for sale.

loans.name: Keyling Liduvine

texts.es: Keyling es habitante del Barrio Villa Reconciliación  es una joven de 24 años, Licenciada en Administración de Empresas y labora para una Empresa de Transporte llamada Nicatransport, S.A. desempeñándose como Gestor Aduanero desde hace un año. Ella esta casada y su esposo trabaja como engrasador de Vehículos y la apoya con los gastos del hogar, tienen una bebe de 1 ½ año y su mayor sueño es poder brindarle una casa digna con los espacios definidos  y por eso que solicita su préstamo para mejoras de su vivienda, va a construir el porche. En un futuro ella quiere ser la dueña de un negocio propio ya que su papa es dueño de un taller de enderezado y pintura y ella le apoya en la administración del mismo desde hace 7 años y  ha adquirido buena experiencia en este ramo.
texts.en:
Keyling lives in the Barrio Villa Reconciliacion. She is a young woman, 24 years old, with a college degree in Business Administration, and she works for a Transportation business called Nicatransport, S.A. as a customs solicitor for a year now. She is married and her husband works as a vehicle greaser and helps out with the household expenses. They have a baby girl who is 1 and a half years old, and their greatest dream is to be able to offer her a decent house with separate defined spaces. This is why she requests a loan to improve her house, to construct the porch. In the future, she wants to own her own business because her father owns a repair shop and she has been helping him with the administration of that business for 7 years, and in the process acquired considerable experience in this field.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a porch

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga C., 39, and her husband, Mr. Ang Chea, 49, live on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1986 and have three children; two sons and one daughter. One son studies at University and the other son works in a garment factory. Their only daughter sells vegetables.

Nga and her husband have been farming since 1994. They grow many types of vegetables such as tomatoes, papayas, and spinach to sell to middle men in the village who then take it to sell in Phnom Penh. Nga is requesting a loan of 400 to pay school fees for her son who studies in University and some amount for growing vegetables.

loans.use: Nga would like to pay school fees for her son who is at University, and for growing vegetables.

loans.name: Djiguisseme (Soutien) Group

texts.fr:
Issue toutes de la communauté peuhl (Ethnie spécialisée dans l’élevage au Mali), les membres du groupe Djiguisseme sont en majorité des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 24 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Marka-Coungo (Région de Koulikoro République du Mali).
Liées par des relations de parenté et professionnel, ce groupe fait essentiellement l’achat et la vente de lait et ses dérivés (lait frais, caillé, du crème et du beurre de vache).    
Le groupe Djiguisseme est à son septième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe) avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt, 700 litres de lait auprès des éleveurs sur place à Marka-Coungo et dans les villages environnants. Une partie du lait est vendue à l’état frais, et l’autre partie(caillée et les dérivés du lait)est vendue dans le marché de Marka-Coungo à une clientèle composée de résidents et de  grossistes venant des grandes villes telles que Bamako(capitale de la république du Mali), Fana et Koulikoro. Cette opération est renouvelée chaque 2 jours si bien la marge bénéficiaire est très importante.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen par cycle de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les dépenses de la famille et reste, renforcé le fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
All born into the Fulani community (an ethnic group specializing in raising livestock in Mali), the members of the group Djiguisseme are mostly married women who average 24 years of age and two children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Marka-Coungo (Region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali). Linked by ties of kinship and profession, this group essentially trades in cow's milk and milk products (fresh milk, curdled milk, cream, and butter). The group is on its seventh solidarity loan (group loan) with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. All of the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. They intend to use this loan to buy 700 liters of milk from livestock farmers locally in Marka-Coungo and from surrounding villages. A portion of the milk is sold fresh, and the rest (milk products) are sold in the Marka-Coungo marketplace to customers composed of the residents and of wholesalers from big cities, such as Bamako (capital of Mali), Fana, and Koulikoro. This operation is repeated every two days if the profit margin is very large. They each envision realizing an average profit of 40,000 francs CFA per cycle that will be used to cover family expenses and the rest to boost working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Pablo Calderon es originario de la ciudad de León y vive en el municipio de El Sauce junto con su familia compuesta por su esposa y su hijo al que tiene que mantener. Él se dedica a su actividad agropecuaria con la que mantiene a su familia que tanto necesita de su apoyo financiero.

El señor C. se ha destacado en la crianza de novillos y siembra de hortalizas y la razón por la cual ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los novillos para desarrollo. Por este motivo es que espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado y de esta forma logrará salir adelante en su actividad a la que se dedica.
texts.en:
Mr. Pablo Calderon is originally from the city of Leon, and he lives in the town of El Sauce with his family, which are his wife and son whom he cares for. He supports his family through farming, and needs your financial support. Mr. Calderon has focused on raising cattle and planting vegetables. Therefore, he has asked for Kiva partner Ceprodel's help by applying for a loan to buy more cattle and expand. Because of this, he is hopeful and confident that his loan will be authorized, allowing him to advance in his work.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Amelia Milagros

texts.en:
Amelia is a member of the Ayllu (Family) Village Bank. She is 26 years old and is married without any children. Amelia has a dry goods store on Independencia Avenue, one of Ayacucho’s main streets. She works alone seven days a week from 6am-12pm or 2pm, and from 4pm-9pm. She has been running the store for the past two years, and will soon start a second job working in an office as an administrator.  

Amelia is requesting a loan of 900 soles to start selling clothing in her store. She will buy the clothing in Lima, which is about 8 hours from Ayacucho. Her goal for the future is to have a country house of her own.

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Yokub

texts.en:
Yokub T. is 50 years old. He is married with 3 children. Yokub is an optimistic, hard-working father. He works his land with love and dedication every day, so that it produces excellent vegetables. Yokub has been in agro-business for more than 8 years. In fact, he draws strength and vitality to make his products the best in the city.

Though growing vegetables is a very difficult and time-consuming job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest. He is planning to fix up his house and save enough money for the future weddings of his children. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni which he has committed to repay within 8 months. With the desire to realize his plan, Yokub appeals to your generous hearts for a swift contribution! More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Agamed

texts.en: Agamed A. is a 22-year-old man who sells different kinds of food products in the small village of Imishli City. He is not married yet, but his dream is to marry this year. Agamed started his business in 2003 to bring more income to his family, which consists of his parents and younger brothers and sisters. Agamed also works as a butcher in the local restaurant in the first part of the day, and from 12 p.m. until late night he works at his store. Now Agamed would like to increase his income and purchase more foodstuffs for his store.

loans.use: Purchase more foodstuffs for his store.

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi: Chị Ngô Thị Bình  năm nay 37 tuổi,  chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999 và đang kinh doanh hàng ăn . Anh Tâm  chồng chị là thợ cơ khí với thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Ngoài thời gian đi làm anh cũng giúp đỡ chị rất nhiều vì thế công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị  phát triển tốt và cho thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng.  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thực phẩm phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ngô Thị Bình, 37 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 1999 and currently runs a restaurant. Her husband Tâm works as a mechanic and earns 2,000,000 VND (115 USD) per month. When he is not working at his regular job, he helps Mrs. Bình a great deal in the restaurant, and because of this the business is doing very well and earns the family 2,500,000 VND (144 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 20,000,000 VND (1150 USD) to invest in buying raw ingredients to use in the family’s restaurant.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restaurant

loans.name: Hin

texts.en:
Hin P., 34, is a professional weaver, making $2 each day, in the Takeo province. She is married and has three children living at home, that she supports.

Her husband, Soeun Bol, makes approximately $6 every day as a construction worker. The economic downturn has made construction in Cambodia pretty slow and usually he has no work to do.

Hin would like a loan of $1200. She will purchase wood and carpentry tools for her husband to start a carpentry business. Before doing construction, her husband was a carpenter. Hin P. (right) is pictured with her husband.

loans.use: Purchase wood and carpentry tools.

loans.name: Faafili

texts.en:
Faafili I., 52, is married with six children. She has four years of experience in crop planting. She sells to the village people and the public three days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about $145).

Because she was never able to qualify for a loan through the traditional banks, SPBD loans are Faafili’s only access to capital. She has three previous loans with SPBD. She needs the loan to buy equipment and chemicals for her business as well as to make some home improvements.

loans.use: To buy equipment and chemicals for her business as well as to make some home improvements.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline I. is thirty-two years old and married with two children. She sells clothes and shoes and hopes for a loan to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell. Roseline is thankful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.fr: Y. Abiba est née vers les années 1982 au Nord du BENIN. Abiba est célibataire  sans enfant. Abiba est issue d'une famille très pauvre. Abiba est venue à Cotonou,  Capitale Économique du Bénin  pour  chercher de l’argent. C’est ainsi que s’est lancée dans la restauration populaire. Vend de couscous fait à base de tubercule de manioc appelé localement achèkè. Pour soutenir son activité Abiba a besoin de moyens financiers. C’est pourquoi Abiba sollicite un prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Y. Abiba was born around 1982 in northern Benin. She is unmarried and has no children. Abiba is from a very poor family. She has come to Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, in search of money, so she got started in basic food catering, selling a couscous made from cassava tubers called achèkè locally. To support her business, she has need of funding. This is why she's requesting a loan from ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy five sacks of cassava tubers, a box of fresh fish, and a 25-liter drum of peanut oil

loans.name: Rakhim

texts.ru:
Рахим Ахмедов - мужчина средних лет (50 лет). Женат и имеет 4-х детей. Занимается продажей фруктов и овощей на рынке "Панчшанбе" города Худжанда. Он сидит внутри рынка, и соответственно его арендная плата дороже чем у тех, кто сидит снаружи рынка. Но у Рахима очень качественный и свежий товар, и поэтому Рахим продает немного дороже, чем снаружи. Рахим закупает овощи и фрукты у дехканин. Каждое день ранним утром, примерно в 5 часов утра, Рахим ждет своих постоянных поставщиков, закупает овощи и фрукты и начинает свой рабочий день. Таким образом он зарабатывает на жизнь и кормит свою семью. Рахим наш давний клиент, который кредитуется у нас с 2002 года. За этот период кредитования Рахим расширил свой бизнес. В этот раз Рахим просит кредит для закупки новых фруктов и овощей в этом сезоне, тем самым он расширяет свой ассортимент. 
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.
texts.en:
Rakhim A. is middle-aged man (50 years old). He is married and has four children. He sells fruits and vegetables at the "Panchshanbe" market in Khujand City. He is set up inside the market and, accordingly, the rental of space inside the market is more expensive than outside the market. Rakhim has very high quality and fresh products, and therefore he sells slightly more expensive products than those sold outside. Rakhim buys his fruits and vegetables from the farmers. Every day, early in the morning, at about 5 am, he waits for his regular suppliers, buying fruits and vegetables and then starting his working day. This is how he earns a living and feeds his family. Rakhim, our longtime client, has been a borrower with us since 2002. During this period, Rakhim took out loans to expand his business. At this time, Rakhim requests a loan to purchase fruits and vegetables in season and to expand his variety. MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, providing credit services to the population of Tajikistan. MLF “MicroInvest” seeks to transform itself into a micro-loan deposit-receiving organization. In October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded LLC Microloan deposit-receiving organization “Arvand.” “Arvand” at the behest of “MicroInvest", continues to carry out its mission to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Fruits and Vegetables

loans.name: Rosevilla

texts.en:
Rosevilla Y. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 47 years old. Rosevilla is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosevilla owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting "nipa" for sale which commonly use as roofing the the hut for most Filipinos. Rosevilla has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month (about US $83) for these activities.

In 2006, Rosevilla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosevilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. Rosevilla is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Rosevilla from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Crisologa

texts.en:
Crisologa makes a living as a farmer. Her main source of income comes from selling rice to local community members. She is 51 years old, married and has four adult children.
