They are from the village of Navalan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. Crisologa has been farming for over 25 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP quarterly.

In 2008, Crisologa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in rice field activities. Crisologa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in farming activities. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for a farm

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa es una madre muy cariñosa, vive en la casa de unos de sus familiares junto a sus dos pequeños niños, Ebert de 5 y Mayeli de 3 años, a quienes desea dar unos buenos estudios. Todos los días a partir de las 6 de la mañana, junto a su carretilla de jugos, sale en busca de clientes, a los cuales poder venderles sus deliciosos preparados. Ella vende distintos tipos de bebidas durante el día, por la mañana brinda a sus clientes el popular jugo caliente de quinua (bebida caliente hecha a base de quinua, mandioca y manzana licuada), durante el resto de la mañana vende jugos de frutas, y ya llegada la noche sirve sus saludables emolientes, para calentar a la gente que concurre a su carretilla. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 5 años en esta actividad y considera que los más difícil para ella es tener que permanecer en la calle todo el día, soportando las inclemencias del clima, anhela que su negocio progrese y que pronto pueda poner una tienda donde atienda con más tranquilidad a sus clientes. Este es el sexto préstamo de Elisa con MFP y se siente muy confiada de poder pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causar problemas en su banco comunal, donde es muy querida, ya que es la socia más joven y alegre. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevas ollas, vasos, baldes, etc, para preparar sus bebidas con mayor higiene, ya que las que usa actualmente ya están muy viejitas.
texts.en:
Elisa is a very loving mother who lives in the home of some relatives along with her children, Ebert (5) and Mayeli (3), who she wants to provide with a good education. Every day at 6am, she goes out with her juice cart to look for clients to sell her delicious juices to. She sells different types of drinks over the course of the day: in the morning she sells her clients the very popular hot quinoa juice (a hot drink made from quinoa, tapioca and applesauce), later in the morning she sells fruit juices, and in the evening she sells "emolientes" (hot herbal drinks with curative properties) to warm the bones of the people who stop by her drink cart. Her favorite part of her work is chatting with her customers. She has had her business for 5 years now, and says that the hardest part is having to be on the street all day, withstanding harsh weather. She hopes to grow her business to the point where she can open up a store to serve her clients in a calmer environment. This is Elisa's sixth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is very confident that she will be able to make all of her payments on time. She doesn't want to cause any problems for the other members of her village bank, who care for her very much, since she is the youngest, most cheerful group member. With the requested loan of 2,000 soles, she will buy new pots, glasses, and buckets, so that she can prepare her drinks more hygienically (the equipment she's currently using is very old).

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new pots, glasses, and buckets

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita.
Maura es casada, tiene 46 años y 4 hijos, Maura venD. alfalfa D. manera ambulatoria, sus ventas los realiza D. casa en casa, producto que adquiere D. los productores.
Maura necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. alfalfa.
Los sueños D. Maura son mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maura is a member of the Sarita Community Bank. She is a 46-year-old married mother of four children. She sells alfalfa door to door and acquires the product from the producers. She is requesting a loan of 600 soles (approximately $225), which she plans to use to purchase more alfalfa. Maura's dreams are to improve her business and for her children to be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase alfalfa

loans.name: Maisaa

texts.en:
Maisaa is a 27 year old woman who lives in the Bekaa with her husband and their child. Maisaa has owned a grocery store for eight years. Maisaa requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that Maisaa has requested a loan.
Maisaa is special in her business because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she had financial issues. Maisaa decided on doing her businesses because she wanted to work. In the future, she plans on expanding her businesses.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a married mother of two children. She lives in Nyamasaria where she also runs a charcoal business. She buys bags of charcoal in bulk and sells to other retail outlets. She has applied for Kshs 20,000 to get more stock.

loans.use: Buy more stock

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
34-year old tricycle driver Virgilio G. raised 3 pigs, and earns Php 400-1000 daily in his sari-sari store in Banga, South Cotabato.  In 2004 he started this kind of business in order to provide the basic needs of his family and education for his 2 children.

He joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and would like to request a loan amount of Php 15,000.  This loan would be helpful to finance his business with a lower interest rate.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mrs. Sim N. is a villager in Damnak Sangke village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land in which she cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a fish breeder. Since her fish breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more fish and fish food for the fishery. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living with this loan. Mrs. Sim N. is a 62 year old widow, her child is a construction worker.

loans.use: By purchasing more fish and fish food for her fishery.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 37 years old and married to Jacob, Sr. who runs their vulcanizing shop. Her family lives in the village of Calao East, Santiago City. The couple is blessed with six children, namely: Jacela-16 years old and a college undergraduate; Melanie-14 years old, a high school student; Rose Anne-7 years of age, an elementary pupil; Jacob Jr.-6 years old, an elementary pupil; Jasmine-1 year old and Jacqueline-9 months old.

Angelita manages a store and the vulcanizing shop which is situated where her neighbors frequently pass by. She would like to develop their vulcanizing shop and buy more merchandise for her mini-store to further improve their stanard of living and to be able to pay for the schooling of her children. In this regard, she would like to apply for a loan of Php 6,000 from KIVA lenders for additional merchandise and the improvement of their vulcanizing shop.

Angelita dreams of having a productive business for the future needs of her children. She would be glad and thankful if her request loan is granted.

loans.use: additional merchandise for her general store and  improvement of their vulcanizing shop business

loans.name: Mariza

texts.en:
Mariza C. is from the village of Casinglot, Tagoloan Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old. Mariza is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mariza owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products like pancakes, fruit salad and banana cue in the local community. Mariza has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 7,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mariza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mariza is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mariza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income and support the educational expenses of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Souleymane S. a 34 ans et marié, il vit  dans une famille monogame avec sa femme et ses  6 enfants à Nimbougou dans la commune rurale de Loulouni, préfecture de Kadiolo, 3eme région administrative de la république du Mali.  
Il fait le commerce d’articles  divers de boutique et de céréales depuis  maintenant 15 ans. 
Expérimenté en raison des années dans le commerce, il le mène avec une grande réussite.
Il est à sa troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Les deux  prêts passés se sont  bien dénoués. 
Il compte acheter avec son prêt, 5 paquets d’articles divers de boutique et  2 tonnes de céréales (riz et maïs). Il s’approvisionne à Sikasso ville, à Zegoua et au marché de Loulouni les jours de foire.
Il vend au comptant et souvent à crédit, en gros et en détail, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Il envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour augmenter le fonds de commerce et l’autre partie sera mise en épargne car il ambitionne construire une maison à usage d’habitation à Sikasso.
texts.en:
Mr. Souleymane S. is 34 years old and married; he lives in a monogamous family with his wife and six children in Nimbougou in the rural community of Loulouni, Kadiolo prefecture, 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

For almost 15 years now he has been selling various grocery items and cereals. He is seasoned because of years in the business, and conducts it with great success. This is his third collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. The two previous loans were resolved well.

With this loan, he is hoping to buy 5 packs of various grocery items, and two tons of cereals (rice and corn). He sources his goods from Sikasso town, in Zegoua and at the Loulouni market on fair days.

He sells for cash and often at credit, in bulk or retail to customers made up of women and men.

He is planning to make an average monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA of which one part will be used to increase his working capital and the other will be placed in savings. He is aspiring to build a house to be used as a dwelling in Sikasso.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is 35 years old. She is married and the mother of seven kids. Five of the children are in school, while the rest are learning various professions. She lives with her family in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood. Abena is very skillful and a talented hair dresser. For this reason, lots of people have their hair done in her salon, increasing her clientele base and hence her profit margin. With her fifteen years of rich experience, she has managed to train five apprentices who are now on their own. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service, therefore she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, activators, hair dryer machines etc., to serve her customers well.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, activators, etc.

loans.name: Angel Ramon

texts.es:
El Señor Ángel Ramón García Z., tiene la edad de 50 años, Labora en la limpieza (Higienista) en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene tres hijos a su cargo, dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado créditos con  CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 3 créditos en el mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
 
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en el pago de la mano de obra y en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Zinc, perlines, etc. El cual utilizara para la remodelación del Techo de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de darle mayor seguridad y mejores condición de vida a sus hijos y su esposa. 

Ángel dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel su vivienda ha mejorado y ahora cuenta con más seguridad para sus hijos y esposa.
texts.en:
Señor Ángel Ramón García Z. is 50 years old. He works as a cleaner in Managua’s Mercado Oriental (Eastern Market). He cares for three children, two of whom are of school age. He is married. He has arranged loans with CEPRODEL for three years. In this period, thanks to the financing granted by CEPRODEL, he has invested the three loans in the improvement of the dwelling in which he lives. He is an excellent client.

The loan applied for is for investing in the payment for labor and the purchase construction materials such as zinc, metal beams, etc. This will be used for the renovation of the roof of the house in which he lives, with the goal of giving greater security and a better quality of life to his children and wife.

Ángel said that thanks to the loans granted by CEPRODEL his home has improved and now his children and wife can count on more security.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvement and expansion of a home

loans.name: Anoma

texts.en:
Anoma is a very good business women, particularly because of her tailoring skills. She started her business in the year 2005.  Anoma wants to take loan of LKR 40,000. This loan is needed because she is wants to expand her business.  She has already employed 5 poor women and planning to create more employments with her expansion. 

Anoma wants to use her loan to purchase material for designing different cloths for sale. She is very hard working women and she knows how to achieve her goals. Anoma has a plan to create employment for 50 poor women within next 3 years. This is so that she can feel better by helping other women in the village and be proud of herself.  

She is 35 years old and married living with her husband and his family. She is blessed by one boy child who is going to school in the 4th grade.

loans.use: Buy sewing machine, cloths and other accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Set up a corn mill

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita M. is from the village of Gingoog City. She is 65 years old, married and has 2 adult-aged children.  To make a living, Carmencita runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling food & daily use products in the local community. Carmencita has been in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Carmencita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmencita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase additional products to sell. Carmencita is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP to purchase more products to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 
----------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Rosario

texts.es: La  Sra. Elizabeth Del Rosario V. García, se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria, es casada , sin hijos, cuenta con mas de siete años de experiencia en esa actividad, los créditos que ha solicitado  han sido para la mejora de su vivienda en donde expresa que los créditos son la única alternativa para llevar a cabo tales actividades.
texts.en:
Elizabeth Del Rosario V. García has been an elementary school teacher for over 7 years. She's married and has no children. The funds she has requested are to make home improvements; she has stated that the loans are her only option to accomplish them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Bekishkan's Group

texts.ru:
Бекишкан Байкубатова– лидер группы. Ей сорок шесть. У Бекишкан и её мужа трое детей. Муж Бекишкан и старший сын, которому двадцать пять лет, работают на арендованном микроавтобусе. Три года назад Бекишкан закупила семенной картофель на общие семейные сбережения. Теперь Бекишкан с остальными детьми сажают картофель, и занимаются прополкой, сбором урожай и его продажей. Младшая дочь учиться в школе, в десятом классе. Она и её средний брат активно помогают маме выращивать картофель. Эта работа требует огромного терпения и трудолюбия, чего Бекишкан с её детьми не занимать. Младшая дочь прекрасно совмещает учёбу с домашним семейным бизнесом, что уже является для неё хорошим воспитанием в себе деловых качеств, которые ей пригодятся в дальнейшей взрослой жизни. Сейчас ежемесячный доход от продажи картофеля составляет всего чуть больше чем две с половиной тысяч сомов ($55). Это небольшой доход, но учитывая, что в самом начале, ещё три года назад, они вложили всего около двух тысяч сомов ($50) в закупку этого картофеля, а также то, что сезон продажи картофеля начнётся осенью, то можно считать, что всё ещё впереди. Сейчас у Бекишкан есть планы дальше развивать свой картофельный бизнес. Ещё бы, ведь у Бекишкан есть видение того, как дальше двигаться.  Бекишкан хочет получить кредит и купить семенной картофель сорта «Мандиал», а также расширить площадь посева. 

Партнёры Бекишкан по группе:

Кулукан Куронкеевой пятьдесят два года. Муж Кулукан – временно безработный. У Кулукан есть сын, которому двадцать три года. Он студент одного из столичных ВУЗов. Сама Кулукан печёт лепёшки и разносит по магазинам. Сейчас ей нужен кредит для того, чтобы купить ГСМ на весенние полевые работы. 

Эркин Акматовой шестьдесят три года. Сын Эркин и её муж разводят овец. Сама Эркин находится дома и занята домашним хозяйством и продажей молока. От одной продажи молока они зарабатывают четыре с половиной тысяч сомов в месяц. Эркин обратилась за кредитом, так как хочет закупить ещё овец на откорм. 


Наметжану Асранову тридцать пять лет. Жена Наметжана  - домохозяйка и занимается домашними хлопотами. Наметжан откармливает и продаёт овец. Ранее он занимался крупно – рогатым скотом, но вот уже на протяжении десяти лет занимается только овцами. Наметжан надеется получить кредит и купить овец на откорм и дальнейшей перепродажи на скотном рынке.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Bekishkan B. is the group leader, forty-six years old, married with four children. Bekishkan’s husband and eldest son, who is twenty-five years old, rent minivans for deliveries. Three years ago, Bekishkan purchased seed potatoes. Bekishkan, along with her children, are growing potatoes for sale. The youngest daughter is in the tenth grade. She and her middle brother, are helping their mother. Their current monthly income from the sale of potatoes is slightly more than two and a half thousand soms ($55). It is a small income, but considering that at the very beginning, three years ago, they invested a total of about two thousand soms ($50) in the purchase of potatoes, as well as the fact that the potato season sales begin in the fall, we can assume that they will make a profit. Now, Bekishkan has plans to further develop her potato business. Bekishkan wants to get a loan and buy potato seed varieties called "Mundial", as well as to increase the acreage.

Bekishkan’s Partners for the group:

Kulukan K. is fifty-two years old and her husband is unemployed. Her son is a twenty-three year old student. Kulukan bakes flat breads and delivers to the shops. Now she wants a loan to buy equipment for spring field work.

Erkin A. is sixty-three years old and her son and husband breed of sheep. Erkin is a homemaker and sells milk. Their milk sales bring in four and a half thousand soms per month. Erkin is asking for a loan because she wants to buy another sheep for fattening.

Nametjan A. is thirty-five years old and married. Ten years ago, he was involved in raising cattle, but now for the past ten years, he raises and sells only sheep. Nametjan hopes to get a loan to buy a sheep for fattening to increase his sales.

Translated from Russian by Susan Savkov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Agriculture and livestock purchases

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila E. is from the village of Rogongon, Iligan City. She is 40 years old. Cerila has 9 school-aged children. To make a living, Cerila owns & operates a  sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Cerila has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cerila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Cerila is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Cerila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Fe Y Amor 6,7 Group

texts.en:
Yanira is the coordinator of her group, Fe y Amor (Faith and Love), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the economy is based around the sugar cane harvest and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple, rented structure with her long term partner and two children.

Yanira is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a general store by purchasing flour, cooking oil, charcoal and clothes to stock her store. She will use the profits to save towards her dream of owning her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase flour, oil, charcoal, clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of working tools and grains to sow

loans.name: Yennifer

texts.es:
La socia pertenecen al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; La socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Yennifer;  ella tiene 25 años de edad, la socia es soltera, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia vende abarrotes en el mercado central, La socia vende arroz, azúcar, fideos, conservas, leche y más productos de primera necesidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de abarrotes y de este modo implementar su tienda y tner mayor venta.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The client belongs to the Perolniyoc Communal Bank (named after a waterfall and Incan archeological site). She lives in Urubamba Province, which is in the Department of Cusco. The client is named Yennifer. She is 25 years old and single. She divides her time between housework and her retail business; she sells groceries in the central market. Yennifer sells rice, sugar, pasta, canned foods, milk and other staple goods. She is asking for this loan to buy grocery items. She is grateful for and values the support offered to her through this medium, and she promises to make her loan payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for grocery store

loans.name: Belencita

texts.en:
Belencita S. is from the village of Gingoog City. She is 48 years old. Belencita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Belencita owns & operates a business making & selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Belencita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Belencita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Belencita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make the products that she has for sale. Belencita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Belencita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Javzbegim

texts.en:
Javzbegim A., 39 years old and married with two children, sells fabrics for sewing the national dresses. In business for three years, she has very good taste and is always ready to advise her clients about the appropriate textile to choose for any occasion, two reasons she has many customers. Moreover, Javzbegim’s fabric prices are attractive for various levels of the population as she has a wide range of goods for any taste and any budget.

The income that she derives allows her to educate her dear children, and she hopes that she can continue to provide for them so they can receive an adequate education. Now Javzbegim needs $1500 USD to purchase new fabrics in order to increase the range of goods for sale. She promises to repay the loan without any violation and expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes its role as a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics in order to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is married to M.; they both live in a city called Borewala in Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. She is a housewife who stays at home and takes care of her family. 

Her husband is involved in a timber-selling business. He sells timber at his shop. He has six years of experience in this business. His shop is located in the main market of Borewala. This place is always busy with people. All the necessary things can be found easily there. 

Parveen has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount, he will buy timber in bulk and expand his business. 

Parveen is hopeful that this investment will be helpful for her husband’s business, and he will increase his profits and his family will be able to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase timbers for timber selling business

loans.name: Guillemina Angelica

texts.es:
Guillermina de 52 años, , vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil (la mayoría de habitantes son comerciales informales), ella tiene un taller de costura y también tiene una pequeña papelería. 

Hace 30 años atrás, ella comenzó con el negocio para poder ayudar a su esposo económicamente. El esposo también trabaja como confeccionista de ropa. Con dedicación los dos comenzaron a trabajar confeccionando ropa hasta ahora que trabajan desde las 08h00am hasta las 17h00pm todos los días, tienen una pequeña papelería en su negocio. 

Para poder incrementar su producción ella quiere comprar con el préstamo telas y una maquina de coser, en el futuro quiere tener una distribuidora de ropa con su marca.
texts.en:
Guillermina is 52 years old and lives in Surburbio de Guayaquil, where most of the residents are informal merchants. She has a sewing workshop and also manages a small stationery store.

Thirty years ago, Guillermina started her business so that she could help her husband financially. His job also involves manufacturing clothing. With dedication the two of them began working together to make clothes. Now their work schedule is from 8am to 5pm every day, which includes running the stationery shop as part of their business.

In order to increase her production, Guillermina wants to use her loan to buy fabrics and a sewing machine. In the future, she hopes to have a distribution center where she can sell her own brand of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics & a sewing machine

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: La Sra. Esperanza es una mujer muy trabajadora  en este momento cuenta con 46 años de edad con 2 hijos el mayor ya es profesional y la menor tiene 16 años la cual  esta estudiando en la universidad estatal. La Sra. Esperanza cuenta con un casa en anticrético y su mayor anhelo es poder tener una vivienda propia para poder pasar su vejes tranquila. Ella en este momento se dedica a la venta ambulante de productos de belleza (Labiales, delineadores, bases de maquillajes, perfumes, y otros) ganado el 50% de cada producto que compra por docena, además la Sra. es muy conocida por su trabajos en costura ( Realiza fundas para living , vestidos y arreglos en costura en general, ella solicita el crédito para comprar muebles para su casa, como roperos, sillas mesa comedor, televisor, etc.  ya que a ella siempre le gusto vivir en un ambiente cómodo y confortante.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a hardworking woman. She is 46 years old and has two children. The oldest already works and the youngest is 16 years old and goes to a State University. She lives in a house with an "anticretico" contract (a common contract in Bolivia in which the owner of a house "rents" it for a determined period of time in exchange for a one time payment that must be given back to the tenant once the contract expires). Her biggest wish is to own her own home so that she can have a comfortable old age. She currently sell cosmetics (lipstick, eyeliners, foundations, perfumes, and others) door to door. She earns 50% profit over the products she buys by the dozen. She is also well known for her sewing jobs (slipcovers for couches, dresses and general repairs). She requests the credit to purchase furniture such as closets, chairs, dining table, TV and others for her home since she has always wanted to live in a warm and comfortable environment.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of furniture for her home

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn P. hails from Sto. Niño. She is 45 years old and is married with children aged 22 and 15.

Together with her husband, Evelyn has been farming rice for more than a few years now to provide for her family’s needs. She wants to increase her income for her family’s benefit and so she applied for a loan.

The loan will be used for the expenses of tilling the land in preparation for the planting season and to buy seedlings and fertilizer. Any additional income will go to support her family’s daily consumption and to her child’s education.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Tusooka Kwavula Women's Group 2-Lugazi

texts.en: N. Jane, 49, belongs to Tusooka Kwavula Group 2-Lugazi. This single mother of four has, for the past decade, been in the decision-making hierarchy of her hotel and restaurant businesses in Lugazi town. Before she got established in this business, she was more involved in selling snacks. She also sells firewood and charcoal. She attributes her success, albeit with the many challenges she has inevitably faced, to hard work. In a month, she makes 1,000,000 UGX, and with this loan she wants to pay the refurbishment costs for her restaurant.

loans.use: To refurbish her restaurant

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya P. is married with a grown son. She runs a clothing sales business in her hometown of Novaya Kahovka. Natalya sells women’s clothing items in two local marketplaces. She has been in the trade for 17 years. Currently, her turnover capital is 17,000 Grivnyas. Her monthly net profit is about 6,000 Grivnyas.  

Natalya is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional clothing merchandise for her market vending locations. Prior financial assistance has given her business a boost. The current loan will add to consistent future growth of her business.

loans.use: To increase clothing merchandise stock

loans.name: Glyn

texts.en:
Glyn A. is a married woman who lives in Purok 2, Brgy. Alim, Hinobaan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three (3) business ventures:  a  Food Vending , an Avon dealership, MSE, FX and E-load Retailing and a fishing businesses. Her husband Ronald A., who is 35 years old, works as a Fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have one child who is 6 years old.

Glyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Glyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 7th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to fund her Food Vending and E-load Retailing business so that she could continue to save up for future education of her only child. Glyn A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:
 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of  her food products business

loans.name: Jane Wangari

texts.en:
Jane has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 12 years.  She is 45 years old and married to Wambu Chege. They have seven children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her third loan.  She has paid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings, which she will plant.

In the future, Jane hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato seedlings.

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en:
Jonas C. is from the village of Maribucao, Gingoog City. He is 28 years old and married. To make a living, Jonas owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, breads and canned goods in the local community. He is also buying and selling electronic loads from several networks like GLOBE & SMART. Jonas has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jonas joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jonas is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jonas from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to buy and resell

loans.name: Lubinda

texts.es:
Lubinda  es una madre de familia de 40 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que pertenece a la región Piura y que se encuentra ubicada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su vivienda, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes productos de uso diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Su clientela prefiere su negocio porque ella siempre brinda productos de calidad y un buen trato. El negocio le sirve para ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos familiares y mantenerse activa.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Lubinda is a 40 year old mother living with her family in Tambogrande district, a farming district that is part of Piura region located over four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

She has a store installed in her house.  She stocks daily use items and groceries.  Her customers prefer her because she always stocks quality products and because of her kind treatment.  The business helps her husband meet family expenses and helps her stay active.

She wants to expand her business acquiring more stock items to meet customer demand and has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock items for her store.

loans.name: Unidas Para Triunfar 3 Group

texts.en:
Benito is the one of the members of his group Unidas para Triunfar  (Unite to Win) 3. He makes his home in a simple structure with his long-term partner and a child. He says that his most difficult challenge is to work hard to become a business man.  In the meantime, he plans to continue enjoying studying.

Benito is excited to be taking his first loan with Esperanza. He has had his business for 2 years, starting with some capital he saved. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business by buying salami, cheese, hot dog sausages, etc. He will use the profits to invest in his business and to buy items they need in at home. 

Benito's association with Esperanza began because he wants to improve his business. His  story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti.   His group is located in Santiago, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic.  This area is famous for its tobacco and beef production, but like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, it suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy sausages and cheese

loans.name: Jovanis

texts.en: Jovanis is forty seven years old and a widow who lives with her four children in her own house in Fort Portal Uganda. The responsibility to take care of the family is vested in her and her dream is to educate her children up to university. She  has been selling old clothes for six years now and her business has enabled her to pay school fee.Jovanis needs the loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: Paying school fees.

loans.name: Greziel

texts.en:
Greziel L., 38 years old, is from the town of Panglao. She is married and has four school-aged children. She owns and manages a sari-sari store, selling noodles, bread and other products. She also displays her DVDs and pocketbooks for rent. She wants her business to grow and she is working hard to achieve it.

Greziel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sikinan

texts.en:
Sikinan E. is 33 years old. She is married and a mother of four school-going children. Sikinan is a farmer and she farms her own piece of land which she has been doing for the last six years.

She learned about KADET LTD from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be her third loan. She is planning to spend the loan amount to buy seeds  and employ help in planting her piece of land. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she plans to hire more land for farming to increase her wheat output and use some part of the profit to develop her plot.

Her future dream is that she will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where she can plant more wheat on a large scale.Sikinan is diligent and with the right resources at her disposal, she can achieve a lot.

loans.use: to buy seeds  and employ someone to help in planting her piece of land

loans.name: Rayo De Luz 1 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Ana is one of our businesswomen and belongs to the group "Rayo D. Luz" 1 & 3, composed of 10 members. She works selling underwear for men and women. She makes her sales in her community which is a rural area surrounded by forests and mountains where citizen run their little farms in the town of Hato Mayor, an agricultural zone where some of her customers live and where other borrowers live.

Ana's family is composed of her child her long-term partner. Her most important challenge is to finishing her house. Her favorites activities are to take care of her child and her home. She has had her business for 3 years, starting with the first loan she took with us. Now she is receiving her 7th loan from Esperanza Internacional and, because her loan repayments have all been maD. punctually, she has been able to grow her business with the re-investment she makes from each loan.

She would like to save her profit to build a bathroom in her home. She also wants to proviD. food, clothing and housing expenses. She has a dream that one day not to far off, she will be able to live in a safer home with her family, and have her business on a settled footing.

loans.use: to buy underwear

loans.name: Mary Nyambura

texts.en:
Mary has practised farming in Ndunyu, Njeru town for the last five years; she is also a teacher at a local kindergarten.  She is 36 years old, a single mother of two children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her third loan.  She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer for the next planting season.

In future, Mary hopes to buy more land and practise large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Sundui

texts.en:
Sundui T., 24, is married and lives with his wife and a 1-year-old son in the Hovd province of Mongolia. 

His wife is unemployed and looks after their baby. Sundui began operating a computer repair service in 2005 and opened an Internet center in 2010 in addition to his previous business. He holds a degree in IT engineering and it has been an advantage for him to run his business successfully. 

Now he repairs computers, runs his Internet center and has recently opened a photography studio for his business. He is a hardworking person who says, "My wife has not finished her university yet and I am taking care of my family by my business profits." 

He is requesting a loan of 2,800,000 MNT to purchase more gear for his photography studio.

loans.use: to purchase more gear for his studio

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old, married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Carmen runs a general store in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for 30 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP per month from these activities.
Carmen joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.
Carmen is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her tenth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products such as sugar, vinegar etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy Avon cosmetic products such as perfume, make-up, face and body creams and children's products

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda, es una dichosa mujer de 35 años. Convive desde hace 13 años con Walter, con quien tiene un hijo, Kevin, de 14 años. En unión familiar ellos viven una casa alquilada, ubicada en el caserío de Huaylahuichan.  Para sacar adelante a su hijo, que es su razón de vivir, Olinda, se dedica desde hace 13 años a la siembra de papa, arvejas y maíz, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero pues depende la calidad de sus cosechas. Su buena venta en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde además viaja todos los jueves y domingos a comercializar los cuyes que compra, vendiendo su carne a un mayor precio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder brindarles a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida. “Me gusta trabajar, realizó muchas actividades para poder obtener mayores ingresos”, afirma. Ya que también se dedica a la ganadería, cuidando de sus vacas, carneros y cuyes, que enseba para luego comercializarlos a un mayor precio de venta. Sus planes son poder construir su casa propia, y de esa manera poder tener algo para el futuro, pues ahora puede ahorrar y hacer realidad su sueño, “antes tenía que invertir en la educación de mis demás hijos”, culmina. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva esperanza”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde logró mucho de sus objetivos, pues el apoyo que recibe lo incentiva a desarrollar mejores cosas. Olinda, gracias a su experiencia sabe, que en esta época del año donde se celebra “el día de la madre”, la venta de cuyes aumenta, por ello con el dinero solicitado comprará 50 ejemplares, para su venta.
texts.en:
Olinda, 35, is a lucky woman. She has lived for 13 years with Walter, with whom she has a son, Kevin, 14 years old. Their family lives in a rented house in the neighborhood of Huaylahuichan. To help their son, who is her reason for living, to get ahead, Olinda has worked for 13 years planting potatoes, peas and corn. She cares for them with dedication since she depends on the quality of her harvests. She sells them in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma, where she also travels every Thursday and Sunday to sell the guinea pigs that she buys, selling their meat at a higher price. 

What she likes most about her job is to be able to give her son a better quality of life. "I like to work, I do a lot of things to earn more income" she affirms. She also raises livestock, tending her cows, sheep and guinea pigs that she fattens up to later sell them at a higher price. 

Her plans are to be able to construct her own home, and thus have something for the future since now she can save money and make her dream a reality. "Before I had to invest in the education of my other children" she explains. 

She belongs to the village bank "Nueva Esperanza" and this is her third credit with MFP. She has achieved many of her goals since the support that she receives gives her incentive to develop better things. Olinda, thanks to her experience, knows that guinea pig sales increase around this time of year, because of Mother's Day. For this reason she will use the loan to buy 50 animals to sell.

loans.use: to buy 50 guinea pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Tica Tica, provincia D. Cusco, departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Nicasia;  La socia tiene 56 años D. edad; La socia es casada;  La socia tiene 2 hijos los cuales ya son independientes; La socia tiene un puesto ambulatorio D. venta D. golosinas, la socia venD. en la esquina del colegio Civirichi todo tipo D. golosinas en una carreta, ella venD. también galletas, dulces, papitas fritas, canchitas, habitas saladas, kekes entre otras golosinas. La socia suele pedir que le otorguen el préstamo para poder comprar mercadería y D. este modo implementar su carreta y abastecer a los niños y jóvenes que son sus clientes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. golosinas para implementar su carreta. 

 La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the "Working Mothers" communal bank.  This bank is located in the Tica Tica district, province of Cusco, department of Cusco.
The associate is Señora Nicasia.  She is 56 years of age and married with 2 children who are already independent.  The associate has a mobile cart for the sale of sweets.  The associate sells all kinds of delicacies in a wagon at the corner of the Civirichi school.  She also sells cookies, candy, French Fries, popcorn, salted beans, and cakes, among other delicacies.  The associate is accustomed to asking for a loan to be able to buy merchandise and in this way stock her wagon to supply the children and youth that are her clients.  The associate requests the loan to invest in the purchase of delicacies for stocking her wagon.  

The associate is satisfied with the loan offered and she promises to comply with the payment schedule in the time limit established.

loans.use: to buy treats to sell from her food cart.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom has a mixed farm that produces milk, maize, beans and fruits, which are all sold locally. He has been in the farming business for three years now. He also owns a mini bakery and sells fish to the local market. He is aged 39, married and has 5 children between the ages of 2 and 9 years old. Four of the children are currently attending school.

Tom has requested a loan of 41,600KES in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes that, with the dairy cow he will acquire, his family will be guaranteed enough milk for domestic consumption and for selling. The proceeds from this loan will help him provide his children with a good education.

His biggest challenge has been lack of enough animal feed, especially during the dry spell. He hopes that in the next 5 years, he will have acquired at least 5 dairy cows in order to boost his milk production. He comments that Juhudi should hold frequent seminars for clients like the one held in Kitale town in January 2011.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Holaya Auxiliadora

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal De Colorado se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Holaya, tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo el cual es  mayor de edad y está comprometido,  aun vive con ella junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo. Su esposo es agricultor pero ya no labora por la edad.

Ella es la encargada del bar de una escuela de la localidad, allí vende todo tipo de productos que prepara en su casa y de fabrica, ella prepara y vende corviches, empanadas, jugos de frutas, además de golosinas, sodas, gelatinas entre otras cosas, trabaja de lunes a viernes, realiza esta actividad por diez años y esto le ha ayudado mucho para los gastos de su  familia ahora que su esposo no trabaja.

Este crédito es para comprar sodas, gelatinas, papas fritas e ingredientes necesarios para preparar los bocadillos. Lleva seis años en el banco comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella ha podido poco a poco aumentar su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The 'Colorado' Communal Bank meets every 15 days in Colorado, Montecristi canton. Colorado is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its artisan crafts, recognized at the national and international level.  The town is famous for its [Panama] hats made of 'toquilla' straw.

Here we meet Holaya, 62 years old, married and with a son who is grown and engaged, but still lives with her and her husband and with his little son. Holaya's husband is an agricultural worker but he no longer works, due to age.

Holaya is in charge of a bar, located in a school in her locality. Here she sells all types of products she prepares at home and also manufactured products. She prepares and sells, ceviches, stuffed buns, fruit juices, plus sweets, sodas, and gelatins, among other things. Holaya works from Monday through Friday. She has been doing this for 10 years and it has greatly helped with family expenses, now that her husband no longer works.

This loan is to buy sodas, gelatins, fried potatoes, and the ingredients necessary for preparing sandwiches. Holaya has been a member of her communal bank for 7 years and she likes it because with the loans, she has been able to, little by litlte, augment her business.

Her dreams are to continue working and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: buy sodas, gelatins, fried potatoes, and ingredients for preparing sandwiches.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch, 38 years old, is a farmer. Her husband plants corn to sell; their income is $8 per day. They have four children, aged 21, 15, 13, and 3 years old; two are studying and one is working in a factory. Every month, Touch has to spend $27 on food, $10 on electricity, $7 on school fees, $15 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a corn throwing machine to help make her husband’s career easier. Her husband wants to buy more land on which to plant other fruit to sell to earn more profit as their children will need a lot of money for their schooling.

loans.use: To buy a corn throwing machine

loans.name: Ocomisto Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “OCOMISTO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Nely, la que esta ubicada al lado izquierdo, con una gorra azul y esta escribiendo en el cuadreno de actas. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: producción de leche, tienda, venta de calzados, venta de cerveza.

La señora Nely,  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora en la zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda en general.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para compra de mercadería (compra de fideo, aceite, harina, arroz) que adquirirá de las personas mayoristas  y posteriormente lo venderá en su C.. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el consultorio.
texts.en:
“Ocomisto” communal association begins its first cycle in Pro Mujer (Pro Woman) as a part of the Los Andes focal center.  It consists of ten members, and is run by a board headed by Nely, who is on the left hand side of the photo with a blue cap and who is writing in the passbook.  The businesses of the communal association are varied, and include:  milk production, store, sale of footwear, beer sales.

Nely states that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer, and that she joined the group when invited by one of the promoters in the area.  At present she runs a general store.

The loan she will take out now is to buy merchandise (purchase of pasta, oil, flour, rice), which she will buy from wholesalers to subsequently sell in her house.  This arrangement allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is married and has four children.

When asked why she likes Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the credit extended and the counseling.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, oil, flour, and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for ready-made textile items to sell.

loans.name: Silvia Jannet

texts.es:
Silvia de 35 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Guadalupe que pertenece al departamento de La libertad.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Silvia desde hace algunos años se ha dedicado a vender videos musicales y películas de forma ambulatoria en el mercado de Guadalupe, tiene su propia clientela porque siempre cuneta con las últimas películas que salen y con los ingresos que logre obtener puede solventar las necesidades diarias de su familia.

Ha solicitado a un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más videos musicales y de películas que le piden sus clientes, al contar con mercadería actualizada aumentar sus clientes al igual que sus ganancias, lo que le permitirá cubrir su préstamo otorgado y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.  Silvia es una mujer alegre, trabajadora y con muchas ganas de poderle brindar a sus hijos otras oportunidades académicas y más comodidades en su hogar.
texts.en:
Silvia, 35, lives with her family in her own house that has water and electricity and is located in an urban part of Guadalupe District belonging to La Libertad Department, a zone noted for farming, cattle raising and tourism.

Silvia has been selling music and film CDs in an ambulatory way in the market in Guadalupe for several years.  She has her own clientele because she always stocks the latest released films.  She can use income she manages to obtain to cover her family’s daily needs.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy more music and film CDs that her customers request.  Having up to date merchandise available will increase her customers as well as her profits which will make it possible for her to repay the loan as well as provide her family with improved quality of life.  Silvia is a cheerful, hardworking woman who very much wants to provide her children with other academic opportunities and more comfort at home.

loans.use: to buy more music and movie CDs to stock her store.

loans.name: Sarim

texts.en: Sarim is a rice farmer and her husband, Veng, is a construction worker. They have been married since 1987 and have four children -- one son and three daughters. One is married, one is a construction worker, and other two are garment workers. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh City. Sarim is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work and to buy fertilizer to maintain her rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work and buy fertilizer to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 35-year-old quarry businessman. He is married to Agnes who is employed. They are blessed with five children. He has been in the quarry business for the past two years, with a monthly income of KES 6,000, which he uses to support his wife’s income.

He is applying for his second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. John will use the loan to employ labor in his business to increase his stock. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. 

His hopes are to buy a pick-up for transporting the stones and to educate his children up to the university level.

loans.use: To pay for labor in his quarry business

loans.name: Syrga

texts.ru:
Сырга – 52 – летняя фермерша, живущая на юге Кыргызстана. Замужем и имеет 5 детей. Сырга со своей семьей занимается животноводством и заготовкой и реализацией сельхоз продукции. Сырга начала этот бизнес более 15 лет назад, купив на накопленные деньги корову и сумела развить хозяйство до 6 голов крупного рогатого скота. Прибыль от бизнеса помогла Сырге  дать достойное приданое своим 2 детям и помочь в их собственных хозяйствах.  Ежемесячно, в семейный бюджет семьи Сырги попадает 5,000-6,000 сом (KGS)от продажи мясных и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сырга обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма.
На доходы от кредита, Саргы планирует  дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а в бдущем – женить сыновей и дать хорошее приданое своей дочери.
texts.en: Syrga is a 52-year-old farmer living in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is married with five children. Syrga and her family breed cattle and sell agricultural products. Syrga started this business fifteen years ago when she bought a cow for the money she had saved. She managed to grow her business; now she owns six heads of cattle. The profits from this business helped Syrga provide her children with good dowry and contribute to her children's households.  The family's monthly profits from the sales of meat and dairy products range between 5,000 and 6,000 Kyrgyz som. In order to expand her business, Syrga turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 135,000 Kyrgyz som. She is planning to use the loan for buying more cattle and to use the profits for expanding her business by increasing the number of cattle. In the future, she will use the money for her son's marriages and her daughter's dowry.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria Teresa de 42 años, es casada vive en su casa propia, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Ella cuenta con su negocio que es una panadería, actividad que realiza desde hace 11 años, cuenta con su propia clientela, es conocida por la limpieza y los deliciosos panes que ofrece. Ha solicitado un préstamo para comprar insumos, huevos, mantequilla, harina, leña entre otros. Maria con su trabajo y sus ganas de salir adelante se ha ganado la confianza de sus clientes, con la finalidad de que más adelante tenga un negocio grande donde ofrezca una gran variedad de pan.
texts.en: María Teresa, 42, is married and lives in her own house that has all basic utilities.  She has two minor children in her care.  She has a business which is a bakery, an activity she’s been in for the last 11 years.  She has an established clientele and she’s known for her cleanliness and for the delicious bread she offers.  She’s asked for a loan to buy ingredients: eggs, butter, flour and firewood, among others.  With her hard work and drive to get ahead, María has won over the trust of her customers with the aim of later on having a business where she offers a great variety of bread.

loans.use: to buy eggs, butter, flour and firewood.

loans.name: Handsuren

texts.en:
Handsuren is 57 and lives with her husband in a 'ger', a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province of Mongolia. She has three kids who all live separately. Her husband runs a taxi business with his own Russian SUV. She operates a used clothes business. She was a school teacher from 1990-1998, sold second-hand clothes from 2008-2009, and from 2009-2011 a photographer. She got back into the second-hand clothes business recently, which was the one she had the most experience with and  the most profitable. 

Handsuren is a strong and diligent woman who says, "It was challenging to raise three kids (with college degrees) and it is time to use my money on my own self and rest a  bit." She is requesting 2,800,000 MNT to buy more used clothes at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in Uganda. She is married and has 7 children, all of whom are in school. Rose operates a food stall. She has been in this business for 10 years and she works 6 days a week. Rose sells her products retail at the market. She has requested a loan of 1200000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through a pub. The main business challenges for Rose include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and to sell wholesale only. Rose lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Walter Yamil

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, el señor Walter Yamil   se dedica   a laborar como operador de planta de tratamiento en una institución del estado, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace dos años. Es soltero y con tres personas a su cargo, es una persona con buenos valores morales. 

El señor Walter Yamil ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar la condición de su vivienda en la compra de materiales de construcción tale como bloque, cemento, arena, y pago de mano de obra, para hacer un anexo de un cuarto en su vivienda, por medio de esta obra brindarle mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Walter Yamil works as an operator at a state water treatment plant in the city of Managua; he’s had this job for two years.  He’s single and has three people in his care.  He is a person of good moral values.

Walter Yamil has called on Ceprodel to request a home improvement loan to buy building materials and supplies like concrete blocks, cement and sand and to pay labor costs to add a room to his house to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a resident farmer in Nkubu, Central Kenya. He is married and has four adult children. 

He is 53 and has been in farming for 30 years. His produce is bananas and sweet potatoes for the local market. He also works as a security  guard at the local market.

Wilson has requested a loan of 63,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He will use the additional profits to expand his farming by buying dairy goats, poultry and rabbits. He is worried, however, about rampant animal diseases.

He says the loan will bring benefit to his family by uplifting their living standards.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Adalicia

texts.es: Adalicia con su anterior credikiva compró una vitrina y productos de papelerías con la cual la surtió y vendió con una rotación muy rápida de sus productos. Su actual credikiva lo invertirá en la compra de telas de  uniformes, para responder a pedidos de fin de año de un colegio en un barrio contiguo a su negocio; para la fabricación de los vestidos, Adalicia compra la tela los manda a fabricar en una microempresa cercana y es ella quien los comercializa. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente "Agradecimientos por la oportunidad que me han brindado. "
texts.en: Adalicia used her previous Kiva loan to buy a display case and stationery supplies to stock it and she quickly sold out her products.  Her current Kiva loan will be used to buy fabric to make uniforms to fill orders she has for the end of year from a local neighborhood school next door to her business.  To make the dresses, Adalicia buys the fabric and has them made by a nearby micro business and then she sells them.  Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: “Gratitude for the opportunity you’ve given me.”

loans.use: to buy fabric to make uniforms.

loans.name: Nurana

texts.ru: Ona zamujem. Nurana yavlyayetsya IDP personom i pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoim mujem. Nurana 22 qoda. Ona 2 qoda kak nachala zanimatsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota i pereprodaji ix. Etom u biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyey mami kotoraya toje razvodila korov.
texts.en: Nurana is 22 years old, married and now lives in the Fuzuli region with her husband. She is an internationally desplaced person (IDP). For the last two years she has been raising cattle. Currently Nurana needs a loan of 2000 AZN in order to buy additional cattle for her her and future resale. Nurana has learned how to take care of livestock from her mother, who also raises cattle for a living.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Neida

texts.es: La Sra. Neida  se dedica  a la venta de comida, vive en la zona de el Recreo, ella tiene 42 años y tiene un hijo, su esposo el Sr. Juan  tiene 46 años, el le ayuda con la venta de comida, venden los siguientes platos  como ser  locro, parrillada, chuleta, elabora variedad de plato, venden a dos cuadras de su casa,  hace tres años que se dedica a esta actividad sus deseos son de superación  para así brindarles  a su hijo un futuro mejor, con el dinero del crédito comprara un frízer y refrescos para su negocio,  tiene el deseo de tener su propio restaurante y atender a mas clientes, trabajan mucho ya que es su única fuente de ingreso, La Sra. Neida es una persona responsable y se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Neida sells food.  She lives in the El Recreo zone.  She’s 42 years old and has a son.  Her husband, Juan, is 46 years old and he helps her with the food sales.  They sell the following dishes: locro [stew], parrillada [grilled meat], chuleta [chops].  She prepares a variety of dishes and they sell two blocks from home.  She’s been in this line of work for three years and she hopes to get ahead to provide a better future for her son.  She will use the money from the loan to buy a freezer and soft-drinks for her business.  She hopes to have her own restaurant and to tend to more customers.  They work a lot because it’s their only source of income.  Neida is a responsible person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, soft-drinks and juice.

loans.name: Silvio Alonso

texts.es: A sus 32 años, el señor Silvio se dedica con su moto al transporte de personas en el casco urbano y veredas del municipio de tamesis localizado al sur de Antioquia. Esta labor la inicio debido a que su trabajo anterior le estaba causando problemas de salud ya que trabajaba con químicos que lo estaban intoxicando.  Actualmente, el señor Silvio permite que las personas puedan transportarse y la economía de su municipio mejore. Debido al invierno, la moto del señor Silvio ha sufrido daños, por lo que necesita de mantenimiento que le permita seguir trabajando y así generar los ingresos para el sustento de su familia y una buena educación para su hijo de 11 años.
texts.en:
Silvio, age 32, uses his motorcycle to transport people in the inner city and rural districts in the Tamesis municipality, which is south of Antioquia.

He started this work because his previous job was giving him health problems.  He used to work with chemicals that were poisoning him.

Silvio currently allows for passenger transportation and for improvement in the municipality’s finances.

Because of the winter Silvio’s motorcycle has been damaged.  It needs maintenance, which will allow him to keep working and generating income to support his family.  The income is also to give his 11 year old son a good education.

loans.use: to provide maintenance on his motorcycle - change the tires, replacement parts, and lubrication.

loans.name: Nhóm 07 Thôn 3 Tn - Quảng Vinh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan  works in agriculture, raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.
Lan  has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that Lan faces in her business is lack of capital.

Lan  is 30 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

She is the leader of a seven-member group, the Nhóm 07 Thôn 3 Tn - Quảng Vinh solidarity group. 

This is Lan  first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. 

In the future, Lan  hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to maintain a successful business, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Las Frutillitas Group

texts.es:
Virginia es una mujer de 35 años de edad, casada, tiene cinco hijas de tres, seis, nueve, once y catorce años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de fruta.
Ella es buena madre, optimista, luchadora, constante, fuerte, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ que se mantiene como granero de la ciudad, por la producción de cereales, verduras y frutas, hasta en los distritos urbanos. Maíz, trigo, cebada, hortalizas, frutilla, plátanos, papayas, naranjas, manzanas, duraznos y hasta plantas de tumbo se producen en Sacaba. También tienen granjas de pollos e incluso trabajan en la apicultura.
Virginia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el quechua y habla español, en el comercio habla las dos lenguas 
(la primera de la izquierda, suéter animal  print). Su vida la realiza con su esposo que se dedica a la construcción y sus cinco hijas, de las cuales cuatro estudian en la escuela y la menor todavía se encuentra a su cuidado. La necesidad por generar mejores ingresos económicos para solventar los gastos de sus cinco hijas la hizo conformar una banca de personas con negocios como; tienda de barrio, carnicería, tienda de videos, venta de sándwiches, artesanía en yeso, venta de refrescos y librería, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios.
