In 2010, Marilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marilyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Topurchase fertilizers

loans.name: Avon Group

texts.es:
El grupo Avon lo conforman cuatro mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedora una de ella es la señora Deysi María Áreas  de 48 años quien vende ropa desde hace 3 años quien en sus inicios comercializando ropa usada. Ella invertirá el crédito en camisas, blusas, vestidos, faldas y zapatos que tiene de encargos. 
Las otras integrantes son Ninex B. quien vende ropa y zapatos desde hace tres años, Catalina M. comercializa ropa y Yahira L. vende productos Avon.
texts.en:
The Avon Group consists of four hardworking, industrious, and enterprising women. One of them is Sra. Deysi María Áreas, age 48, who has been selling clothing for three years. She started out selling used clothing. Deysi will invest her loan in shirts, blouses, dresses, skirts, and shoes for which she has received orders.

The other members are Ninex B. who has been selling clothing and shoes for three years, Catalina M. who sells clothing, and Yahira L. who sells Avon products.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia C. is from the village of Nagrumbuan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 50 years old. Virginia is widowed and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a business venture in retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling some grocery items and other basic commodities in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Virginia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Virginia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has one child, who is currently in school. Betty has a restaurant business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase and store food for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Betty hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to build a house and educate her child. Betty is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to be hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase and store food for resale

loans.name: Mujeres Talentosas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres  Talentosas” cumple actualmente su 5º ciclo y se formó gracias al espíritu emprendedor que las mueve para cada jornada laboral, sus integrantes ya realizan una actividad productiva, por lo que ya se desenvuelven cada una en su propia microempresa,  utilizan su crédito para  fomentar y variar la actividad que ya están realizando como ser: compra de artículos de ocasión como ropas, zapatillas, championes, calzados deportivos ,kepis, gorras, etc.
La sra. María D. por ejemplo compra y vende ropas dentro de su barrio y alrededores para poder provver un ingreso económico a su familia de modo que vivan dignamente.
Todas las integrantes redoblan esfuerzos tratando de mejorar sus ingresos y así poder ofrecer a sus hijos la posibilidad de acceder a una buena preparación académica y por consiguiente una buena opción laboral.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Talentosas” (Talented Women) communal bank is currently in its 5th cycle.  It was formed thanks to the enterprising spirit that motivates them each working day.  Its members are already involved in a productive activity so each one is developing in her own micro business.  They use their loan to foster and vary the activity they are already carrying out such as: purchase of seasonal items like clothes, sandals, athletic shoes, footwear, sportswear, caps, hats, etc.

Mrs. María D., for example, buys and sells clothes in her neighborhood and adjacent areas to provide income for her family so that they can live properly.

All the members double their efforts in an attempt to improve their income and offer their children the possibility of accessing a good academic preparation and thus good employment options.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, jeans, caps, shorts, Capri pants, scarves, gloves, etc.

loans.name: Dorian Orquidea

texts.es:
Doña Dorian  F. es comerciante y su actividad es la venta de cosméticos, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
Doña Dorian vende su producto de manera ambulante en diferentes partes de esta ciudad como ser: fabricas de puros y oficinas gubernamentales. sus productos los vende al credito. sus clientes las prefieren debido a la amabilidad con la que ella atiende y por la calidad del producto que vende.
Doña Dorian convive en unión libre y con su compañero de hogar han procreado a dos hermosas niñas, una de ellas tiene meses de edad y la mayor actualmente esta en Pre-kinder, nos comentaba doña Dorian que sus dos hijas son las que la animan a seguir adelante y asi ofrecerles un buen futuro.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de cosmeticos al por mayor para obtener mayores ganancias en las ventas.
texts.en:
Mrs.Dorian F. is a merchant and her activity is selling cosmetics. She has been doing this activity for 3 years.

Dorian sells her products as a vendor in different parts of the city, for example in cigar factories and government offices. She sells her products on credit. Her customers prefer her because of the friendliness she serves them with and the quality of the products she sells. 

Dorian is in a common law marriage and she and her husband have two beautiful daughters together. One of them is only months old and the oldest is in pre-school at this time. Dorian told us that her two daughters are what encourages her to get ahead to offer them a good future.  

She will use the loan to buy cosmetics wholesale to obtain more earnings with the sales.

loans.use: To buy creams, deodorants, lotions, baby oil, talcum powders, perfumes, lipsticks, nail polish and t-shirts.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia is a married woman who lives in Puerto Princesa, Palawan. She earns her living operating a fruit and vegetable vending business .Her husband Teodoro, who is 62 years old, works as an ice cream vendor to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have seven children who are between 9 and 27 years old. Letecia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Letecia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,500 to buy more stock of  fruits and vegetables for trading so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Letecia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Kokou Antoine

texts.fr: Monsieur Antoine est marié avec 5 enfants à charge. Il a 39 ans.  Il exerce comme activité la soudure. Il a démarré en 1999 son activité et achète les outils de travail au grand marché de Lomé. Il a son atelier à Avépozo où il habite.  Il sollicite un prêt pour faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en: Mr Antoine is a married 39 year old, with five children in his care. He began working in the soldering trade  in 1999 and buys his tools from the great market at Lomé. He lives, and has his studio, in Avépozo.  He is seeking a loan in order to meet his customers' growing demand.

loans.use: to purchase iron

loans.name: Najib

texts.ar: نجيب في عمر 48 سنة متزوج وله 5 اولاد يعمل في تربية الدجاج والطيور له في عمله 15 سنة يتمز بأسعاره المنخفضة وعمله الجيد له زبائن من محيطه وغيره حيث انه يتميز الدجاج الذي يربيه بالشكل الجيد لا يواجه صعوبة في المنافسة لكن الصعوبة في المادة التي تحد من تطوره له خبرة كبيرة في هذا المجال يريد ان يؤمن العيش الكريم له ولعائلته يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء العلف للدجاج + الماكنة لطحن العلف يحلم بأن يصبح صاحب مزرعة كبيرة تضم جميع انواع الدواجن
texts.en: Najib is 48 years old and married with five children. He raises chicken and other birds for a living, and he has 15 years of experience in this line of work. He stands out in his business by virtue of his low prices and good work. That he has customers not only from his community but also from other communities is the result of the high quality of the chickens that he raises. The competition in his field does not pose difficulties for him; however, material concerns do. These difficulties limit how much he can develop his business. He has a lot of experience in his field. He would like to secure a respectable life for himself and for his family. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy chicken feed as well as a machine to grind the feed. He dreams of owning a big farm on which he will raise all of the different kinds of poultry.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed as well as a machine to grind the feed.

loans.name: J. Refugio

texts.en:
J. Refugio G. is an independent truck driver who started RGE Transport in January, 2011.  Having been in the trucking industry for many years, Refugio finally decided to go into business for himself.  He contracts with a transportation company that specializes in moving fruits and vegetables.  Originally from Guanajuato, Refugio moved to Edinburg in 1993.

Refugio used this loan to help buy his truck.  He was referred to ACCION Texas-Louisiana by the truck dealer who sold him his trailer.  Without this loan, Refugio doesn’t know when he would have been able to buy his truck and launch his business. 

Within a few years, Refugio would like to buy more trailers to expand his business.  “Echanle ganas!”  His advice to fellow entrepreneurs is, “Go for it, and open your business!  With dedication, everything is possible.”

loans.use: to buy a truck for his business.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “ PRO DESARROLLO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Pisac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Calca, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Ceferina, ella tiene 57 años de edad, la socia es soltera y tiene 4 hijos de 38, 37, 36, 15 años de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención de su restaurante, la socia tiene un restaurante el cual ella misma se encarga de los alimentos y de todo lo referente a la buena disposición del local, la socia siempre invierte su dinero de los bancos comunales en la mejora de cubiertos, remplazo de vajillas, y en la compra de ingredientes y productos al por mayor para que le salga a cuenta, la socia desea comprar algunos servicios como vajilla y sal, aceite, fideos, arroz al por mayor, la socia también se encarga de vender caldo de gallina y extras en especial los días feriados y domingos. La socia solicita el préstamo en la compra de servicios para el restaurante y mercadería.

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called “PRO DESARROLLO” (Pro Development) and is located in the town of Pisac which belongs to Calca Province, Cusco Department.

The member is Ceferina, 57.  She’s single and has four children who are 38, 37, 36 and 15 years of age.  She alternates her household chores with running a restaurant.  She has a restaurant that where she, herself, is in charge of cooking the meals and of everything related to the good running of the establishment.  She always invests her money from the communal banks to improve her eating utensils, to replace dinnerware and to buy ingredients and products at wholesale so that she can afford them.

She wants to buy dinnerware, salt, oil, noodles and rice at wholesale.  She also sells chicken soup and extras especially during feast days and Sundays.  She is asking for the loan to buy eating utensils and merchandise for the restaurant.

She is grateful and wants to express that she will meet her installment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy dinnerwear and merchandise for the restaurant.

loans.name: Roberto Daniel

texts.es:
Roberto de 30 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, tiene un taller de servicios técnicos “maquinaria pesada”, esta casado y ella vende productos por catálogos ropa y comesticos tienen un hijo de 2 años,

Empezó hace 10 años y escogió esta actividad porque desde pequeño ayudaba al papa en el negocio. El labora de 7H00 am a 18H00 pm con ayuda de una persona. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere invertir en su negocio con repuestos se maquinaria y ayudar a su esposa en las mercadería de ropa y comesticos por catálogos para incrementar sus ganancias. Su sueño es tener su casa, seguir con su negocio y familia juntos y que D-miro siga dándole créditos para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Roberto, 30, lives in an urban zone in El Guasmo (named after a species of tree: Guazuma ulmifolia.  El Guasmo is a popular neighborhood of humble class that used to be a hacienda in Guayaquil).  His house is cement and has all basic utilities.  He has a shop providing technical services: “heavy machinery.”  He’s married and his wife sells clothing and cosmetics via catalogue.  They have a two-year-old son.

He started out 10 years ago and chose this occupation because he had helped his father since he was a little boy.  He works from 7am until 6pm with help from one person.  With help from the loan he wants to invest in his business buying spare parts for his machinery and help his wife with her catalogue clothing and cosmetics merchandise to increase her earnings. 

His dream is to have a house, stay in business, remain together as a family and that D-Miro will continue giving him loans in order to improve his business.

loans.use: to invest in his wife's catalogue clothing sales business and to buy machinery replacement parts.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en:
Moussa is 41 years old and he is married. He sells shoes. His business is well-organized and he has two years of experience. He currently employs one person to help him. His business operates from 6 am to 7 pm every day. 

Moussa has requested a loan from kiva lender in order to purchase more women's shoes to sell. With this profit, he will reinvest in his business and save money for his future.

loans.use: to purchase more women's shoes to sell.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 38 years old.  She is lesbian and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental.

Geraldine own a mini grocery store that sells all kinds of food and refreshments.  She inherited this business from her parents and has been running it for two years.  She earn PHP 6,000 a month in income.   The buildling materials of her store are much too old and need to be replaced.  So, Geraldine went to GDMPC to request a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase new building materials to renovate her store. 

Geraldine is a new member of GDMPC.  In the future, she hopes that she can build a larger store that has many stocks to sell.

loans.use: renovate her store

loans.name: Jargal

texts.en:
Jargal is 45 years old and lives with her husband and five children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband works as a driver at a private company while her older daughter helps with the family business. Her second child, age 20, works at a construction company and her younger two children go to a secondary school. 

Jargal manages a clothing-trading business at a rented stall at a trading center. She started her business in 2011. Her stall is located in a very good place, therefore her earning is quite high compared with other salespersons. She plans to have her own stall in the future, so she can save her rent payment. She is a polite woman who says, "I want to have my own working place in the future." She is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT loan to purchase a container for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a container

loans.name: Fenix Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se llama “Fénix” está conformado por 18 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre ellos amasandería, peluquería, venta de alimentos, corte y confección. Todos ellos pertenecientes  a la ciudad de Talca. 
Sara quien en la foto se encuentra en primera fila, en el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, vistiendo un sweater color morado y jeans. Se dedica durante la semana a la venta de carbón, labor que realiza desde su casa. Durante los fines de semana se dedica a preparar y vender comida rápida, específicamente sopaipillas, empanadas de queso y papas fritas. Su horario laboral es a partir de las 16ºº horas hasta las 03ºº de la madrugada, ya que es durante éste horario en el cual los clientes frecuentan su negocio. Ella se instala con una parrilla, en una esquina cercana a su casa.
Sara trabaja en éste rubro desde hace un año, comenta que le ha ido muy bien desde que inició su negocio. Los ingredientes para preparar sus alimentos los compra en supermercados mayoristas y en una feria de agricultura.
Con el crédito comprará carbón, un quintal de harina, levadura, aceite, sal, papas y cartuchos de papel. 
Sus metas son tener un carro que cuente con las condiciones de salubridad, específicamente agua. 
Sara vive junto a su marido y está esperando la entrega de su casa propia, ésta será durante el próximo año. Dependiendo de ésta entrega Sara pretende instalar su negocio en su casa nueva. 
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida del crédito entregado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha servido para invertir en su negocio y generar mayores ganancias. Respecto al grupo del banco comunal al cual pertenece, éste es muy unido y Sara ha podido conocer otras experiencias de socias con sus negocios. Además está muy motivada y participa activamente de las reuniones, puesto que es secretaria del banco comunal. 
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
This community bank is called “Fénix” (Phoenix).  It is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who work in different businesses including: a bakery, a hairdressing salon, a food sales business and a dressmaking business.  They all live in the city of Talca.

Sara is in the front row of the photo, second from the left, wearing a purple sweater and jeans.  During the week, she sells charcoal from her home.  On weekends, she makes and sells fast food, specifically 'sopaipillas' (a type of fried pastry or quick bread), cheese empanadas and fries.  She works from 4.00pm to 3.00am as this is when her customers come to her business.  She sets herself up with a grill on a corner near her home.

Sara has been working in this field for one year.  She says that things have gone very well since she started her business.  She buys the ingredients that she uses to prepare her food in wholesale supermarkets and from a farmers' market.

Sara will use her loan to buy charcoal, a 100kg bag of flour, yeast, oil, salt, potatoes and paper bags.  Sara's dream is to own a car.

Sara lives with her husband and they are waiting to move into their own home which will be sometime in the coming year.  Depending on this move, Sara plans to set up her business in her new home.

Sara is very happy and grateful for the loan from Fondo Esperanza as it has helped her to invest in her business and make more profits.  The community bank that she belongs to is very united and Sara has been able to listen to the business experiences of other members.  In addition, she is very motivated and participates actively in the meetings as she is the bank's secretary.

Talca is in Maule region which is located in the central area of the country.  It is an administrative, financial and cultural center of the region as it is the most important city in the Chilean Central Valley.  There is a curious expression in Chile "Talca, París y Londres' (Talca, Paris and London).  Among the different suggestions about where the saying comes from, some say that it comes from something that an English person originally said "Talca parece Londres" (Talca is like London) owing to the abundant mist that frequently covers the city in winter, just like it does in the English capital.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, a 100kg sack of flour, yeast, oil, salt, potatoes and paper bags

loans.name: Prossy's Group

texts.en:
Prossys‘s group is comprised of four hard-working women. Prossys is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Prossy has a beauty salon, which she has had for two years.  She sells food as her secondary business.  

To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase braids for the hair for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Prossy hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Prossy hopes to expand her business. 

Prossy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by expanding her capital that has helped her pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to purchase braids for the hair for resale.

loans.name: Katherin Susan

texts.es: Katherin, de 23 años es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su madre, su hijo y su tía con quienes comparte su alegría y su deseo de superación.Katherin comienza su día muy temprano cuando sale a realizar sus compras en el mercado para realizar su negocio que consiste en la venta de comida en un restaurante.  Su local es alquilado  pero está ubicado de una avenida transitada de la ciudad lo que es muy beneficioso. Ella es nueva en este negocio, lleva pocos meses realizándolo y agradece tener la ayuda de su madre y su tía quienes la apoyan siempre.Lo que más le agrada de su trabajo es que tiene trato directo con sus clientes y lo que le incomoda es que tiene que salir muy temprano. Sin embargo, Katherin sabe que de esto depende el crecimiento de su negocio por lo que acepta el reto para poder seguir hacia delante y así dar una buena educación a su hijo.Este es el primer préstamo realizado entre Katherin y MFP, se siente cómoda por que sabe que el monto solicitado es poco y con las proyecciones de su negocio podrá pagar todas su cuotas a tiempo.Con lo solicitado 1000 soles ella comprará una cocina industrial y una parrilla ya que desea vender parrillas por las noches.
texts.en: Katherin, age 23, is a very hard-working and enterprising woman. She lives in a rented home with her mother, her child and her aunt, with whom she shares her joy and her desire to succeed. Katherin starts her day very early, when she goes out to make her purchases for her business. She sells food in a restaurant. Her building is rented but it is located in a high-traffic area of the city, which is very beneficial. She is new to this business, and has been in it for a few months. She is grateful to have the help of her mother and aunt, who always support her. Having direct contact with her customers is what she most likes about her job, and her main inconvenience is having to get going very early in the mornings. However, Katherin knows that her business' growth depends on this, and so she accepts the challenge in order to continue moving forward and thus provide a good education for her child. This is the first loan between Katherin and MFP. She feels comfortable because she knows that the amount she has requested is small and that with her business projections she will be able to repay all of her quotas on time. With the requested 1000 soles, she will purchase an industrial kitchen and a grill, because she wants to sell grilled food in the evenings.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial kitchen and a grill because she wants to sell grilled food at night.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Veronica works hard to support her family.

She has an ambulant vending business selling bread in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tailoring. Veronica is borrowing 14,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more bread to sell for her ambulant vending bread business.

Veronica has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bread to sell.

loans.name: Yacouba

texts.fr:
Né à Sikasso et âgé de 34 ans, Monsieur  Yacouba est marié et père de six enfants, il réside avec son épouse et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle Bougoula Hameau environ 7 km de la ville de Sikasso  (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Yacouba après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’est initié au commerce de céréales de d’articles divers de boutique, dont il dispose une boutique devant le domicile conjugal où il mène ses activités d’achat et vente des articles  tels,  le maïs, la cigarette, les bonbons, allumettes, Chewing Gum, lait en poudre, thé, sucre, savon, etc depuis plus de douze ans. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il ya environ quatre ans. Ainsi il déjà bénéficié de quatre prêts individuels qui ont été tous correctement remboursés. 
Il sollicite ce cinquième prêt pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acquérir 6 tonnes de maïs, 15 cartouches de Cigarettes différentes, 3 cartons du thé, 4 sacs du sucre, 8 paquets de lait en poudre, 5 paquets de bonbons, 10 paquets de Chewing Gum, 30 paquets d’allumettes et 5 cartons de savon. 
 S’approvisionnant auprès de commerçants grossistes de la ville de Sikasso et environnants, il revend ses marchandises en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de toutes sortes de couches sociales de sa localité.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in Sikasso and 34 years of age, Mr. Yacouba is married and the father of six children. He lives with his spouse and   children in a big traditional family in the village of Bougoula, about 7 km from the city of Skiasso (the third administrative region of Mali).

After having tried different business activities without success, Mr. Yacoubal started selling cereals and various first-need items from a store in front of his family home.  For over a dozen years, he has been selling articles such as corn, cigarettes, candy, matches, chewing gum, milk powder, tea, sugar, soap., etc. He is much sought after by his customers due to the quality of his goods.

In order to meet the growing customer demand,   about four years ago he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution about four years ago. And  thus he already obtained four individual loans and repaid all of them well.

He is now seeking  his fifth loan in order to increase his working capital and buy six tons of corn, 15 cartions of various cigarettes, three boxes of tea, four bags of sugar, eight packs of milk powder, five packs of bandy, ten packs of chewing gum, 30 packs of matches and five boxes of soap.

He  buys his goods from wholesalers in the town of Sikasso and in nearby area and sells retail, for cash and on credit to customers coming from all social segments in his neighborhood.

With this loan, he plans to achieve a monthly income of 100,000 West African francs, which will be used to offset family expenses and pay the interest on his loan, with the rest reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals and various first-need items

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William, 61, is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. He has been in farming for 30 years and has two farmhands. His farm produces milk and maize. He is married with 18 children, 12 of whom are attending school while the other six are adults. He owns a motorcycle which makes deliveries for him and for other farmers at a fee.

He has made a loan request of 100,000 KES with Juhudi Kilimo in order to start poultry farming at 60,000 KES and use the other 40,000 KES to  construct a modern dairy unit. His previous loans of 65,000 KES were successfully repaid. 

His focus is to buy a motor vehicle to make his deliveries to the market. He adds that the poultry business will boost his income.

He states that poor infrastructure and animal diseases are the greatest challenges.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds and construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Leidis Mariela

texts.es: La joven Leidis Mariela de 23 años de edad, labora como responsable de Administracionn Tributaria desde hace 3 años desempeñandose con gran honestidad y responsabilidad; esta solicitando su 2do credito con el objetivo de comprar un terreno y en el futuro hacer su casa poco a poco. Según referencias comerciales, laborales y personales, es una joven con muchos deseos de superaciòn laboral y profesional, sus padres siempre la han apoyado en sus estudios, su mayor sueño en la vida es culminar sus estudios universitarios y gozar de estabilidad labora para asi poder ayudar a su linda familia.
texts.en: Leidis Mariela, 23, has been employed for the last three years as a tax collector honestly and responsibly.  She’s asking for her second loan to buy a piece of land on which to gradually build her house.  According to commercial, employment and personal references, she is a young woman with a strong drive to improve both professionally and at work.  Her parents have always supported her schooling.  Her greatest wish in life is to complete her university training and to enjoy employment stability to be able to help her lovely family.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, 49, is married to Daniel and supports a family of five people. She has had her business for two years. 

She has applied for a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more potatoes for resale. The profits will be used to transport her goods to various places in search of a better market. This is her first loan and she hopes to pay it well.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Muzaffara

texts.ru: Музаффара замужем занимается посевом картофеля на 1,2 га земли. Если работать на земле от души то земля принесет хороший доход, считает Музаффара. Отходы от посева сельхозкультур идут на вскармливание скота. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес, но для этого нужны дополнительные денежные средства. Музаффара надеется получить займ и приобрести крупный рогатый скот.
texts.en: Muzaffara is married and is involved in sowing potatoes on 1.2 hectares of land.  Muzaffara thinks that if you love working on the land, then the land will bring in a good income.  Agricultural crop waste goes into feeding livestock.  She wants to expand her business, but needs additional financial means for it.  Muzaffara hope to obtain this loan and buy cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: María De La Concepción

texts.es:
La Sra.  María tiene su negocio de venta de ropa  para niños, niñas y damas en el mercado de Managua, ella tiene veintiocho años de vender en el mercado, ella vende de lunes a sábados desde las tres de la tarde hasta las ocho de la noche.
Ella es casada con tres hijos pero solo uno depende de ella.
Ella ha trabajado once créditos con ceprodel y estos han sido para compra de mercadería para su negocio.
Ella esta solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertir en compra de ropa para niños, niñas y damas ya que las ventas buenas son en estos de Noviembre y Diciembre.
texts.en: María has her own business selling clothing for boys, girls, and women in the Managua market. She has been selling in the market for twenty-eight years. She sells Monday to Saturday, from three in the afternoon until eight at night. She is married with three children, but only one is a dependent. She has worked off eleven loans with CEPRODEL, all for the purchase of merchandise for her business. She is requesting a new loan to invest in purchasing clothing for boys, girls and women, since sales of these are good in November and December.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for women, boys and girls

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is married and blessed with one child. She has been selling utensils such as plates, dishes and cups to make a living. She has been in the business for the last two years. She also does farming to supplement her income. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy more plates and dishes for resale.

loans.use: To buy plates and dishes for resale

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr: Monsieur Boubacar est marié et vit au Sénégal. Il est âgé de 42 ans et s’active  dans le secteur de la menuiserie  en aluminium. Il capitalise une expérience de 25 ans dans ce domaine.  Il a démarré   avec la menuiserie en bois avant de porter  sa passion dans l’aluminium.   Il est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou il vit depuis octobre 2010. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour  la réfection du local qu’il occupe   ou il exerce son activité et le carrelage des lieux. Son objectif est de rendre son local plus attrayant  pour mieux rentabiliser son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Boubacar is married and lives in Senegal. He is a 42-year-old aluminum worker. He benefits from 25 years of experience in this field. He started with woodworking before bringing his passion over to aluminum. He has been a member of the local branch office of U-IMCEC in the village where he lives since October 2010. 

He is requesting a loan of 300,000 frs, which he plans to use to make repairs to the space where he works and to do tiling in the space. His goal is to improve the appearance of his workspace to make his business more profitable.

loans.use: to repair his workspace and do tiling work.

loans.name: Ermanboy

texts.ru: Эрмонбой вот уже более 20 лет  занимается бизнесом. Он занимается купле- продажей крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. Одновременно занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Ему выгодно содержать скот, потому что отходы от выращивания сельхозкультур идут на их корм. Его жена добрая и трудолюбивая. Она помогает мужу с удовольствием, и они стараются улучшить жизненные условия семьи. Эрмонбой хотел бы получить займ для покупки 5 голов крупно 15 голов мелкого скота, а на остальную сумму хочет посеять пшеницу и ячмень.
texts.en: Ermanboy has had a farm business for more than 20 years. He primarily raises sheep and cattle but also grows grains and produce for sale. Ermanboy uses leftover greens from his fields to feed his animals. His wife is kind and hardworking. She loves helping her husband at the farm and the two of them work hard to improve their family's living situation. Ermanboy wants to take out this loan to purchase five more cows and 15 more sheep for his herd, and will use the rest of the loan to plant wheat and oats.

loans.use: To buy cattle and seeds

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth de 45 años, convive con Rodrigo de 48 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 1 hijo. Juntos habitan en el distrito de Pichari. Elizabeth es una madre dedicada al trabajo de reciclar todo tipo de productos, esta labor lo realiza en el distrito de Pichari y sus anexos. Ella incursionó en esta actividad por una simple necesidad económica, pues vio este negocio que se realizaba en la capital y por tanto quiso aplicarlo en su ciudad.  Es así que se consiguio una movilidad para llevar productos reciclables, que en un inicio el capital con el que contaba no era tan suficiente como para comprar un volumen adecuado. Los productos que recicla son botellas descartables, latas de leche, cartón y papeles, todo este producto una vez recolectado pasa a una selección, luego de ser seleccionado entra a una comprimidora. Ella esta contenta con el negocio que realiza por que le deja buenas ganancias. Mas adelante desea procesarlas, pero primero debe de adquirir equipos y maquinarias sofisticadas. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles incrementará su capital para comprar más productos que reciclar.
texts.en: Elizabeth, age 45, lives with Rodrigo, age 48. They have one child and live together in the Pichari district. Elizabeth recycles all types of products, working in the Pichari district and its annexes. She started this job out of economic need. She had seen this kind of business being carried out in the capital, and wanted to start it up in her own city. She got a vehicle to transport recyclable products. In the beginning, she did not have enough capital to buy a good amount of products. She recycles bottles, milk cans, cardboard and paper. Upon collection, these items go through a sorting process and are then passed through a compressor. Elizabeth is happy to have her business because it provides her with a good income. In the future, she wants to do the processing herself, but first she has to acquire equipment and sophisticated machinery. This will be her first loan with MFP, so she promises to repay her quotas punctually. With the requested 1,500 nuevos soles, she will increase her capital in order to purchase more products to recycle.

loans.use: to buy products for recycling.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es: La señora GEORGINA, tiene 48 años de edad, la socia continua con su negocio de preparación de bocaditos dulces y salados, la socia prepara para todo tipo de compromisos bocaditos dulces como alfajorsitos en tamaño pequeños, cachitos con relleno de manjar, piononitos, y bocaditos salados como salteñitas, hambuerguecitas enanas y otros, la socia los vende al por mayor desde la docena y el ciento. La socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de los bocaditos.
texts.en: Señora Georgina, age 48, is still running her business making sweet and salted snacks. She makes all kinds of snacks suck as small alfajores [a type of cookie sandwich made with dulce de leche], cachitos [croissants] filled with dulce de leche, piononitos [cake rolls], and salted snacks such as salteñita empanadas and mini hamburgers. She sells these snacks wholesale by the dozen and the hundred. Georgina now wants to invest this loan in the purchase of ingredients for making her snacks.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Ryan

texts.en:
Ryan is from Aguada, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. He is 33 years old. Ryan is married and has three school-aged children.

To make a living, Ryan owns and operates a tricycle transport service. (A tricycle is a motorcycle with a passenger cab). Ryan has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month for these activities.

Ryan is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to cover the cost of maintenance and repair of his motorcycle.

In 2010, Ryan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and have an additional motorcycle for business.

loans.use: to maintain and repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Rurales de la Fundación Paraguaya a formado varios grupos en la ciudad de Curuguaty  y el comité Kuña Aty es uno más situado en el Barrio Santa Maria con el total de 15 mujeres en las cuales están vecinas, amigas y hermanas. Actualmente se encuentra en el segundo ciclo, es un comité que demuestra mucho interés con todos los programas que la Fundación ofrece.
Eloina es una mujer muy trabajadora, quien nos cuenta que por medio de la venta de todo tipo de verduras ha podido sacar adelante a su familia y ayudar con los gastos diarios de la casa. Ella sabe lo difícil que es mantener un hogar, y es por ello que día a día se esfuerza mucho. Cuenta que tiene buena venta, pues sus vecinos siempre compran de ella sus productos.
Esta vez solicita la ayuda de kiva y de fundación paraguaya para la compra de verduras, como ser tomates, locotes, cebollas, papas, legumbres y demás tipos, pues quiere abastecerse para tener siempre verduras que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Fundación Paraguaya's Comité de Mujeres Rurales [Rural Women's Communal Bank] program has formed various groups in the city of Curuguaty. The communal bank "Kuña Aty" is a member group located in Barrio Santa Maria, composed of 15 women who are neighbors, friends, and sisters. They are currently on the second loan cycle. Their communal bank shows a lot of interest with all the programs offered by the Foundation. 

Eloina (one of the members) is a very hardworking woman who sells vegetables. This has allowed her to move forward with her family and help with the daily house expenses. She knows how difficult it is to maintain her house, so she puts a lot of effort into it on a daily basis. Her sales are going well, since her neighbors always buy from her. 

The loan requested to KIVA and the Fundacion Paraguaya will be used to buy vegetables, like tomatoes, chilies, onions, potatoes, legumes and other type of vegetables. This will help her to stock her store and continue offering vegetables to her customers.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, chilies, onions, potatoes, legumes and other types of vegetables.

loans.name: Pilar Juanita

texts.es: Pilar es una mujer de 48 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su negocio. su historia empezó cuando sus padres empezaron a trabajar en el negocio de alquiler de sillas en la playa. cuando ella era pequeña se dedicaba a la venta de colas en la playa desde ese entonces creció en este ambiente y decidió alquilar silla, su trabajo lo hace con los hijos todos los días, no tiene dificultades, está casada, tiene 1 hija, su sueño más importante es incrementar más en su negocio y tener su propio local donde guarda su propia herramienta de trabajo. Por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar sillas y toldos.
texts.en:
Pilar is a 48-year-old woman who has a great desire to boost her business over the next few years.

Pilar's business story began when her parents began to work renting chairs on the beach. When she was young she used to sell soft drinks on the beach. Since then the environment has grown considerably she began to also rent out chairs. She performs her job alongside with her children every day. She has no considerable difficulties and is married with one daughter. Her dream is to grow her business more and have her own place where she can store her work tools. She is requesting the loans to purchase chairs and awnings.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and awnings

loans.name: Selifatou

texts.fr: Selifatou est une femme âgée de 55 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Mariée et mère d’un enfant, Selifatou est une marchande de produits alimentaires qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile et en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Selifatou désire ce crédit pour financer son achat des bols de farine de manioc, d’arachides et du sucre en vue de bien revendre puis d’en tirer profit et gagner plus de revenus afin de mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en: Sadya est une femme mariée âgée de 53 ans résidante à Tokoin. Avec deux enfants à charge, Sadya est une revendeuse des tubercules d’ignames et de l’huile végétale qu’elle s’approvisionne sept fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Sadya désire ce prêt pour commander la calebasse de tubercules d’ignames et le bidon d’huile végétale. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne revente, Sadya compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et celui de ses enfants puis à leur épanouissement.

loans.use: to purchase 24 bowls of cassava flour, 3 bowls of peanuts, and a sack of souches.

loans.name: Tecla

texts.en: Meet Tecla, a mother of one, who has been farming for six years. She lives with her family on a family-owned land in the Kapsowar, Kenya. Tecla sells milk, eggs, and various food crop varieties from her farm to earn a living. Tecla is very passionate about horticultural farming. However, she faces market challenges such as low prices and low demand in certain seasons. Tecla joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization that provides both training and financing to smallholder rural farmers. She learned about loan management during the training sessions. She is now seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase horticultural inputs. With the loan, Tecla will pay the input expenses that are beyond her means at the moment. With the inputs, she is set to achieve not only a great quantity, but also high-quality yields. With the additional income from horticulture, Tecla will comfortably complete her loan repayments. She seeks to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy horticultural inputs.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista joined Life in Africa in February of 2005. Since then she has been a very active member and has become a leader at the WE Center. She is a single mother raising three children and she always works very hard to provide for them and to keep them in school. As they get older, the school fees increase and she is looking for a way to insure that she will be able to pay all the fees so they can complete their education. She does not think that being a single mother should be a barrier to her children's education.

Even with all the demands for their needs, she has managed to save enough money to acquire a plot of land. She plans to build a house on this land that she will rent out. The income from this rental property will be specifically used for her children's education. Housing is in high demand so this will be a sound investment.

She is seeking a loan in the amount of shs. 800,000 ($475) to assist her in starting the first phase of her project. She has savings that she will add to this loan to purchase the necessary materials to lay the foundation and build part of the walls.

Her total project budget is shs. 3,252,000/=
With the 800,000/= that Teopista is asking to borrow for the first phase, she plans to buy:
Bricks 7,000 @ 60/= 420,000/=
Cement 20 bags @ 18,000/= 360,000/=
Transport 20,000/=
TOTAL 780,000/=

Based on her current income, Teopista will be able to repay the loan in 12 months. She has des-ignated 25% of the interest she pays on the loan to support Life in Africa's Internet4Change training program.

loans.use: Purchase building materials

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro has had a grocery store for 2 years. He is very happy with his business, and he works hard every day to give the best service to his customers, and to keep his store well-supplied so they will always find the product they want. In 2007, he is thinking of increasing the variety of products so that he can keep growing. For this reason he is requesting a loan of $1200.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Alejandro tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 2 años, el esta muy contento con su negocio y se esfuerza todos los días por dar el mejor servicio a sus clientes y por tener bien abastecida su tienda para que ellos siempre encuentren el producto que quieren, pero este 2007 tiene contemplado agregar mas variedad de productos y seguir creciendo, por lo cual solicita un crédito de $1200.00

loans.use: To buy products and merchandise

loans.name: Ulkar

texts.en: Ulkar is an Internally Displaced Person from the Armenian-occupied Zangilan district of Azerbaijan. She fled to Baku in 1993. Married, she has three children. She started her business in 1995, and borrowed five Normicro loans from Baku branch totaling $1800. Now she wants to borrow $700 to increase the variety of goods in her shop.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Ving

texts.en: Mrs. Ving C. is a widow with two chidren.  She lives in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. She runs a farm on a small piece of land behind her house.  She barely makes enough money to help make ends meet for her family. Two of her children work at the local garment factory and contribute money to the household once a month. Currently, C. is requesting an $800 loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and cows to work on her farm. She thinks the loan offers the best opportunity to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and cows for her farm

loans.name: Faamati

texts.en:
Faamati has two children aged 2 years and 9 months respectively and her husband is unemployed. She had been running her own shop for some time before joining the SPBD programme. She faced some difficulties running her shop, especially with a family to look after. Therefore she decided to join SPBD so she would be able to have some financial assistance in running her shop. To date, Faamati has received 5 loans from SPBD.

With these loans, she has been able to to buy more goods for her shop and put her children in school. In the future she plans to extend her shop and is thinking of building a mini restaurant beside her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy fruit to make juice for sale

loans.name: Aliitasi

texts.en: Aliitasi is a forty two year old lady and a mother of four kids. None of them are employed so her plantation is their only source of income. She applied for this loan in order to buy the necessary chemicals and tools. Aliitasi sells vegetables and crops at the market  three days per week and makes a profit of 210 Tala ($84 US) per day. She will use her next loan  to improve her vegetable garden which goes together with her plantation business.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and tools for her plantation

loans.name: Esmira

texts.en: Esmira is a mother of 2 children. She is 46 years old, a widow, and lives in Khachmaz town. This woman has sold produce for 2 years. Now she needs a loan of $850 to buy produce for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy produce to sell

loans.name: Munak Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Rose has a retail shop business. With the extra profits, Rose wants to repay the loan and re-invest in the retail shop. Prossy sells used clothes. Sarah has a cosmetic shop. Ritah sells firewood and Madinah has a beauty salon.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To add in stock

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet O. is a mother of 4 children, 40 years old, and comes from Shibiri, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells baby products, and has been in her business since 1998. She now needs a loan in the amount of $450 to enable her to buy more baby products to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more baby products to sell

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is forty-nine years old and the mother of three sons and one daughter.  Esperanza explains that four children are hard to keep up, but she says that’s her responsibility and she’s proud that they all attend school.  To support her children, Esperanza operates a cafeteria she started three years ago.  Currently, she has a well established clientel and she has good income.
Esperanza plans on using her loan to increase the variety of food she offers to her customers.  She hopes that her business’s growth will allow her increase her revenue and maintain a comfortable lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a large variety of goods for a cafeteria.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario is a high school teacher at César Augusto cesar Salinas Pinell. He started out giving classes to his fellow students when was in the 4th grade and it was here that he showed his love for teaching. Two years ago, he managed to get a job from the Ministry of Education, which he performs with responsibility and honesty. He is a teacher of mathematics and English and at the same time he is studying towards two degrees in mathematics and English. It is worth noting that this young guy is characterized by his simplicity and humble spirit of overcoming challenges. He wants to become an excellent professional to be able continue helping his family.

Mario J. is requesting a loan in order to invest in the improvement of his home, located in Zone #1 of Nueva Guinea, by repairing his bedroom to have a little bit of comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva volunteer.

Mario es docente de educación Secundaria en el colegio César Augusto cesar Salinas Pinell. Inició a laborar dando clase a sus mismos compañeros cuando estaba en cuarto año, fue así que él demostró su amor por la docencia y consiguió que en el ministerio de educación le otorgara una plaza hace dos años, donde se desempeña su labor con mucha responsabilidad y honestidad es maestro de matemática e inglés, a la vez es estudiante de dos carreras Lic. En Matemática e Ingles, Cabe la pena recalcar que este joven se caracteriza por su sencillez y humildady espíritu de superación, quiere llegar a ser un excelente profesional para así seguir ayudando a su familia. Mario J. está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda ubicada en la zona # 1 de Nueva Guinea, como es repellar el dormitorio en el que habita y así tener un poco de comodidad.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand to repair a room of his house

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoang Thi D., 36 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2004. She has 2 children, one of which is 15 years old, the other is 18 years old. Her main activities are working on the rice field and breeding animals. At first, she used her borrowed money of 125 USD to breed pigs. She got a very good profit. Therefore, she continued to borrow 450 USD to buy buffalos to assist in practising agriculture. Her family economy improves gradually. She can send her children to good school and furnish her house. This time she wants to borrow 575 USD to buy pigs and chickens to breed. Her wish is to be a life-long member of the TYM Fund.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị Diện, 36 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2004. Chị có 2 con: 15 và 18 tuổi, cả hai đều đang đi học. Công việc chính của chị là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Năm đầu tiên tham gia Quỹ chị xin vay số tiền 125USD đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Kết quả sau vòng vốn đầu rất khả quan, chị tiếp tục xin vay 450USD mua trâu phục vụ sản xuất nông nghiệp. Kinh tế gia đình ngày càng phát triển, các con được ăn học tử tế, đồ đạc trong nhà chị Diện cũng được sắm sửa thêm nhiều. Vòng vốn này chị tiếp tục xin vay 575USD để mua lợn gà chăn nuôi. Mong muốn của chị Diện là được tham gia Quỹ lâu dài và mãi mãi.

loans.use: Buy pigs, chickens

loans.name: Kurbonali

texts.ru:
Kurbonali H. lives in the town of Yavan and works as an engineer at a Daewoo plant. He is also a farmer who grows vegetables and grain varieties. In order to sow he needs to purchase additional fertilizer and seeds. That is why he wants to take out a six-month loan. Kurbonali is married and has four children. They all live happily together, despite the difficulties and challenges of life today.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Хочаев Курбонали житель города Яван . Работает в ДЭУ инженером. Кроме работы он занимается земледелием , где выращивает овощи и злаковые культуры. Для повторгного посева Курбонали должен закупить удобрения и семена. Поэтому он хочет получить кредит со сроком в 6 месяцев. Курбонали женат и имеет четверых детей. Живут все они дружно и весело , несмотря на трудности и невзгоды сегодняшней жизни.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Frida S., who is married and has two children aged 8 and 12. She has two additional dependents living with her because they are orphans. In 2007, Frida established her traditional African cloth business. Working six days a week, five hours a day, and assisted by her husband and one employee, she earns about $110 every month. Frida now requests a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of cloth, dye and other chemicals which she will use to make a new range of colourful cloth. In the future, she plans to open another business and employ more workers. Frida thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of traditional African cloth.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula started her business for the lack of a fixed and stable job. She wanted to feel useful and capable of helping his husband with the expenses and the needs of their home. She also wanted to help her children with their studies so they could have a better future. She began buying few goods in May 2005 to see if selling secondhand clothes would work. She started little by little going to the different flea markets of the area and this way people started taking notice and her clientele has grown increasingly. Today, she has a good number of clients and she has been doing fine. She needs a loan of $400 that she will repay over a period of 4 months. She will buy more seasonal secondhand clothes in order to have a larger variety to offer to her clients and this way increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

Paula inició el negocio por falta de un trabajo fijo y estable, quiso sentirse útil y capaz ayudando a su esposo con los gastos y las necesidades de su hogar y ademas ayudar a sus hijos con sus estudios para que salgan adelante en la vida y puedan tener un futuro mejor. Comenzó en Mayo de 2005, comprando poca mercancía para ver si iba a funcionarle la venta de ropa usada por lo que emepzo a recorrer poco a poco los diferentes mercados rodante de la localidad y así la gente la empezó a ubicar los mismos y su clientela fue creciendo cada vez más, hoy cuenta con un buen numero de clientes y le ha ido bien. Ella necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 4 meses para poder comprar ropa usada de temporada y tener mas variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera aumentar sus ingresos.

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Mrs. Im P. is 40 years old and works selling a variety of grocery items to the people in her community. She generally makes up to $50 each day of gross income. She is married and has two children, one of who is enrolled in school and the other who helps her work day to day. Her husband works as a construction foreman, however his work depends on when he is needed.
Mrs. Im P. would like to increase her capital by asking for a loan to purchase more grocery products to supply her inventory. She would like to meet her growing customers' demands and needs this loan to do so.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to expand her business.

loans.name: Sadeta

texts.en: Sadeta H. is 39 years old and comes from Stanić Rijeka, a nice village near Doboj. She was unfortune to be  widowed very young, and she raised her son alone. Sadeta is remarried now and has one more son. Her husband has a car wash and Sadeta and her older son help him. Beside that, Sadeta has her garden and she raises poultry in season. Sadeta wants to support her older son and help him to provide his own living (he lives with them now). They are trying to fix his living place and Sadeta takes a loan from WWI every year for that. She takes a small amount to be able to repay it. Sadeta is requesting a loan from WWI in the amount of 1000 KM to provide electricity in her son`s living quarters.

loans.use: To provide electricity in house

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa, de 52 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive junto a su único hijo que está cursando estudios superiores. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, como también trabaja como secretaria en la municipalidad de Pucallpa, Luisa viene realizando la venta de ropa desde hace ya 2 años, lleva sus prendas por distintos lugares de su zona. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se relaciona más e intercambia ideas con sus clientes. Le es rentable, ya que cuenta con una clientela selecta que requieren de estas prendas. Le va muy bien, se siente satisfecha y con ganas de seguir creciendo. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más ropa para niños y adultos, y posteriormente alquilar un local para poner su tienda/Boutique.
texts.en:
Luisa is 52 years old and a single mother. She lives with her only child who is a university student. Luisa works selling clothing and also works as a secretary for the city government of Pucallpa. She has been selling clothing for two years and takes her garments to different places in the area. What she likes most about her work is the relationships and exchange of ideas with her clients. The business is profitable because she has a select clientele that requires these garments. Things are going well for her and she feels satisfied and has the desire to continue to grow. This is her first loan with MFP. With the money that she is requesting she will purchase more clothing for children and adults and later rent a locale where she will open her boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Yang's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. Mrs. Yang S. is the leader of the loan, and she is age 39. She owns and runs a fruit shop in the local market and sells items such as grapes, apples, and oranges, making an income of $3 per day. She takes care of five children, all of whom are single and attend school. Her husband, Mr. Choun Sophal, 37, is a taxi driver. In order to enlarge the business, S. is applying for a loan to purchase different kinds of fruits to sell. S. has two members with her:

Mrs. Sok S., age 27, a fish seller who is seeking a loan to buy more fishes for selling.

Mrs. Yang R., 62, is a fruit seller. She needs to ask for a loan to enlarge her business. 

The borrowers live in Battambang Province.

loans.use: To purchase different kinds of fruits to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a mill to grind maize and other grains in three villages

loans.name: Folake

texts.en: Folake O.,43, is a LAPO client. She is married with two children and lives in Eleyele, Ibadan, Nigeria. She sells shoes and bags, and hopes to own her own boutique in the future. She is requesting a loan amount of $675 (N100,000) to purchase more shoes and bags to sell. She says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Novie

texts.en:
Novie M., 37 years old, grows rice on her farm. Joel M., her husband, is the one who manages their farm. They work very hard to increase their yield to support their family, especially now that both of their children are going to school. Three years ago, Novie inherited one hectare of land from her parents. That is what they use to feed their children, pay their daily expenses and pay tuition fees and other bills. Novie previously worked in a canning factory but she was not so happy about it.

Novie is asking for a loan from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers, specifically two bags of urea. She will also buy three sacks of quality rice seeds. She is also considering looking for some other possible income areas to help her family more.

Novie has access to CEVI credit assistance. She also receives relevant trainings and insurance coverage from CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seed.

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.en:
Emerenciana T. owns a small "sari-sari" store. It is situated 100 meters away from her house. People come to her store to buy their staples. She sells rice, sardines, instant coffee, noodles, beverages, soaps, shampoos, bread, chippy, and other goods. Her profit goes to pay her children's tuition fees. Because of her store, she was also able to pay for books and other school supplies. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 21,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise to attract customers. The loan will truly help Emerenciana expand her business. In this way, she believes, she will have more to contribute to the family income. 

CEVI provides their clients credit assistance that they need. They also give their clients training and insurance coverage to help their clients grow their businesses.

loans.use: To expand her store's inventory

loans.name: Chibuzor

texts.en: Chibuzor is 26 years old and single. He sells groceries and drinks. He has been in this business for the past 4 years. He requests a loan for 150,000 NGN ($1025) to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. He is a LAPO client. He says thanks to all those who make this loan possible.

loans.use: Purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.en:
Hựu Phan, 51, (right) lives in the town of Hiải Dương. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Hựu owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Hựu has engaged in this business for over 30 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, Hựu joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hựu has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund, used to purchase breeding livestock. Hựu is requesting a loan of 9000000 VND to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be her second from TYM Fund. Hựu plans to use the additional revenue from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Purchase livestock fed.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es pequeño agricultor y productora de leche de vaca con que elabora quesos por cantidad para la comercialización de los mismo en las ferias populares de la ciudad de La Paz; el esposo trabaja de obrero de tractorista en el pueblo; estas actividades son su principal fuente de ingreso con las que cubren la manutención de sus dos hijos de 1 y 4 años de edad; viven en la casa de sus padres ubicado en la Provincia Ingavi – Achica Baja (a dos horas y media de la ciudad de El Alto). 

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad lo cual le ayudará a obtener mas leche para la producción de  quesos y mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es el cuarto  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle este préstamo.
texts.en:
Margarita is a small agricultural and dairy farmer who makes cheeses and sells them in the markets of La Paz. Her husband works as a tractor driver in the town. These activities are their main sources of income, which they use to support their two children, 1 and 4 years old. They live in their parents' house, which is in Achica Baja, in Ingavi Province, two and a half hours from El Alto. She will use the loan to purchase a dairy cow, which will give her more milk for her cheese production and increase her income. This is her fourth loan from Impro, and she has been approved because of her history of faithful payment.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow to increase her cheese production

loans.name: Sandra Rosario

texts.es:
SANDRA ROSARIO G. H., pertenece al Banco Comunal “DAMAS DEL ORIENTE” con domicilio en el Jr Inmaculada Nº201, tiene 24 años, 02 hijos que están en el colegio y su esposo es taxista (servicio de transporte).

Ella ha iniciado u pequeño negocio de peluquería y venta de lácteos como yogurt, leche. Su primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles con el cual se dedicó al servicio de alquiler de un moto taxi que tenía antes de pertenecer a Manuela Ramos. Hoy el negocio ha crecido y tiene otro moto taxi.

Con este préstamo de S/.1.000.00 Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en compra de un motor y le dará mantenimiento del otro moto taxi.

Dice: “Manuela Ramos me ha ayudado mucho, pues gracias a esa ONG me hace posible seguir con el servicio de moto taxi, ya que con los préstamos puedo cubrir las reparaciones o mantenimiento que requieren los moto taxi.”
texts.en:
Sandra Rosario G. H. belongs to the Damas del Oriente Community Bank. She lives at Jr Inmaculada Nº201. She is 24, has two children who are in school, and her husband is a taxi driver. She has started a small hairdressing business, and she sells dairy products like yogurt and milk. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she used to rent out a “moto taxi” (motorcycle with a tricycle-like attachment) that she had before she belonged to Manuela Ramos. Now the business has grown, and she has another moto taxi. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she will buy a motor for the maintenance of the other moto taxi. She says, “Manuela Ramos has helped me so much. Thanks to this ONG (nongovernmental organization), it is possible for me to continue with the moto taxi service. With the loans I can cover the required repairs or maintenance for the moto taxis.”

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance on the moto taxi.  Buy a motor for the moto taxi.

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en:
H. Muborak has a successful business selling high-quality underclothes for women. In business for 4 years, she is a very experienced entrepreneur. She offers her customers polite service, reasonable prices and quality products. Muborak is married and has a little son. She has requested a loan of 2000 Somoni to increase her business capital. This loan will allow her to continue investing in her business and pursue her future goals of expanding and opening new sales locations.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of underclothing for resale

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Suni que significa Abundante en quechua.
Julia es viuda, tiene 63 años y 6 hijos, Julia venD. refrescos y mazamorras en la feria D. platos típicos que se realiza los días sábados y domingos, mientras que los demás días venD. comida en la puerta D. la fiscalia D. manera ambulatoria.
Julia necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, maíz morado.
Los sueños D. Julia son que sus 2 nietos culminen sus estudios y tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
The name of Julia’s Community Bank is Suni, which means abundant in Quechua. Julia is 63, a widow, and has six children. Julia sells soft drinks and “mazamorras” (dessert maD. of purple corn boiled with pieces of pineapple and other fruits) at the fair that sells typical dishes. She does this on Saturdays and Sundays. The other days of the week she sells food as a street vendor in the entrance to the Prosecutor’s Office. Julia needs a loan for 600 PEN to buy sugar and purple corn. Julia’s dreams are for her two grandchildren to complete their education and to have a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar and purple corn

loans.name: Izzatoi

texts.ru: Иззатой является актвнымклиентом нашей организации. Она получает кредит с 2003 года.  Торговать (тканью)материалами начала 20 лет назад, когда рабтала в магазине в советское время. Имея опыт торговли она начала ездить со знакомыми за товаром. Когда могла сдавала товар оптом. Сейчас арендует помещение и расширила ассортимент тканей , от дешевых до дорогих. Кредит получила для покупки летней тканей.
texts.en:
Izzatoi is one of our active clients. She has been receiving credit since 2003. She started selling fabrics 20 years ago, when she worked at a store during the Soviet time. Having gained retail experience, Izzatoi began to travel for the merchandise with her friends. When she could, she sold goods wholesale. Currently, she is leasing a space and was able to expand her selection of fabrics from cheap to expensive. She is obtaining this loan for the purchase of summer fabrics.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer fabrics

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en:
Ruta L. (0) is a 51-year-old woman living in the town of Vaovai. She is married and has four adult children.

Ruta owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 350 WST a month.

In 2009, Ruta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ruta is now requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban tiene 48 años, es un hombre que siempre tiene una sonrisa en el rostro, es separado hace 20 años y vive solo en su casa propia. Él tiene un hijo de 17 años que estudia en la ciudad de Tarma, la cual se ubica a 5 horas en auto desde su localidad. Él considera su trabajo muy placentero, pues desde niño le ha gustado dedicarse al labrado y cuidado de las plantas y conoce cómo y cuándo cuidar de ellas para que le generen muy buenos ingresos. Es por ello que se levanta muy temprano por la mañana para quitar todas las malezas y arbustos de sus plantaciones. Su siembra preferida es el café, aunque se demora tres años para cosechar, igual le agrada ese cultivo, ya que llegada la época de cosecha la comercialización le genera muy buenas ganancias.
