Con el dinero acumulado invierte en sus siguientes siembras y también envía dinero a su hijo para sus gastos estudiantiles, pues su anhelo es que se convierta en un buen profesional. Estaban está muy agradecido con el presidente de su banco comunal, pues fue él quien lo invitó a integrarse al grupo. Por su parte, él se compromete a pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas para no defraudar al resto de sus compañeros. El dinero que viene solicitando lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus plantas de café.
texts.en:
Esteban is always seen with a smile on his face. He is 48 years old, lives alone in his own home, and has been separated for the past 20 years. He has a 17 year old son who is studying in the city of Tarma, which is 5 hours away by car from his home. Esteban enjoys his work. As a young man, he liked to engage in hard labor and taking care of plants because he knew these activities could bring in a good income. For this reason, he gets up early in the morning to remove all the weeds and shrubs around his plantation. He enjoys planting coffee the most even though it takes three years for the crop to mature. Estaban also likes the harvest season when he can bring his goods to market and earn a good profit. With the savings he accumulates, he invests in the crops for the following season and also sends some spending money to his son for school, since he wants him to become a professional.

Esteban is very grateful to the president of his Communal Bank for inviting him to be part of their group. He has agreed to make all his payments on time so that he does not disappoint the other members. The money he is requesting will be used to purchase chemical fertilizers for his coffee plants.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Ancha Vasco

texts.pt:
Ancha Vasco C. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, tem 35 anos de idade, solteira maior e vive numa casa cedida pelos serviços juntamente com três irmãs que estão sob sua responsabilidade. Nunca teve marido. Estudou ate 12 classe e as irmãs também estudam a sua custa. Também se responsabiliza pela sua mãe que vive na província de Gaza, enviando dinheiro.

Ancha cresceu na companhia dos pais em maputo e mais tarde a sua mãe passou a viver na província de Gaza, onde ela também deslocara no ano de 1986 e tendo regressado vinte anos mais tarde juntamente com as 3 irmãs para o distrito de boane.
É dactilografa na Administração regional das Águas (ARA, sul) recebendo 7.000,00MT.
Antes de trabalhar nesta empresa publica, fez trabalhos na Emissora provincial da Radio Moçambique durante seis anos exercendo as mesmas funções.

Este é o seu segundo empréstimo com a Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 17.000,00MT para compra de cimento, ferro, pedra e outro material de construção de uma casa de alvenaria. O credito anterior foi para compra de bens de consumo, graças às informações obtidas através de colegas.

Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos com objectivo de concluir a sua casa. Sonha, no futuro mais breve, casar e retornar a escola para fazer o nível superior.
texts.en:
Ancha Vasco C. was born in the city of Maputo. She is 35 years old, single and lives in a home that was provided by social services for her and her 3 sisters, whom she cares for. She has never been married. She studied until 12th grade and she also pays for her sisters’ schooling. She also sends money to her mother, who lives in Gaza province. Ancha grew up with her parents in Maputo and later her mother moved to Gaza, where Ancha also moved in 1986. Twenty years later she and her 3 sisters moved back to Boane. She is a typist for the Regional Water Administration (ARA in Portuguese), and receives 7.000,00MT per month. Before she began working for this public company, she worked for Radio Mozambique for six years, in the same capacity. This is her second loan with Hluvuku-Adsema for 17.000,00MT. She will use the money to buy cement, steel, rocks and other materials needed to build a brick home. Her previous loan was used for household items, thanks to information she received from coworkers. She pledges to pay this loan with no problems so she will qualify for loans in the future. In the near future she would like to get married and return to school to attend college.

Translated from Portuguese by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction materials

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen M. is from Bañadero, Ozamiz City. She is 45-years-old.  Belen is married and has five school-age children. To make a living, Belen owns and operates a service-based business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing parlor services in the local community.  Belen has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Belen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Belen is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment & tools for business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
“ If you are responsible, you will achieve your goal.”  An inspiring quotation shared by Mrs. Evangeline P. one of the responsible mothers in bry. Roxas, Solano,Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Mr. Alfredo P. but unfortunately, they are not blessed with a child. Although, they legally adopted a child whom they called Mark Justin P. 7 years old a grade-I pupil. They want their adopted child to be successful in the future so that he will be the one to take care of them when they got old. In this regard, they are doing all their best to support his education so that he will find a stable job someday. 
	Farming is the common source of their living, they till their land twice a year by planting rice and some vegetables. Since harvesting takes a long time, Mrs. Evangeline put-up a small sari-sari or general store in their village to earn additional income. She used the loan she availed in the Microfinance organization to acquire different grocery items, soft drinks and frozen foods. Her average income for month is amounting to P 5,000.00 which they utilized to acquire their daily basic needs and to pay her weekly loan amortization. Due to our economic crisis, she wants to strengthen her small business to increase her income to satisfy their basic needs and save for their future. She applied a higher amount of P 5,000.00 to strengthen her capital in improving her small store. She wants to buy more grocery items to be able to increase more profit.

loans.use: additional capital to purchase grocery items in her store

loans.name: Mr. Sophoen Morm Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank loan consists of ten people and they all live in Toek Klang village in Kandal province. Mr. Sophoen M. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. On the farm, he faces an obstacle because his field has a lot of insects which damage the crops. In order to deal with this problem, he decided to ask for a loan to buy pesticides to support his crops and make them more productive. His wife, Mrs. Thung Sina, is a housewife.  Mr. Sophoen M. is 30 years old and the father of two children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy pesticides

loans.name: Ledy Jane

texts.en:
Ledy Jane and Jesus S. reside in Nueva Vizcaya province on the island of Luzon. Their home is in Barangay Uddiawan, located in the municipality of Solano. They are blessed with two grown children, Joemark and Jermilyn. Being responsible parents, they did their best to support the studies of their children until they graduated from college. At present, the eldest is working abroad while their second child is teaching at San Juan Elementary School. They believe that their lives are the fruit of their patience and sacrifices. 

Since they are now growing old, the couple continuously works to further improve their living conditions and save for their future. Jesus cultivates their farm plots, planting rice and corn, while Ledy Jane manages their small eatery at home. Being a responsible worker, she is able to earn a net income of 4,500 PHP a month, which she uses for their daily needs and puts into savings for their future. Ledy Jane aims to improve her small eatery, but she has inadequate capital to do so. 

Through Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc. (ASKI), Ledy Jane wants to borrow PHP6,000 from KIVA lenders to be used to acquire needed materials and ingredients for her eatery as well as the maintenance of their crops. She is thankful for this financial assistance, as it gives her the opportunity to improve Jesus' and her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and materials to support her small eatery and crops

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en: Nhor S. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two of her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer who typically makes about US$1 every day, while her husband digs and sells sand. On average, he earns US$8 per day. Nhor S. would like to take out a loan of US$900 so that her husband can purchase sand to resell.

loans.use: Purchase sand to resell

loans.name: Lovis

texts.en:
O. Lovis O. is forty-six years old and is married with three children going to school. He owns a shop business which he has been operating for over six years. His business is now growing into a medium-sized shop still selling general merchandise. This business is strategically located because it is located in the marketplace where the majority pass by.

Lovis is using the loan to purchase retail items such as boxes of pads, toilet paper, boxes of milk, Blue Band (margarine), soap, baking powder, bulbs, and so forth.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his shop

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is 51 years old. She is married and the mother of seven children. Four of her children are adults, while the other three are still in school. She enjoys selling goods, a business where she makes a living. She has been selling tubers of yam, cereals like gari, and beans for four years now to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock from the farmers. This saves her from intermediaries who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. She also deals in the sale of scrap materials; she collects them in pieces and sells them to companies for further processing. She wants to use the loan to buy yarn, beans, and gari in bulk to meet the daily demands of her customers as they approach the Christmas holiday. She hopes to use part of her profits to support her children in school and to expand her business to the level she desires. She would be grateful for your loan assistance.

loans.use: To buy yam, cereals and beans in bulk.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene O. is from Kinuman Norte, Ozamiz City. She is 34 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Irene owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Irene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Irene is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa A., a 31-year-old  fish vendor, works from early morning until late afternoon to be able to sell her fish and earn income for her family. She desires a good future for her family, and despite its difficulties, her business helps her pay all of the expenses in their home. She is now applying for a loan of Php 6,000 to buy fishing materials to be used by her husband as well as fish that she can resell in the town market.

loans.use: To obtain additional fishing materials for fishing and to buy fish to resell

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget S. is married with 4 children.  Her children are excelling in school. Bridget has a stall where she sells lace, sarongs and shoes. Her customers are usually residents, friends and neighbors. She hopes for a loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more sarongs and shoes to sell. She hopes to own a classic boutique in the future.  Bridget is a LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.  Bridget says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional beer for her business.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok M., who is a villager in Trapeang Kak village in Takeo province, is 44 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Ngoy Orun, are farmers who own 2 hectares of land to cultivate rice on to support their family. In the rice field, they have a problem because their field should have been plowed but they did not plow because they did not have enough oxen. 

Thus, Mrs. Sok M. decided to ask for a loan to buy an ox to plow their field. She is a mother of five children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while another is attending local public school, and the others are construction workers. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy an ox to use for plowing

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice G. K. is a married woman who lives with her six dependents. She has received no formal education. Her husband is a farmer.

Alice operates a food joint where she cooks fufu (starchy dumpling made from cassava, yam, plantain or rice) and other local dishes for sale at Jukwa. She has been doing this for some time now. Alice uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of the home.

Alice will add the loan to her initial income to purchase more foodstuffs for her cooking business. With the new earnings from her extended business, Alice plans to save to buy a shop for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for her cooking business

loans.name: Soutoura. Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Soutoura sont des femmes mariées  ayant en moyenne 37ans, 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et tous les prêts passés se sont  bien dénoués. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente condiments,  de produits cosmétiques tels Wassa C., de fruits et légumes, de bois de chauffe, de vêtements pour  enfants et divers autres produits alimentaires et ménagers. 
S’agissant de l’utilisation de ce nouveau prêt, Wassa C. compte utiliser le sien pour acheter, 3 colis de produits cosmétiques de différentes sortes. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente au comptant en détail rarement à crédit, dans les différents quartiers à une clientèle composée essentiellement  de femmes. 
 Les membres du groupe Soutoura envisagent réaliser chacun un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée en épargne et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The six members of the Soutoura group are married women, who average 37 years of age and have two children; the majority live in polygamous families in Sanoubougou 1, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). They are on their fifth loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, which they have taken out to satisfy the needs of their customers; all their previous loans have been repaid correctly. They have a variety of activities which include, among others, the sale of condiments, cosmetic products in the case of Wassa Couibaly for instance, fruit and vegetables, firewood, children's clothes and other diverse food and household products. As far as this new loan is concerned, Wassa C. is planning to use hers to buy three parcels of different types of cosmetic products. She gets her supplies from wholesalers at the big market in Sikasso Town and sells them for cash and on a retail basis, but rarely on credit, in the different districts of the town, to a customer base made up principally of women. The members of the Soutoura group envisage making an average monthly profit of 15,000FCFA each, of which part will be saved and the rest invested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products

loans.name: Rosario Cecibel

texts.es:
Rosario L. es otra de esas mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas  que habita en San Vicente, un pequeño paraíso manabita,  la señora Rosario está  casada y tiene 4 hijos se dedica al comercio, Rosario  vende ropa interior, su esposo también se dedica al comercio de ropa, negocio que ya es como tradición en esta familia,  el viaja constantemente para vender su mercadería, y  ella sale a recorrer en su propio cantón.

Cada 15 o 30 días viaja  a comprar sus mercadearías en la ciudad de Guayaquil, siempre y cuando tenga una demanda aceptable, y el suficiente dinero para abastecerse de mercadería, Rosario lleva a 1 año en su negocio, para ella no hay nada mejor que trabajar y conseguir las cosas a base de esfuerzo,  sabe que sus inversiones son seguras por eso trabaja en base a créditos, mismos que deja a sus clientes fijos y estos cada semana  pagan las prendas que han dejado, ella se da tiempo para trabajar mucho , pero también el suficiente como para no descuidar su hogar, su sueño es seguir trabajando para seguir dando a su familia la estabilidad que se merecen.
texts.en:
Rosario L. is another one of those hardworking, striving women who live in San Vicente, a small paradise in Manabi. Rosario is married and has 4 children. She is a sales woman. She sells underwear. Her husband also sells clothes; the business is like a family tradition. He travels constantly to sell his merchandise and she goes out in her own canton. Every two weeks to a month she travels to buy her merchandise in the city of Guayaquil. This depends on whether there is an acceptable demand and enough money to get the merchandise. Rosario has been in the business for one year. For her, there is nothing better than working and getting things based on effort. She knows that her investments are safe and that is why she works on credit. She drops the clothes off with her regular customers and every week they pay for them. She takes the time to work a lot, but she also takes the time to not neglect her home. Her dream is to keep working to continue giving her family the stability they deserve.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase underwear

loans.name: Elpidia

texts.es:
Elpidia González tiene 54 años de edad oriunda de la ciudad de Carapeguá, está casada hace más de 23 años con el Sr. Mario Ibarra  de 47 años de edad, tienen 1 hijo que, está cursando el segundo año de la carrera de derecho. 
	Doña Elpidia  y Don Mario se casaron muy jóvenes y empezaron a trabajar en la Argentina durante muchos años es ahí donde juntaron el capital para poder volver a su país y construir  una casa propia que tanto soñaban, actualmente la Sra. Se dedica a la venta de perfume y cosmético en general realizando sus ventas en forma al contado y a crédito, tiene una buena clientela formada tanto en la ciudad como en las compañías,  gracias a esta actividad y el esfuerzo de los dos su hijos está estudiando en una universidad privada.
	Ahora desea comprar más mercaderías como perfumes, crema y otro producto que tiene muchos pedido.
texts.en:
Elpidia González is 54 years old, and is a native of Carapeguá City. She has been married for 23 years to Mario Ibarra, 47, and they have 1 child who is in their second year of law. Elpidia and Mario married when they were very young and worked in Argentina for many years. This is where they gathered the capital to return to their country and build the house they had dreamed about so much. Elpidia sells perfume and general cosmetics, making cash and credit sales. She has a good clientele of people in the city and from companies, and thanks to this activity and the efforts of both their child is studying in a private university. Now Elpidia wants to purchase more merchandise such as perfumes, creams, and other products to fill her many orders.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfumes and cosmetics

loans.name: Menda

texts.en:
Despite the fact that Menda S. J.’s three children, aged from 20 to 27, are already adults with her two eldest now having their own family, she still doesn’t want to resign from her career of being a mother to them. She wants to support their lives and those of their own families until they can get out from the umbrella of poverty. Menda’s husband was unemployed and that has added to the challenges of her life as a woman and the need to become productive.

With faith that one day she will be able to find a way to improve the life of her family, Menda was very happy to learn about ASHI way back in 2005. Then Menda and her husband agreed that she must join ASHI so she could request a loan which would be their source of financial capital to start up a business to earn a daily income. They thought of setting up a small eatery since her husband is a good cook.

After several loans from ASHI, their eatery has eventually grown and has been sustained. Menda has also been able to finance a 'buy and sell' business in partnership with her unemployed eldest son. Proceeds are equally divided between them so her son can support his own family's needs. The loan will be used to purchase bulk ingredients for cooking foods for her eatery. Some of the loan will be used to purchase bulk onions, salt and garlic for her son's 'buy and sell' business. As much as possible, Menda wants to grow and stabilize her eatery and her 'buy and sell' business through the support of loans through ASHI. Proceeds of her business would enable her to support her dream of sending her two children back to school until they graduate from college so they can have a different kind of life in the future - a life that is not poor.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her eatery and to buy food items for her son's business

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios A. is 55 years old and married with seven children, living in the town of Guitas. She has been involved in farming for more than eight years now and tills her land for planting rice crops that she sells at the market, earning about Php5000. She hopes to double her next harvest and is doing her best to keep the farm productive.

Remedios joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remedios has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is now requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and pay the laborers who helped till her farm. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Remedios from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay the laborers who helped till her farm

loans.name: Benkadi  3 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi 3 est composé de femmes mariées du village de DANGASSO dans la préfecture de SAN, région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 41  ans et au moins 6 enfants.
Elles cultivent  du  fonio, de l’oseille et du gombo.  
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé les prêts précédents, elles sont à leur deuxième  prêt de campagne.
SANATA D., est des membres du groupe, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence de fonio, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles, exclusivement  au grand marché de SAN. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de SAN, DAH et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice 21000 à 39500CFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courant de la famille.
texts.en:
he Benkadi 3 group is composed of married women from the Dangasso village in the San prefecture, in the Segou Region (the fourth administrative region of Mali). The women live in traditional families. They are on the average 41 years old and have at least six children. They cultivate fonio [a local sort of millet], sorrel and “gombo” [okra]. In order to make their agricultural work profitable, they have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program two years ago. After having duly repaid previous loans, they are now on their second agricultural loan. Sanata D. plans to use her loan to purchase a sufficient supply of fonio seeds, small tools and agricultural inputs, specifically at the big market in San. After the winter season, the harvest is stored for a while as its price increases before being sold at the big markets of San, Dah, and other nearby markets, retail (often wholesale too) for cash to customers mostly coming from big towns. After selling their produce, each group member expects to obtain an income between 21,000 and 39,500 West African francs, which will be used to pay off the loan interest and cover ongoing family expenses.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing agricultural inputs, seeds and small tools

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden J.  is currently in the business of selling dried fish and tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice and beans to sell.  Kiden is 21 years old and single. She has no children yet.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house for rent.

loans.use: Stock bags of rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for cement and stone

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia R. is from the village of San Pablo, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 37 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Emilia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Emilia has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP whenever she sells her raised animal.

In 2010, Emilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the first loan that Emilia has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

location.town: San Pablo Proper, Cauayan City, Isabela

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with nine children; two  have completed school while the others still attend school. She has been operating her restaurant for over ten years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she does weaving, contributing another source of income.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. Her major challenge in the business is seasonality especially during the months of August few customers turn up.

She hopes that someday she will be able to be self-reliant to satisfy her family's basic needs. She decided to join Yehu so as to get a loan to boost her family's income. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Wilma's Group

texts.en: Wilma D. is from the village of Malitao, Echague, Isabela. She is 51 years old and is the group leader of this ten-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Wilma is married and has two adult children. She owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Wilma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 4th from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Edith Ismelda

texts.es:
La Sra Edith B. de Guerrero  tiene 47 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos, 3 menores  y 2 mayores de edad. 
Ella se dedica a la confecciones de ropas hace más de 21 años, empezó trabajando con su madrina, la cual se dedica a este rubro desde hace ya más de 40 años.
 Luego de tener suficiente experiencia  tomo la decisión de abrir su propio negocio empezó con una pequeña maquina a pedal, luego con el tiempo pudo comprar  una maquina industrial que le ayudo a incrementar  el trabajo  y a la vez conseguir nuevos clientes.

El préstamo solicitado es para  la compra de telas  para  confeccionar uniformes, conjuntos deportivos para colegios y así poder venderlos e incrementar sus ingresos, actualmente tiene muchos pedidos de buzos, remeras y uniformes.
 
Agradece  mucho a la Fundación Paraguaya  por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Edith B. de Guerrero is 47 years old and has 5 children, 3 minors and 2 adults.

She has worked making clothing for the last 21 years.  She started working with her godmother who had worked in this for 40 years.

After gaining enough experience, she decided to open her own business.  She started with a small pedal sewing machine and was later able to buy an industrial machine which helped her to increase her work and gain new customers.

She is seeking a loan to buy fabric to make uniforms and athletic wear for schools which will help her to increase her sales; she currently has many orders for sweatshirts, t-shirts and uniforms.

She is very grateful to the Fundacion Paraguaya for the loan she will receive.

loans.use: Buy fabric

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma S. is a married woman who lives in Purok Daisy, Brgy. Talacagay, Hinobaan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  food vending and farming. Her husband Milo S., who is 51 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are 18 and 22 years old, respectively. Alma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Alma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,300, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to buy fertilizers and glutinous rice for her food vending so that she can continue to save or the future education of her child. Alma S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and glutinous rice

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz A. is from the village of San Jose, Mahinog,  Camiguin Province. She is 58 years old and single. Luz owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, junk food, detergents and beverages in the local community. Luz has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Luz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to invest in expanding the business. Luz is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Luz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Revelieta

texts.en:
Some people say that life is sweet, but still never without bitter moments that one has to go through and overcome. Our CCT* community partner, Revelieta D. C. or Nene as friends call her, proves it to be so. At 30, Revelieta has reached college and is married to Eddie, an ice cream maker. Their sweet marriage brought to life one child, who is in elementary school. REvelieta's family resides in Caloocan City, Philippines.

At present, Revelieta focuses on running her sari-sari (variety) store. She aims to meet the daily needs of her neighborhood with soft drinks and grocery items such as shampoo, canned goods, seasonings, among others. She also sells products from Avon, a brand of beauty products. With this business, Revelieta earns an average of Php300 a day.

Revelieta knows inside of her that the variety store would not be enough to meet the needs and wants of her family. To continue operation of her business, she would like to apply for Php11, 000 loan. She plans to use this money to add more items to her store. 

One challenge Revelieta faces at present is the difficulty of updating people with the payment of their debts. All that she dreams of in life is to make her family happy and give them a house they could call their own. She gives her best to make sure her only child gets a good education until  college. Life is not all the time sweet, but with all the efforts she is doing for her family, she sees to it that she will emerge an overcomer bringing home a sweet success. 


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To add additional stock to her variety store

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah has been practicing mixed farming for the last twenty years and has employed three farmhands. Her farm, which is located in Kisii town in western Kenya, produces tea, coffee, maize and bananas which she sells to the local market. She also earns income from her cereals business in the same location. She is forty years old and married with six children who are between the ages of 12 and 18. All the children attend school except one. 

She has requested this loan of 50,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. She hopes that this loan will enable her to acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for home consumption and for sale. The extra income from the sale of milk will go towards the education of her children. In the future, she would like to open a cereals store in her location. Her biggest challenges have been insufficient funds to expand her businesses and market competition.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Miriam Roxana

texts.es:
Miriam de 35 años, es vendedora de productos de uso personal y ropa hace varios años atrás. Comenzó con el comercio porque siempre le gusto promocionar y vender. 

Viviendo con su esposo y tres hijos de 12, 10 y 8 años en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas). Ha trabajado promocionando a sus vecinos y amigas los productos y ropa de diferentes precios económicos. 

Como es una mujer trabajadora y que siempre le ha gustado obtener su propio dinero para ayudar a su familia quiere continuar con esta actividad de vender productos de uso personal y ropa con el préstamo para seguir asegurando a su familia económicamente. En el futuro quiere darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
Miriam is 35 years old and she has been selling personal products and clothing for many years. She started her business because she has always enjoyed promotions and sales.

She lives together with her husband and their three children, aged 12, 10 and 8 years old, in an urban region named Orquideas de Guayaquil (an urban region, named orquideas because when it was first colonized many orchid flowers were found). She has has been selling to her neighbors and her friends various products and clothing in a wide range of prices. 

Since she is a hardworking person and since she has always liked to have her own money to support her family she wants to keep her business running, selling personal use products and clothing. The loan will ensure that she will be able to continue to support her family financially. IN the future she wants to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase clothing, perfumes, and skin creams.

loans.name: Suzane

texts.en:
Suzane owns a business that sells vegetables.  She is 38 years old, married and has three children who are between the ages of thirteen and sixteen years old.  Her husband works as a mason.  Suzane has been selling vegetables for 15 years.  

Suzane's loan will be used to add more oranges, pineapple and yellow bananas to sell.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a house and she hopes to pay school fees for her children for the coming years.

loans.use: To add more oranges, pineapple and yellow bananas to sell.

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar lives in Okara, which is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family in a 2-room brick house for the past 5 years. She is 42 years old and married to S. A., who is a butcher by profession. His shop is located in the community area and he offers quality meat to his clients for cheap prices.
 
Kosar is the mother of 3 sons and a daughter. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. She herself is a housewife and prefers to stay at home and perform her household responsibilities. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy chickens in large quantity to fulfill customer demand and make more income. He has been operating this business for the past 5 years and Kosar is very hopeful that her husband’s business will be expanded further after the loan investment. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In a previous loan year, she established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kosar.

loans.use: To buy chickens for chicken-meat selling business

loans.name: Mah

texts.en:
Born in 1978, Mah H. is married and has four children.  She has been very hardworking from the day she joined GHAPE.  Her desire is to work for her children’s education and pay for their school fees so that they can be educated. 

She decided to become a member of GHAPE due to her inability to get investment capital, which could give her higher income to meet her children’s needs and the family's.  With this loan, she plans to buy piglets and feed.  This investment will help people in her community to have pork.  She is planning on using the profits generated to sponsor her children in school.  She also wants to buy fowls which will provide the community with chicken. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Odile

texts.en:
Odile is 21 years old and is single. She sells various goods such as: avocados, soap, sugar, pens, rice, etc. and runs a well-organized and well-known store, which she has had for one year. Her store is open from 7am to 9pm every day and she currently employs one person to help her. 

Odile will use this loan to expand her store. She will use any profits she makes to reinvest in her business and hopes to become financially stable.

loans.use: To expand her small store

loans.name: Yao Abra

texts.fr: Madame Abra a 46 ans et mère de 2 enfants. Elle fait le commerce de maïs et de charbons de bois. Elle cumule dans cette activité 6 ans déjà et s’approvisionne à Tabligbo. Ensuite elle revend ses marchandises à la devanture de sa maison dans le quartier Kagomé. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter  10 sacs de maïs et 10 sacs de charbons de bois. Mais actuellement elle n’a pas de stock.
texts.en:
Mrs. Abra is 46 years old and the mother of 2 children. She trades corn and charcoal, and already has 6 years of experience. Mrs. Abra buys her supplies at Tabligbo and then re-sells in front of her house in the Kagomé neighborhood. 

She is requesting a loan to buy 10 sacks of corn and 10 sacks of charcoal. At the moment, she has no stock on hand.

loans.use: to buy corn and charcoal

loans.name: Kalyskan Group

texts.en:
"Kalyskan” is a group from Chonkara village which is situated at the southern part of Kyrgyzstan.  All members of the group are engaged in cattle breeding and land cultivation. 

Kalyskan A. is the leader of the group. She is 55, married, and has eight children. She started her business with the initial capital of 5.000 KGS and managed to develop a farm with five milch cows and sheep. Also, her family is engaged in cultivating rice, which allows them to earn the sum of 4.000 KGS in a month. 

Members of the “Kalyskan” group have applied for a loan of 54.000 KGS to purchase cattle and fertilizers to manure their land. This will allow them to get a good harvest of rice and raise their sales of milk and meat products. In future, they plan to broaden their businesses. 
 
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Nuevas Amigas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevas Amigas está formado por 1 socio y 8 socias quienes laboran en diferentes actividades que les permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares.  Viven por diferentes parroquias y sectores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene hermosos paisajes naturales para visitar, es la tercera ciudad de mas importante del país y fue nombrada en 1999 como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, toda su gente es muy amable y cordial.

La Señorita. Diana C. se encuentra en el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga quien es socia activa del banco.

Nuestra socia tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive en la casa de sus abuelitos a quienes les ayuda económicamente.
 
La Señorita. Diana estudio 2 años en una academia de costura y está ejerciendo su profesión hace un año, ella trabaja de lunes a viernes de 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde en una fábrica que confeccionan jeans.

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su hogar.
 
Su meta es tener un taller de confección  para producir sus propios productos.
texts.en:
The Nuevas Amigas (New Friends) community bank has nine members (one man and eight women).  They all work in different businesses which allow them to contribute financially to their households.  They live in different parishes and sectors of the city of Cuenca.  This is a cold-climate city which has beautiful natural landscapes to visit.  It is the third most important city in the country and was named a World Heritage Site in 1999.  Its people are all very kind and friendly.

Diana C. is receiving her first loan through the community bank.  She was invited to join by a friend who is an active member of the bank.

Diana is 19 years old and single.  She lives in her grandparents' home and helps them out financially.  She studied for two years in a sewing academy and she has been carrying out her profession for one year.  She works from Monday to Friday, from 8.00am to 6.00pm, in a factory where they make jeans.

Diana will use her loan to buy food for her household.  Her goal is to own a dressmaking workshop so that she can make her own products.

loans.use: to buy food

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann Z. is from the city of Pantaon Ozamiz City. She is 25 years old. Mary Ann is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Ann owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Mary Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be Mary Ann's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her vegetable farm

loans.name: Naya

texts.es:
Naya forma parte del banco comunal “Belén” perteneciente a la ciudad de Valparaíso. 
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio ambulante, vendiendo ropa para adultos y niños. Específicamente ropa de polar (tela abrigadora), su mercadería la compra de acuerdo a la temporada del año o alguna festividad, como por ejemplo, en verano vende poleras, jockey, bolsos para dama. Y durante las festividades, día de la madre; chocolates, artículos para dama, día del padre; artículos para varón, día del niño; juguetes y en navidad de todo tipo de artículos para regalo. Esta mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Santiago, ya que existe mayor variedad de productos y además Naya invierte en productos de buena calidad, para mantener su clientela.
Naya trabaja de lunes a domingo en jornada completa en un puesto que acomoda en la calle. Ella se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 30 años. 
Con el préstamo comprará calzas, camisetas, calcetas y poleras de polar, para dama, varón y niño. Ya que es lo que más se vende durante la temporada de invierno. 
Sus metas son instalar su negocio en un local establecido, ya que es muy sacrificado trabajar en la calle durante los meses correspondientes a la temporada de verano e invierno, debido al calor o frío. Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio son debido al sustento económico que le brinda a su familia.
Naya vive junto a su marido e hija de 9 años de edad, actualmente ésta familia está enfrentando una situación de mucho dolor, ya que el hijo mayor de Naya falleció hace 6 meses atrás, debido a un asalto que sufrió.
Su sueño es brindarle una educación de calidad a su hija y verla desempañarse como profesional. 
Naya está muy agradecida del crédito y apoyo que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para emprender en su negocio. Respecto a las reuniones, éstas son muy gratas y además forma parte de la directiva del grupo, ya que es secretaría de éste.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
Naya belongs to the “Bethlehem” cooperative bank, located in the city of Valparaíso.

She dedicates herself to working as a street merchant, selling clothing for adults and children.  She buys her products based on the time of year, or for an upcoming holiday.  For example, in the summer she sells t-shirts and handbags.  She also focuses on certain holidays: for Mother’s Day, she buys chocolates and women’s accessories; for Father’s Day, she buys men’s products; for birthdays, she buys toys; for Christmas, she buys all types of items to give as gifts.  

She buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago, since she can obtain a greater variety of products there.  Also, Naya likes to buy high-quality merchandise in order to keep her customers.  Naya works Monday to Sunday from a location she has on the street.  She has dedicated herself to this business for 30 years.

She will use the loan to buy socks, t-shirts, knitwear, and fleece for men, women and children, as these are the items she sells the most of during the winter season.  Her goal is to move her business to an established site, as it is difficult to work on the street during summer and winter because of the hot and cold temperatures.  Her motivation to continue working is her desire to help support her family.

Naya lives with her husband and 9-year old daughter.  This family is currently going through a very painful time, due to the passing of Naya’s oldest son 6 months ago.  Her dream is to provide a quality education for her daughter, and see her become a career professional.  Naya is very thankful for access to credit and the support provided by Fondo Esperanza for carrying on with her enterprise.  She finds the group’s meetings to be very pleasant, and serves as the Secretary of the management board.  

Valparaíso is located 120 km northeast of Santiago.  It is the regional capital, and also the seat of legislative power of the country.  It is the first port in the nation, and offers a great variety of beautiful and picturesque areas such as the house of the poet Pablo Neruda, winner of the Nobel Prize.

loans.use: buy hose, t-shirts, socks and fleece items for women, men and children.

loans.name: Kankeletigui 4 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KANKELETIGUI 4 est une Association  de  10 femmes  toutes mariées du village de Dembela dans le cercle de NIENA région de SIKASSO troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali.  Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et au moins 4 enfants. Elles exercent la culture d’arachide, des pois sucré, pois de terre de riz et de mil.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour payer des frais de labours, acheter  une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, de riz des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de Dembela et de Nina ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de NIENA et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
SAFOURA  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 1 sac d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30.000 à 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Kankeletigui 4 group is made up of ten women, all married, from the village of Dembela, in the district of Niena, Sikasso region, in the third administrative district of the Republic of Mali. They live in large traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc. On average, they are 35 years old with 4 children. 

 The women grow ground nuts, sugar peas, bambara peas, rice and millet. With the goal of increasing profitability, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program . The current loan will be used to pay labor costs, to buy enough ground nut seeds and rice, small equipment and intrants for cultivating, at the Dembela Grnad Market and the Niena town market. After the rainy season, crops are stored for a certain amount of time to increase in value before being sold and the Niena Grand Market and in the nearby markets, on a  retail (sometimes wholesale) basis, for cash to customers who are mostly from the large towns. 

Safoura plans to use her loan to buy one sack of urea, two sacks of complex cereal and the rest sill be used for labor and hoeing costs. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 - 40,000 CFA francs which will be used to pay interest  on the loan to to pay for the family's everyday expenses.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural intrants and labor costs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Planting bananas can be pursued as small-scale farming, as a source of food and feeds for the animals, and as additional income for the family. For the past two years, Teresita, a 45-year-old married mother of seven children in Tinacla-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, has been involved in banana production as a source of income. Earning approximately PHP 4,000.00 each month, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.00 from GDMPC to buy planting materials and fertilizer for banana production.

Teresita, a new member of GDMPC, dreams of someday having a banana plantation with the help of God and GDMPC.

loans.use: to buy planting materials and fertilizer for banana production.

loans.name: Naom

texts.en:
Naom is a resident farmer in the Nyamira area of South Rift, Kenya. She is married with three children, ages 9, 5 and 1 year old. She has been farming for 10 years producing and selling maize, vegetables, bananas and tea for the local market. She gets additional income from her rental houses.

Naom has obtained a loan of 46,800 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the dairy cow will provide the family with milk and additional income. She says she wants to own three quality dairy cows in five years. Naom says farming inputs have become expensive and this is the main challenge for farmers in the area. However, she thanks Juhudi Kilimo for their services.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana de 26 años, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, vive en su propia casa al lado de su esposo Amancio 28 años y sus 02 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindarles una buena educación para que en un futuro próximo sean hombres de gran provecho. Juana es una mujer de ardua labor, se esmera a diario por entregar lo mejor a su familia. Ella se dedica al trabajo del agro donde siembra cacao y café; viene realizando esta actividad desde hace 07 años. Y gracias a los frutos que le brinda sus plantas, ella compró variedad de muebles para su hogar y a la vez compró su propia maquina fumigadora para el control de la plaga de insectos. En tiempo de cosecha y deshierbo de maleza, obligadamente contrata jornaleros para poder avanzar con mayor celeridad en cuanto a su faena programada. Ella cuenta con espacios de tierra sin cultivar, lo cual inevitablemente necesita el apoyo de todos ustedes para llevar consigo su propósito, tiene proyectado sembrar sus fincas con más plantas de café. Para el bien de su trabajo, espera contar con la misma fuerza e ímpetu que la caracteriza para sacar adelante  sus sembríos y a sus adorados hijos. Este será su segundo crédito, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para concretar sus planes y por ende comprometerse a devolver  puntualmente los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más semillas de café para que pueda aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Juana is 26 years old, a native of Quimbiri city, and lives in her own house alongside her husband Amancio, who is 26, and 2 dear sons, for whom she wishes to provide a good education that will benefit them in the future.

Juana is a hard-working woman, who strives every day to provide the best for her family. She works in agriculture, sowing chocolate and coffee. She has been doing this for the last 7 years. And thanks to the fruits offered by her plants, she has bought a variety of furniture for her home and, at the same time, purchased her own fumigating machine to control plagues of insects.

At harvest time, and during weeding, she hires day laborers to advance more rapidly in her crop routine. She has land that is not as yet cultivated, and this requires the help of all of you to carry out her proposal, to sow more coffee plants on the vacant land.

For the good of the project, Juana hopes she can count on that same force and impetus which has characterized her past efforts to forge ahead with both her plantings and her adored children's welfare.

This will be her 2nd loan, and she hopes for the help of each of you to realize her plans, promising to make her payments punctually. With this loan, Juana will buy more coffee seeds so that she can increase production.

loans.use: buy coffee seeds to plant on her available land.

loans.name: Zainab A.

texts.en: This is 34-year-old Zainab.  She is married and has three children aged 5, 14 and 18 years. All of them are school-going children. She has three additional dependents who live with her because they are her brother's children. She takes cares of them like her own children. In 2007, Zainab established her ready-made ladies and gents wear business. She began her business because she wanted to be self-reliant and able to provide a livelihood for her family. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000.  Zainab  has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan to buy jeans - 3 doz @ Le35,000, Snickers - 10 doz @ Le35,000, Office shirts - 10 doz @ Le37,000, Ladies Bags 8 - doz @ Le35,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000.  In the future, Zainab plans to import and open another business center so that she can employ more people and  give her children a quality education for them to be very good citizens. She treats the customers she serves in the entire Makeni town as special.  A reasonable amount of people visit her shop every day because she has good products. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more ladies and gents wear to sell

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro de 36 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, sus hijos viven independientemente, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicado en el distrito de San José que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

La actividad que desarrolla Alejandro  es brindar el servicio de transporte público, ya que cuenta con su propia mototaxi, la cual lo trabaja mañana y tarde movilizando personas que viven en San José y también a los distintos caseríos de la zona, cuenta con su propia clientela y con los ingresos que obtenga puede cubrir sus gastos de su casa.

Ha solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para brindarle mantenimiento a su mototaxi y seguir brindando un buen servicio.  Alejandro es una persona muy conocida en el lugar donde vive porque siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de los suyos, con el fin que en un futuro pueda brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 36 years old and lives in his own home with his family. His children live independently. Alejandro receives all basic services. He resides in the District of San José, which is part of the Department of Lambayeque. This area has businesses that involve agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

Alejandro has a business providing public transportation services with his own motorcycle taxi. He works in the mornings and the afternoons, driving around people who live in San José. Alejandro also travels to different villages in the area. He has his own customer base and the income he earns is used to cover his household expenses.

Alejandro is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN in order to maintain his motorcycle taxi so that he can continue providing good service. He is a person who is well-known in the place where he lives because he is always concerned about the welfare of his family. His goal for the future is to provide them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Uganda. She is single and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (a brother).

Sarah has a business of selling second hand clothes. She has been in this business for 4 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Sarah sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Sarah has requested for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used clothes.  

The main business challenge(s) for Sarah include thieves during transportation of her goods and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell on wholesale only and also to build rental rooms.

Sarah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity, but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Benkadi  C Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres que constituent le groupe BENKADI C sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à MAARO, un village situé à environ 45 km de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième cycle prêt avec l’institution. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le riz et l’arachide  avec Madame AFOU  assise au milieu.
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et des semences pour entretenir : 0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village à LOUTANA et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25.000 FCFA  en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
BENKADI C is a group made up of 10 married women with an average age of 32 and who have, on average, 3 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in a village called Maaro, which is located about 45 kms from the town of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
The group joined the loan program of the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This will be their 5th loan cycle with the institution. Their previous loans have all been fully repaid.
Afou (sitting, in the middle of the picture) grows rice and groudnuts. She will use her part of the loan to buy the farm inputs and seeds she needs for her 0.5 hectare of farmland, and pay the labourers. The harvest will be sold in the village of Loutana and at the market of Sikasso. By the end of the season she should have made a profit of around 25 000 FCFA, with which she plans to pay back her loan and help her husband with the daily household expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She operates a mat weaving business, selling at the market and from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future.

With her KES 15,000 loan, Fatuma wants to purchase blocks and cement to renovate her house. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase blocks and cement to renovate her house.

loans.name: Cenelia

texts.es:
A sus 59 años D. edad Cenelia es una luchadora incansable, dedicada a la venta D. comidas fritas, D. gaseosas, tinto y café, labor que desempeña diariamente D. 5:00 a.m. 8:00 p.m. pues en este horario hay buenas ventas y ha tenido la ventaja D. tener una buena ubicación en el sector.
Cenelia actualmente debe comprar insumos para la producción D. alimentos, como gaseosas, café, azúcar, maíz, harina, y papas, por lo que hoy solicita un préstamo, con el cual hacer esta inversión, mejorar las ventas, y proporcionalmente su calidad D. vida.
texts.en: At 59 years of age, Cenelia is a tireless and tenacious woman.  Her business is selling fried food, soda and coffee.  She carries out this work every day from 5.00am to 8.00pm as this is when she makes good sales.  She has the advantage of being in a good location in the neighborhood.  Cenelia currently needs to buy supplies for making her food.  She will buy soda, coffee, sugar, corn, flour and potatoes.  She is requesting a loan in order to make this investment, improve her sales and, proportionally, her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making food

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия занимается откормом скота на протяжении 10 лет. На воспитании имеет одного ребенка. Занятие бизнесом помогает ей в содержании семьи. Откорм скота приносит хорошие доходы. Зулфия просит займ для покупки крупного и мелкого рогатого скота для того чтобы расширить свой бизнес и получить максимальный прибыль. Она заранее благодарна всем вам за вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Zulfiya feeds cattle for the last ten years. She is raising one child. This business helps her to support her family. Feeding of the cattle gives her good income. Zulfiya is asking for a loan to buy large and small horned cattle to expand her business and receive maximum profit. She is thankful in advance to everyone for help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Kambizi

texts.en:
Kambizi is a married woman, raising one young child. For the past two years, Kambizi has run a shop and hotel business, in addition to a side job as a farmer. Her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. She describes her greatest business challenge to be transportation and her highest monthly expense is school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Kambizi will use her loan of KES 60,000 to purchase essential business supplies such as cooking oil and groceries. Kambizi aspires to purchase a posho mill for grinding grain into flour and to open another business. She joined Yehu to access working capital.

loans.use: To purchase essential business supplies such as cooking oil and groceries.

loans.name: Akylbek

texts.ru:
Акылбек 36-летний фермер, живущий в со своей семьей с двумя сыновьями семи и пяти лет в селе Ой- Тал (северо-восточная часть Кыргызстана). В поисках источника дохода, в 1996 года Акылбек начал свой бизнес в разведении скота, выращивании и перепродаже сельхоз продукции.  На участке Акылбека имеются яблони и грушевые деревья, а также особое внимание он уделяет культивированию и выращиванию особого сорта картофеля, пользующегося повышенным спросом у местного населения. Упорный и неустанный труд в бизнесе позволяет Акылбеку покрывать расходы своей семьи и хозяйства, а  также  планировать  будущее для своих детей.
Для дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Акылбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) для закупа дополнительного поголовья скота для откорма. Планируемую прибыль Акылбек намерен использовать для закупа кормов и сена на зиму, чтобы весной начать перепродажу скота.
texts.en: Akylbek is a 36 year-old farmer, living with his family and two sons, who are seven and five years old, in the the Oi-Tal village (north-eastern part of Kyrgyzstan).  In search of a source of income, Akylbek started his own business of breeding livestock, growing and reselling agricultural crops in 1996.  Akylbek has apple and pear trees on his plot of land and also devotes special attention to cultivating and growing a particular variety of potatoes that is in higher demand among the local residents.  His persistent and tireless labor in the business allows Akylbek to cover his family's and household expenses and also to plan his children's future.  In order to further increase his livestock quantity, Akylbek requested a loan in the sum of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy additional livestock headcount for fattening up.  He plans to use the planned profit for the purchase of fodder and hay for the winter, so that he can start reselling livestock in the spring.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Jacklyne

texts.en: Jacklyne is a hardworking business woman aged 29. She is married and blessed with one child. She has been operating a business selling clothes for the past two years to support her family. She also runs a cereal shop to supplement her income. She has employed one person to help her in the business. Jacklyne has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to add to her stock of clothes for resale. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth Maria

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth a sus 31 años de edad es madre de tres hijos de 9, 6 y 4 años. La señora Elizabeth se dedica al arreglo de uñas de las manos y los pies (manicure y pedicure) desde hace tres años con el fin de poder cuidar a su familia y percibir sus propios ingresos. La señora Elizabeth desea comprar herramientas de trabajo como esmaltes para uñas, accesorios, moldes, cortaúñas, limas y cremas corporales, lo anterior con el fin de tener las herramientas de trabajo para suplir la demanda de la temporada de fin de año y a la vez mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  A futuro la señora Elizabeth desea tener su propio local.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 31, has three children; ages 9, 6, and 4.  Elizabeth has been doing fingernails and toenails (manicures and pedicures) for three years.  She does this to be able to take care of her family and to get her own income.

Elizabeth wants to buy work materials like nail polish, accessories, molds, nail clippers, files and body creams.  She wants these items so that she has the work tools in order to meet the demand in the end of the year season.  She also wants to improve her family’s quality of life.

In the future Elizabeth wishes to have her own place.

loans.use: to buy work materials like nail polish, accessories, molds, nail clippers, files and body creams.

loans.name: Oisara

texts.ru: Ойсара занимается купле- продажей скота и выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Она замужем и любящая мать четверых детей. Её семья помогает ей в бизнесе. Они стараются улучшить жизненные условия и создать уют и удобства в своем доме. Ойсара хочет расширить свой бизнес и купить 3 голов крупного рогатого скота и посеять пшеницу и ячмень. С этой целью она просит о помощи, которая позволит ей продвигаться вперед.
texts.en: Oisara raises cattle for meat and also farms. She is married and a loving mother of four children. Her family helps her with her work. Oisara's family is working hard to improve their living conditions and to create a cozy and comfortable home. Oisara wants to expand her herd and plans to purchase three more calves as well as plant more wheat and oats. For this reason she has turned to KIVA for help as this will helps her to move her business forward.

loans.use: To buy cattle and seeds

loans.name: Mayra Johanna

texts.es:
